This is Jenes' first loan from KADET. She plans to use the money to purchase more mobile phone accessories. With the anticipated profit she hopes to open up another business and 
to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Felix Angel

texts.es: Félix Ángel se dedica a vender carne y junto a su esposa, reside en la comunidad de telica. Félix se dedica a este negocio desde hace 9 años y lo aprendió como una forma de vida. Actualmente vende este producto que es muy solicitada por sus clientes pues es muy importante para el consumo diario.  Una de las dificultades que enfrenta es que no ha podido suplir la demanda de sus clientes. El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar capital de trabajo carne. Es su primer crédito y espera cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Félix Ángel sells meat.  He lives with his wife in the Telica community.  Félix has been in this business for nine years.  He learned it as a way of life.  The meat that he now sells is in much demand by his customers.  Daily consumption makes it very important.

One of the difficulties that he faces is that he has not been able to meet the demand of his customers.  He needs the requested loan as working capital for meat.  This is his first loan, and he plans to make his payments on time.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en:
Jumagul K. is a married mother of two children. She sells socks at an open market in Tursunzade city. The very good location of her vending place brings many clients her way. Her business does well. Jumagul has been in this business for 25 years, ever since she saw that socks were one of the few products that sell well and produces a stable income. Jumagul would like a loan of $1500 USD to add an assortment of winter goods. She would spend additional income to improve her living conditions. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new goods in order to increase the assortment of products for sale.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty B. is from the village of Poblacion 3 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Letty is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Letty owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Letty has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Letty joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Letty is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Letty from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 27 años, está casada con Rudy, de 28 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Jack, de 9 y Anahi, de 3 años. Los tres como una gran familia, viven en su casa de su mamá, ubicada en la localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Las labores de Margarita son múltiples, ya tiene 10 años dedicándose a la “cajonería” (lugar donde se hacen cajones de madera, que se utilizan para vender frutas), en todo este tiempo pudo juntar un capital de dinero necesario para poder abrir un restaurante de anticuchos, los que en todo este tiempo, tiene gran acogida. Como mujer joven y trabajadora Margarita, tuvo una buena idea y ahora no solo vende anticuchos, también hamburguesas y pollo crocante. Pero, las ganas de luchar de está mujer son increíbles, ya que hace tan solo 2 años que incursionó en la agricultura, donde siembra plátano y café. Ahora ella quiere comprar terrenos agrícolas, pero sin descuidarse de su negocio. Para ello ella tiene pensado comprar una casa propia, donde pueda decorar su restaurante de manera más llamativa. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y, se siente feliz de regresar a su banco comunal, donde siente que cada día progresa más. De adquirir el dinero solicitado tiene pensado comprar bebidas y dulces, para surtir su restaurante de anticuchos (comida a base de corazón de pollo), como también si el dinero le alcanza, comprará un parrillero de fierro, para poder cocinar sus ricos platos.
texts.en:
Margarita is 27 years old, and is married to Rudy, who is 28 years old. They have two children: Jack, 9, and Anahi, 3. Like a big family, they all live in her mom's house in the Puente Paucartambo community, which is in the central region of the peruvian rainforest. For 10 years, Margarita has worked making wooden boxes in which fruit is sold. In this time, she has been able to collect enough money to open a kebab restaurant which was very well received. As a young and hardworking women, Margarita had a great idea and now not only sells kebabs but also hamburgers and crispy chicken.

Her drive is incredible and only two years ago, she invested in agriculture, where she plants plantains and coffee. Now she wants to buy more farmland, but without neglecting her business. To do this, she wants to buy her own home, where she can decorate her restaurant in a more striking way.

This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is happy to return to her community bank, where she feels that every day she progresses more. She plans to use this loan to purchase sweets and drinks and to supply her kebab restaurant and if she has funds leftover, she will buy a grill so she can cook her rich dishes.

loans.use: Purchase drinks, sweets, and a grill for her restaurant

loans.name: Americo

texts.pt:
Américo B. nasceu na Província de Nampula norte de Moçambique tem 42 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, é pai de 4 filhos de 5, 8, 14 e 15 anos, todos vão a escola. Fez a 8ª classe não continuou devido ao trabalho que não o facilitava. Vive na casa própria com sua familia, não responsabiliza se por ninguém.

Américo sai de Nampula para Alemanha num curso de 10 anos financiado pelo Estado, e quando fazia o sétimo ano o estado interrope o curso alegando que fundo desponibilizado ja havia esgotado e manda os de volta a Moçambique, ele consegue arranjar um emprego numa Quinta onde trabalha a mais de 15 anos auferindo 3.000.00mt como guarda. E ainda proprietário de um estabelecimento na sua residência e criador de frangos de corte. Conta com ajuda da sua esposa consegue no seu negocio um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da sua casa, dos negócios e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e Kiva no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos, ração e vitaminas para criação de frangos de corte. O anterior de 15.000.00mt foi para a mesma finalidade.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto porque conta com a receita do seu estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Américo B. was born in Nampula, Northern Mozambique. He's 42 years old, married and the father of 4 children ages 5, 8, 14 and 15, all attending school. He lives with his family in a house they own.

When he was younger Américo left Nampula to go study in Germany. When the 10 year state-funded course he was enrolled in was interrupted in the 7th year, due to budget problems, he was sent back to Mozambique, where he found a job as a security guard at a private home. He's been working there for the past 15 years, currently earning a salary of 3.000.00 mt. He also runs a small grocery store from home and raises poultry to sell. With the help of his wife, their business make 10.000.00mt per month, which allows them to pay for household and business expenses as well as save some money in the bank.

This is Américo's second loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. He will use the 25.000.00mt to buy baby chicks, feed and vitamins for his poultry business. He used his previous loan in the same manner.

He's confident that he'll be able to pay back his loan ahead of schedule, since he can count on the profits from his other business.

loans.use: to buy baby chicks, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal Natshe is a young man from Hebron city. He is married and a father of four sons who are all in school. Nidal came to FATEN for a loan to fix his house's infrastructure, including the water and electricity networks. 

Winter is near and his house needs maintenance so he decided to perform it this month before rainy and windy weather attacks the region. Hebron is a cold city where it rains and snows heavily.

Nidal Natshe appears in the picture above in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To perform house and infrastructure maintenance on his home

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice M. is 48 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. Beatrice has a boutique business, which she has run for less than a year.
To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Beatrice hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Beatrice hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Halimah

texts.en:
Halimah is a married woman with seven children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past six years, selling from home to her neighbours. In addition she also sells firewood makes up her other source of income. Halimah faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season the availability of products for sale is low. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu because it has not too many legal requirements.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Doña Vicenta, tiene 39 años de edad, reside en San Isidro, departamento de Morazán, administra un cafetín, su familia la conforman: su esposo, tres hijas de 18, 15 y 8 años de edad.
Doña Vicenta se dedica al cafetín hace 9 años, lo tiene ubicado en su propia casa, ofrece comida, bebidas, panes, entre otros alimentos, sus clientes son vecinos y amigos cercanos, estudiantes que circulan por el lugar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar pan, carnes, café, azúcar, arroz y condimentos, entre otros que tienen demanda como las sodas, jugos. Este préstamo le ayudara a mantenerse estable en el negocio, vera la oportunidad de producir más y tener mejores ventas.
Su sueño es en un futuro ampliar su vivienda, para que su familia se sienta más cómoda, también quiere crecer con el negocio para tener un ingreso constante para ayudar a sus hijas a realizarse como profesionales.
texts.en:
Doña vicenta is 39 years old and lives in San Isidro in the department of Morazán.  She runs a small coffee stand. She has a husband and three daughters, ages 18, 15 and 8.  Doña Vicente has been running her stand for 9 years out of her own home.  She sells food, drinks, bread and other food items.  Her customers are her neighbors and close friends and the students who pass through the location.

She is requesting a loan to buy bread, meat, coffee, sugar, rice and condiments and other items on demand such as sodas and juices.  This loan will help her keep her business running smoothly, allowing her to produce and sell more.  Her dream is to expand her house so her family can live more comfortably.  She also wants to grow her business to have a stable income to help her daughters become professional workers.

loans.use: To buy bread, meat, coffee, sugar, rice and condiments

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 58-year-old married man with eight children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Charles has been in the limestone business for 45 years, starting out by selling substandard limestone and now selling the fine one. His hardship is the difficulty of working in the rainy season. Charles' dream is to diversify into selling charcoal and firewood. Charles needs this loan to buy charcoal and firewood to resell.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and firewood to resell

loans.name: Edith Audelia

texts.es:
Doña Edith, tiene 45 años D. edad, resiD. en El Transito departamento D. San Miguel, vive con su esposo y dos hijos D. 10 y 7 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. ropa, este negocio inicio D. forma ambulante y con la ayuda D. una amiga, logro instalarse en un puesto fijo en el mercado municipal D. El Transito, su horario D. ventas en D. 7:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio comprando ropa D. moda y que es solicitada por los clientes, este préstamo le ayudara para fortalecer y crecer con su puesto D. venta, generándole más competitividad frente a los demás.
Doña Edith aspira para un futuro tener un negocio auto sostenible capaz D. atender la demanda y mantener un buen número D. clientes, que su familia cuente con mayores beneficios y que sus hijos tengan lo necesario para desarrollarse.
texts.en: Edith is 45 years old, she lives in El Transito, a department of San Miguel.  She lives with her husband and two children of 10 and 7 years of age.  She sells clothes, a business that got its start in ambulant form. With the help of a friend, she was able to obtain a fixed location at the municpal market in El Transito.  Her hours of business are from 7AM to 5PM.  She is soliciting a loan to invest in the business by purchasing fashionable clothing that is in demand with clients.  This loan will help her fortify and grow her shop, creating a competitive edge amongst the rest.  Edith aspires for a future having a self-sustainable business capable of meeting the demand and maintaining a good number of clients, that her family can count on benefits, and that her children have enough to grow.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to stock her business.

loans.name: Sandy

texts.es: Sandy, es natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, tiene 21 años de edad, es una señora muy alegre y trabajadora, convive con Emiliano de 26 años y fruto de esa relación hoy tienen 02 hijos y  juntos viven en su propia casa, situado en la comunidad de Ivankiriari caserío del distrito de Quimbiri. Desde muy pequeña Sandy aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Ella siembra plantas de cacao, café y plantaciones de hojas de coca; las cuales lleva a vender  sus productos a los centros de acopio ubicados en los distritos de San Francisco y Quimbiri. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que los meses de su arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos por el cual recibe buenos pagos por sus granos de café, cacao y hojas de coca. Lleva 04 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas quienes se encargan de  dañar sin piedad a las mazorcas. El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de semillas de café y cacao. Su meta a futuro es comprarse nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es su primer crédito de Sandy con MFP, esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará semillas de cacao y café para luego poblar sus campos.
texts.en:
Sandy is from the city of Quimbiri. She is a 21 year old happy and hard working woman. She lives with her common-law partner, Emiliano, who is 26 years old. They have two children and live in their own house located in the community of Ivankiriari, village of the District of Quimbiri.

Her parents showed her how to work in the plantation from a young age. They taught her everything necessary to obtain good crops. She now has her own land which she tills with love and patience. She sells her products to the warehouses in the Districts of San Francisco and Quimbiri. What she likes the best about her work is the harvest because she sees the results of months of hard work by obtaining high quality coffee and cocoa grains and coca leaves. These crops bring in good income. She has been doing this work for four years and feels that the most difficult part is protecting the crops from pests.

She plans to buy coffee and cocoa seeds. One of her future goals is to buy more land to increase her plantation. This is Sandy’s first loan from MFP and she is committed to paying it back in a timely manner since she hopes to obtain another loan in the near future. The loan of 1.500 Nuevos Soles will be used to buy and plant seeds for her plantation.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and coffee seeds.

loans.name: Zonia Aida

texts.es:
Doña Zonia, tiene 56 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y antojitos, vive en compañía de un nieto que tiene 11 años de edad.
El negocio  de ella inicio hace 10 años, vendiendo tortillas y antojitos, este negocio surge por la necesidad de disponer de dinero, su horario es de 8:00am a 4:00pm, de lunes a domingo.

Actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de leña y maíz, esta compra es debido al incremento del costo del maíz, por que lo ella piensa comprar para tener la disponibilidad por un periodo.

Su plan es que con esta inversión, tenga lo necesario para producir y tener mejores ganancias, cancelando esta deuda y cubriendo las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Zonia is 56 years old and she lives in the city of San Miguel. She sells tortillas and snacks. She lives with her grandson who is 11 years old. She started her business 10 years ago, selling tortillas and snacks. The business emerged out of a need to have an income. Her work schedule is from 8am to 4pm from Monday to Sunday. 

She requests a loan to purchase firewood and corn. This purchase is needed for the increase in price of corn. She wants to buy it to have it available for some time. 

Her plan for this investment is to have what she needs to keep her business productive and to have better earnings, to pay off this loan, and to provide for the needs of the household.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and corn

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo O. C. habita en casa pastoral de la Iglesia con su esposa y tres hijos. Ubicado en el Municipio de San Juan Opico del Departamento de La Libertad.  Vive en condiciones muy humildes y cada día lucha por mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Arturo se dedica  a la venta de vitaminas en diferentes zonas del municipio de Opico del Departamento de La Libertad. Tiene buena clientela y sus productos los vende con facilidad. Su deseo es ampliar la oferta de productos para sus clientes, pero no cuenta con los recursos económicos para hacerlo es por ello que solicita a INTEGRAL este crédito para poder comprar variedad de productos como: variedad de vitaminas, pastillas para los paracitos, pomadas para la piel, pomadas para los hongos y de mas medicamentos de salud que son atractivos para los clientes.  Con esto espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia que cada día le exigen más.
texts.en:
Arturo O. C. lives at a church parsonage with his wife and three children in the town of San Juan Opico in the Department of La Libertad. His home has very modest conditions and he struggles each day to improve the quality of life of his family.

Arturo sells vitamins in different areas of the town of Opico in the Department of Libertad. He has a good customer base and his products sell easily. His wish is to expand the array of products that he offers to his customers, but he does not have the financial resources to make this happen. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can buy a variety of products such as an assortment of vitamins, pills for combating parasites, skin creams, antifungal ointments, and other medicines that are popular with his customers. By acquiring these products, Arturo hopes to improve his quality of life and that of his family so that they can continue to survive on a daily basis.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of vitamins, pills for combating parasites, skin creams, antifungal ointments, and other medicines.

location.town: Opico en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Sop Serigne Touba Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Touba est composé de 23 femmes. Elles habitent le même quartier. Le groupe est créé le 9 avril 2011, jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de Ndieng D..

Soda N., la responsable du groupe, est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants en charge. Elle est debout à l'extrême droite sur la photo et est emmitouflée d'une écharpe blanche.

Elle fait une activité de petit commerce d'huile d'arachide et de niébé (haricot local)Elle maitrise cette activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plus de dix ans.

Son prêt lui permettra de financer son activité de petit commerce afin prétendre à plus de revenus.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de besoins familiaux
texts.en:
The Sop Serigne Touba solidarity group is composed of 23 women. They all live in the same neighborhood. The group was created April 9th, 2011 - the same day the Ndieng D. "Banc Villageois" (loan group) was inaugurated.

Soda N., the group's leader, is 49 years old. She is married and the mother of eight dependent children. She is all the way to the right on the picture, and is wrapped in a white scarf.

She is active in the retail of peanut oil and niebe (a local bean). She has mastered this activity as a result of over ten years of experience.

Her loan will allow her to finance her retail activity to strive for greater income.

Her objective is to support her husband in providing for the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase food products for resale

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel has been selling second-hand clothes in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 63 years old, married to Lucy, and they have two school-going children.

Samwel was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more used clothing to resell.  His target customers are low income earners.

In the future, Samwel hopes to grow his business and move to a more permanent place.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Nadiegueton 4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nadiegueton 4 est constitué de cinq hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 3  enfants et vivant  dans des  familles polygames à Flazambougou un des villages de la commune de Sikasso et situé à environ 12 km de Sikasso ville, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien  remboursé.
La spéculation  principale cultivée est le maïs.  
AGUIBOU,  compte acheter, avec son prêt, des 200 kg d’engrais, 4 bidons d’herbicides ,  les petits matériels et payer les frais de désherbage d’ entretiens . 
La production est vendue après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au niveau du village, au marché  de Sikasso . 
AGUIBOU compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100. 000FCFA par campagne. Son bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et  de réaliser les évènements sociaux de la famille.
Il souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et son partenaire KIVA afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The Nadiegueton 4 group is composed of five married men, averaging 40 years of age, with three children and living in polygamous families in Flazambougou, a village in the Skiasso community, about 12 km from the town of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the winter season. They are on their third loan with the institution. The past loan has been well repaid. The main produce is corn.

Aguibou pland to use his loan to buy 200 kg of fertilizers, four jugs of herbicides, tools and pay for the cost of weeding labor. After harvesting, the produce is sold to men and women from their village and at the Sikasso market.

Aguibou plans to achieve a monthly income of 100,000 West African francs per agricultural cycle. His income will allow him to pay off his loan and cover the cost of big family events. 

He would like to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso and its partner Kiva in order to cultivate a larger land plot and be able to  increase his income.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural inputs, small tools and cost of manual labor

loans.name: Jonard

texts.en:
Jonard is 21 years-old and lives in the Philippines. He is unmarried.

Jonard has a shop that sells green bananas. He has had this business for a year. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additonal green bananas to sell.

Jonard is a new member of Kiva partner HSPFI.  In the future, Jonard hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additonal green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Furkat

texts.en:
Furkat has been running a business processing dried fruit for 13 years. He is a hardworking man and he tries to process his fruits carefully. As a result, he can make a high quality dried fruit. Furkat purchases 15,000-16,000 kg of fresh fruits and after processing, he gets 3500-4000 kg dried fruits and 1600 kg ossicle. From the profit that he made, he bought a car. Currently, Furkat would like a loan of 4,000 TJS for purchasing fresh fruits for processing in order to expand his business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy fresh fruit to process and sell

loans.name: Acencion Felipe

texts.es: Acencion Felipe vive en el reparto Ronal, administra su negocio que es una pulpería. En donde la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar los diferentes productos que ofrece. Tiene más de 13 años en este negocio, el trabaja con proveedores, quienes le llevan la mercadería para el negocio, trabaja todos los días de la semana. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar granos básicos, golosinas, sal, fósforos, papel higiénico, sopas y enlatados esto le ayudara a tener mucho más clientes. El sueño de es lograr que su pulpería siga creciendo.
texts.en: Acencion Felipe lives in Reparto Ronal, where he runs his own corner shop which is attended by many customers coming to his place to buy the different products he sells. He has been running his shop for more than 13 years. He works every day of the week, and his suppliers bring to him the products for the shop. He is currently asking for a loan to buy basic grains, candies, salt, matches, toilet paper, soups and canned food. This will help him gaining more customers. He wishes that his corner shop activity will keep on growing.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, candies, salt, matches, toilet paper, soups and canned food.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 48, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, convive con Eusebia de 49 años de edad y fruto de ello tienen 04 hijos por quienes velan por brindarle una buena educación. Juan se esmera por dar lo mejor a los miembros de su familia, por la cual trabaja arduamente sus tierras cultivados con plantas de cacao, café y plátanos, poseyendo en total con 03 hectáreas de terreno y es conocedor del arduo trabajo que se realiza en el campo, donde viene trabajando 24 años en sus propias tierras. Juan en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de cosechar y trasladar los productos recolectados hasta cierto tramo para luego ser transportados con vehículos motorizados. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo, porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas se estén desarrollando, así obteniendo buenas ganancias, cuenta que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque son meses donde abundan mayor cantidad de insectos perjudicando a sus sembríos. Con el crédito solicitado comprará fungicidas naturales y sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras y posteriormente volverlas productivas. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo  para poder cumplir sus objetivos y por lo cual esta llano en cumplir con el pago de su préstamo puntualmente. Con el monto solicitado comprará, variedad de abonos naturales como guano de isla, estiércol de animales y entre otros.
texts.en:
Juan, 48, is from the city of Quimbiri.  He lives with Eusebia, 49, and their four children that they care for and provide a good education for.  Juan strives to provide the best for his family members; he works hard for them in his fields planted with cocoa beans, coffee and bananas.  He has a total of 3 hectares and is well aware of the hard work that farming is.  He’s been in this line of work for 24 years on land of his own.  During harvests his children help him and he hires day workers to harvest and transport the crops a certain distance where they are picked up to be transported further on motorized vehicles.

He feels very committed to his work because thanks to his daily effort he can now enjoy seeing his plants developing and he is obtaining good profits.  He comments that winter isn’t much to his liking because those are months when the populations of insects grow the most and they damage crops.

He will use the requested loan to buy natural fungicides and sacks of manure to fertilize his lands and make them productive.

This is his 2nd MFP loan so he’s hoping for a small loan to reach his objectives and he is naturally most disposed to repay his loan punctually.  He will use the requested amount to buy a variety of natural manures, like guano from the islands and animal manure, among others.

loans.use: to buy island bird guano and animal manure.

loans.name: Elicia Esther

texts.es: Elicia  es una mujer brillante, que siempre permanece trabajando en todo lo que sabe hacer:  elL. es confeccionista, y ofrece servicio D. reparación y costura D. ropa, es  manicurista y ofrece este servicio a domicilio o en su casa, y es una gran comerciante a L. vez pues tiene un mercado a quienes venD. mercancías como ropa, accesorios femeninos masculinos, perfumes, cosméticos, mediante crédito y planeado en cuotas pactadas con sus clientes. Elicia en condición D. mujer jefe D. hogar y con dos hijos en las edades D. 1 y 19 años, se las ha arreglado para tomar las riendas D. su hogar y genera ingresos y oportunidades D. estudios para su hija que ya está en L. universidad y estudia una carrera. DesD. hace 8 años está ejerciendo sus actividades desD. que se capacitó en una corporación para desempeñarse mejor. Hoy tiene un gran sueño y es el D. tener un salón D. belleza en un centro comercial concurrido, con toda L. infraestructura para que sus clientes se sientan confortables. Su capital D. trabajo no es suficiente para lograr sus metas y ahora inicia su camino a través D. su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará telas, hilos, botones, e insumos para su negocio D. donD. ofrece servicios para embellecer a sus clientes, como, esmaltes, tintes, lijas y aliseres. Mientras Elicia trabaja para alcanzar su sueño, adquiere con su negocio un margen D. utilidad D. 38%, que le permite seguir creciendo y reinvirtiendo parte D. este en su negocio y con el ha logrado hacer mejoras a su vivienda. Su Mayor desafío es lograr el máximo bienestar para sus hijos, porque ellos son justamente el motor que L. impulsa diariamente a continuar en L. búsqueda del éxito.
texts.en: Elicia is a brilliant woman who has always worked in her field of expertise. She is a seamstress and she offers repair and tailoring services. She is also a manicurist, offering her services in her clients' homes or in her house. She is a great business person who also has a store from where she sells merchandise such as clothing, accessories for men and women, perfumes, and cosmetics. She completes her sales on credit, detailing payment schedules with her clients. Elicia is the woman leader of the household. She has two children, 1 and 19 years old and she has always managed to take the reins of the household, earning an income and providing her daughter with educational opportunities. She is already in university and she is studying a career. For the past 8 years she has been carrying out her activities, ever since was trained by a corporation to improve her work. She has a great dream to have a beauty shop in a well-traveled shopping center, equipped with the entire infrastructure necessary to make her clients feel more comfortable. Her working capital is not enough to achieve her goals but now she has taken the first step by requesting a Kiva loan. It is the first loan she accesses through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and she will purchase fabrics, threads, buttons, and products she needs to offer beauty services to her clients, including nail polish, hair dye, nail files, and irons. As Elicia works to achieve her dream she acquires a profit margin of 38%. It permits her to keep expanding and reinvesting into her business, and she has also been able to carry out some home improvements. Her greatest challenge is to proviD. her children with the best possible well-being. They are precisely the motor that drives her each day to continue her daily quest for success.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, buttons, and other products she needs for her business.

loans.name: Diogene

texts.en:
Diogene is the father of a 5-year-old child. He and his wife are both farmers. Diogene has been farming rice for the past 10 years. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during the entire rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and harvesting.

Diogene wishes to use the profits from his farming to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labur for his rice farming.

loans.name: Vecinas De San Pablo Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "VECINAS D. SAN PABLO" y se ubica en el Estado D. México. este municipio se distingue por sus bellos manantiales y grandes campos verdes, por sus fiestas del pueblo, su gente trabajadora, emprendedora y L. humildad que en cada uno D. sus habitantes existe. El grupo esta conformado por diez integrantes. L. señora Alicia es L. presidenta del grupo. ElL. inició su negocio hace 6 años, el cual consiste en L. venta D. dulces y juguetes afuera D. las escuelas, requiere el prestamo para comprar más dulces y juguetes ya que los niños le piden más variedad y si compra en cantidades grandes su precio es más economico. ElL. tiene 38 años, estudió hasta L. secundaria, es ser una persona emprendedora con muchas ganas D. trabajar, siempre con el deseo D. brindarle lo mejor a su familia cada dia, vive en union libre, tiene una D. hijas D. 14 años D. edad y su mayor sueño es ver a su hija graduada y con una mejor calidad D. vida que elL. no pudo tener.
texts.en: The group is called "VECINAS D. SAN PABLO" and it is located in the state of Mexico. This town is known for its beautiful spring waters and extensive green fields, for its town festivals, its hardworking, enterprising and humble people. The group consists of 10 members. Señora Alicia is the president of the group. She started her business 6 years ago. She sells sweets and toys outsiD. schools. She is asking for the loan to buy more sweets and toys as the children are asking her for a greater variety. Also if she buys in large quantities the price is more economical. She is 38 years old and studied until high school. She is an enterprising person, very eager to work whose wish is to always proviD. the best for her family every day. She is in a common-law marriage and has a daughter who is 14 years old. Her biggest dream is to see her daughter graduate and have a better quality of life than she did.

loans.use: to buy sweets and toys.

loans.name: Bao

texts.en:
Bao is 60 years old and married with three children.

Bao and his wife earn a living selling coffee and beverages, which they have done for the last 6 years. Bao would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of coffee and beverages to sell. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and increase the turnover of his business. He also hopes that through the loan his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and enable him to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy beverages and coffee in bulk to sell

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
La señora Santa vive en un localidad muy bonita en donde celebran la fiesta del patrón san Antonio de Padua el 12 de junio, ella es divorciada y en total tuvo siete hijos quienes ya todos están casados.

     Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía como son: azúcar, frijol, aceite, arroz, café, entre otros para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, en donde lleva practicando  dos años y le va bien ya que  ha logrado incrementar sus ingresos de su hogar.
      
      Para dedicarse a esta actividad lo animaron sus hijos quienes le dieron unos ahorritos para que ponga un negocio  en la que pueda dedicar su tiempo y es como se animo a trabajar.

 Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella  valla obteniendo mejores ingresos para seguir adelante hasta que Dios le preste vida.
texts.en:
Santa lives in a very pretty location where the feast day of St. Anthony of Padua is celebrated on June 12th.  She’s divorced and had a total of seven children who are all now married.  She requested the loan to buy merchandise like: sugar, beans, oil, rice and coffee, among others to stock her grocery store where she’s been in business for two years and has done well having managed to increase household income.

Her children encouraged her to go into this business and gave her a few savings they had so that she could start a business that she could dedicate her time to; this is how she was motivated to work.  What she most hopes for is that from this small activity she will continue obtaining improved income to continue forward while God grants her life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 42 años, es casado y tiene un hijo de 10 años, vive con su familia en Ambato. Se describe como una persona tranquila que le gusta trabajar en el campo.

Manuel trabaja con su esposa en la crianza y venta de borregos. Es el segundo crédito que solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que será invertido en la compra de crías de borregos para su crianza y posteriormente para su venta lo cual le ayudará a incrementar la cantidad de animales y podrá mejorar sus ventas e ingresos, lo que le ayudaría para seguir dando el estudio a su hijo.

Su sueño es comprar un terreno para poder dar de pastar a sus animales ya que al momento arrienda terrenos para poder dar de comer a los borregos.
texts.en:
Manuel, 42, is married with one child, age 10, and lives with his family in Ambato.  He describes himself as a peaceful person who likes to work in the field.

Manuel works with his wife raising and selling sheep.  This is the second loan he has requested from FODEMI.  He will use it to buy litters of lambs to raise and then sell.  This will help him to increase the quantity of his animals and he will he able to improve his sales and earnings, which will help him to continue giving his son the opportunity to study.

His dream is to buy a piece of land to be able to graze his animals, since at the moment he rents land to be able to feed his sheep.

loans.use: to buy litters of lambs for fattening.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah lives in Uganda with her husband and four children, one of whom is in school. For the last for years, she has earned a living by selling bananas.  She works every day, selling her products in a local market, and is applying for a loan for 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bananas to sell to her customers. She supplements her income by renting out properties. Her main challenges are the rising cost of bananas and the high cost of transportation. Her goals for the future are to own a delivery van and open up a wholesale business. She lives in a home that she owns but which does not have access to electricity or piped-in water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and medicine.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Maria has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Maria is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en:
51-year-old Ma. Delia buys and sells seashells for a living. She is a married woman with no children yet. Ma. Delia works hard to improve her business and save for the future.

Ma. Delia is requesting a loan to buy more seashells to sell. This is the first time that Ma. Delia has asked for a loan. She said she learned about CEVI through her friends who also availed of its financial services. Ma. Delia is hopeful that this loan will help her have a progressive business.

loans.use: to buy more seashells to sell

loans.name: Vache

texts.en: Vache is a young farmer from Kapan. He keeps livestock and beehives. Unable to cover the family's daily expenses with current income, Vache has applied for a loan to develop his business. With the requetsed loan, Vache plans to purchase livestock and forage. This loan will help Vache to expand his farm and earn additional income. This is essential for Vache and his family as the increased income will allow him to renovate their house and ensure a prosperous life for his own family in the future. Vache lives with his parents.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and forage.

loans.name: Fass Diom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Fass Diom compte 5 femmes; il a été crée le 20-04-2010. Les femmes qui le composent sont de la même localité et font du commerce de détails.
Âgée de 41 ans, la responsable du groupe madame Tening est debout a droite de la photo et levant la main. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants.
Son prêt reçu va lui permettre d'acheter des brebis, qu'elle va engraisser et revendre. Une activité qu'elle fait depuis toujours ce qui fait son expérience.
Les bénéfices lui serviront à améliorer les conditions de vie des sa famille.
texts.en:
The group Fass Diom is comprised of five women; it was created on April 20, 2010. The women in the group are from the same town and are retail merchants. 

At 41 years of age, the group’s official, Ms. Tening, is the one in the photo standing at the right with her hand raised. She is married and the mother of seven children. 

The loan obtained is going to enable her to buy some sheep, which she will fatten and then sell. This is a business that she has always operated and that composes her experience. 

The profits will serve to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, de 25 años, es una mujer buena y amable, es conviviente con su pareja y tiene un hijo de 1 año, vive en casa de la madre de su conviviente y ahí educan a su hijo a quien desean dar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Lucia consiste en la venta de comida y productos de belleza, todos los días desde muy temprano empieza su jornada cuando va al mercado y compra todos los ingredientes y e insumos necesarios para poder preparar los deliciosos y riquísimos pollos broaster, platillo que le gusta sus comensales, quienes van en busca de un buen servicio y una sazón exquisita. Además de trabajar en la venta de comida por las noches, también vende productos de belleza como cosméticos y de cuidado personal, esto lo hace durante el día y en su tiempo libre. Esta trabajando a este ritmo desde hace un año y se siente muy contenta, pues le gusta su trabajo, ya que ella decide que días y a que hora sale a vender o a ofrecer sus productos. Al tener dos actividades también significa que tiene doble ingresos a su economía y esto le permite tener mejores condiciones, pero no todo le fue siempre bien ya que al principio le fue muy complicado por que no sabia mucho el negocio, pero con el tiempo fue mejorando y ahora es muy buena en lo que hace. Ahora esta preparándose para ampliar sus actividades y empezar a vender zapatos y ropa. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, esta a la expectativa de que le brinden un apoyo para así poder seguir haciendo su trabajo y cumplir con sus metas, por otro lado se compromete en ser una cliente puntual ya que tiene muy buenas referencias del grupo al que se esta incorporando por que son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará zapatos y ropa para empezar a vender ya que esta por incursionar en este negocio, además de ingrediente e insumos no perecibles y tener para seguir trabajando con su venta de comida.
texts.en:
Lucia, 25, is a good, kind woman.  She has a spouse and a one-year-old son.  She lives in her spouse’s mother’s house and they educate their son there and wish for a better quality of life for him.

Lucia’s work consists in selling food and beauty products.  She begins her day very early going to the market to buy all the ingredients and supplies needed to prepare her delicious Broaster-style chicken, a favorite of her diners, who come by seeking good service and exquisite taste.  Besides selling food in the evening she also sells cosmetics and personal care products during the day and in her free time.  She’s been working at this pace for a year and feels very happy because she likes her work because she says that she decides what days and what work schedule she’ll use to go out and sell her products.  Having two jobs also means double income and this provides better conditions.  But it wasn’t always like this.  At the beginning it was quite complicated because she didn’t know much about the business.  However, in time she improved and now she is very good at what she does.  At present, she’s getting ready to expand activities and start to sell shoes and clothes.

This will be her first MFP loan.  She is hopeful that she’ll get the support to continue doing her work and reach her goals.  On the other hand, she commits to be a punctual client because she has very good references of the group she’s joining because they are very responsible and supportive.

She will use the requested 1000 soles to buy shoes and clothes to start to sell because she’s about to start out in this business.  She will also buy ingredients and non-perishable supplies to continue working preparing food to sell.

loans.use: to buy food preparation ingredients and also to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Tsiuri

texts.en: Tsiuri is from the village of Patara Lilo, East Georgia. She is 63 years old and lives alone in her house. Tsiuri earns a living through dairy farming. She has 2 milk cows and produces yogurt. She sells milk and the yogurt she makes locally in the village. Her total average monthly income is 500 Laris. Tsiuri requested credit for purchasing new milk cows. The cows she currently owns are already old and their productivity is significantly lower in comparison with that of young cows. She will sell the old ones, add the loan funds to the proceeds, and purchase the younger cows. She will get more milk and sell more dairy products. It will impact Tsiuri’s income positively and she will be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 2 milk cows

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 
Erlinda has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.
Erlinda has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Tataesusai Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tataesusai” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. These small-scale businesswomen are collectively requesting a loan of 2,900,000 SLL from SMT and Kiva lenders in order to further expand their respective businesses. 

Isatu is the leader of this group. Born in Makeni, Isatu is married to a teacher and the couple has four children attending primary schools. Isatu has been doing business for twenty years now. She sells palm-oil, pepper, rice, onions, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy palm-oil, rice and pepper in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, rice and pepper in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es: Maria de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace mas de 10 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.

loans.use: para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married to a wonderful husband who contributes to the family welfare with $ 42 per month. They have two children and expecting another in a few months to come.  She is a mixed farmer; she grows vegetables, maize, beans and bananas. In addition, she sells milk from her own cows and it has helped her a lot in looking after her family and in enhancing her quest for financial freedom.

loans.use: Grace wants to buy dairy meal for her cows to increase milk production.

loans.name: Sovkat

texts.en: Sovkat is a low income person from the Agsu district. She started her business in 2002. In 2003 she borrowed $200 from Normicro Agsu branch and expanded her business. In 2005 she borrowed $300 from Normicro. Now she wants to borrow $1000 to increase the variety of her goods.

loans.use: to increase variety of goods

loans.name: Isu

texts.en: Isu P.’s family is not well off. They struggle to find things or beg other neighbors for necessities to survive. When Isu heard about our program, she decided to use the opportunity given by the SPBD program to provide financial assistance for her and her family. She used her skills in baking and selling her Samoan pastries (faapapa) to the local people. She focuses on baking a traditional Samoan pastry made of sugar, flour and a mixture of ripe bananas. The mixed ingredients are baked in the traditional Samoan oven. Isu walks around the village to sell her cooked pastries until they are all sold out. Finding her idea to be a success, Isu is looking forward to buying a second hand oven to bake on instead of going through the long process of baking her pastries in a traditional Samoan oven.

loans.use: to purchase a second hand oven

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca lives with her unmarried-partner and her five children. Her partner is a photographer, but his income was not enough to support their family. So, Francisca decided to start to work and one of her friends asked her to work with her selling beauty products. Before she began working as a saleswoman, she had helped her husband with his photography, but her own sales continue to grow, adding to the family's spending money. She is very happy with her achievements and with her earnings, which are going towards helping her children.

Francisca is applying for a loan of $275.00, which she will pay back in 6 months. She will use this loan to purchase merchandise and improve her family's standard of living. She already has many orders to fulfill and she doesn't want to disappoint her customers. She and her family thank you very much for your support, which they need to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Francisca vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos, su pareja trabaja como fotógrafo, y por ello sus ingresos no eran suficientes para mantener a su familia, por ello ella decidió empezar a trabajar, fue por invitación de una amiga por la que ella entro a la venta de productos de belleza para mujer, ya que antes de este negocio ella le ayudaba a su pareja con la toma de fotografías, pero actualmente le esta yendo mejor cada vez y teniendo más clientes y así apoya con un ingreso adicional en la economía familiar, ella esta muy contenta con sus logros y sus ingresos, ya que le están ayudando a sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Francisca solicita un préstamo por US $ 275 que ofrece pagar en 6 meses, ella utilizará este préstamo para comprar mercadería y así sacar adelante a su familia, ya que tiene varios pedidos que surtir y no desea quedar mal con sus clientes, por ello ella y su familia te acrecen mucho el apoyo que les brindas para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es:
Martha is from Merida, Yucatan. She is married and has a 17-year-old son and two daughters who are 24 and 18 years old. Her husband is a tire technician. In order to be able to help with the family’s expenses and her children’s school tuition, Martha started helping one of her sisters who was working at the local street market four years ago. Later, she decided to become independent and started her own business selling clothes and toys. Little by little she started buying a greater variety of articles. Thanks to the good work she has done, she has managed to make her business grow. At present, Martha needs a loan of $475 that she will use to buy merchandise to cover the demand of her clients and to keep on growing like until now. She promises to repay the loan over a period of 4 months. Be an important part in the development of this business, Martha and her family are sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha es originaria de Mérida, Yucatán, es casada y tiene un hijo de 17 años de edad y dos hijas de 18 y 24 años. Su esposo es llantero y para poder ayudarlo con los gastos del hogar y pagar las colegiaturas de sus hijos, desde hace cuatro años Martha comenzó a ayudarle a una de sus hermanas que vendía en un tianguis, después decidió independizarse e inició su propio negocio con la venta de ropa y juguetes, poco a poco fue surtiendo una mayor variedad de artículos y ha hecho crecer su negocio gracias al buen trabajo que realiza. En estos momentos, Martha necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, Martha y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru:
Gulnoza, 32, is married and has one child. Gulnoza and her husband sell soft drinks on the central market of Spitamen. They have been in business for several years. They purchase the goods at the wholesale markets of Khudzhand and Istaravshan. This is the only source of income that Gulnoza and her husband have. The plan to use this loan to purchase soft drinks.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Гулноза и ее муж занимаются продажей прохладительных напитков на центральном рынке Спитамена. Этой деятельностью они занимаются уже несколько лет. Товар привозят с оптовых рынков Худжанда и Истаравшана. Другого заработка для содержания семьи у них нету. Гулнозе 32 года и у нее 1 ребенок. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ для закупки новой партии напитков.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks

loans.name: Peola

texts.en: Peola is 32 years old and married with two kids. She applied for this loan in order to buy inventory, such as perfumes, shoes, clothes, and sunglasses for her flea market stall. She also makes and sells Samoan cocoa in order to supplement her income. She is happy to be able to carry enough inventory to fill up her stall and hopes to stay a long time in SPBD’s loan program because her business is her only means of financial support.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her flea market stall and supplies for her Samoan cocoa business

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en: Nargiz (her sister is pictured) is 36 years old and is a mother of 3 children. She lives with her family in Khachmaz region. 4 years ago she started a cattle breeding business with her sister. Now she and her sister need a loan of $1200 to buy 2 calves for increasing their cattle breeding operations.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir C. is a barber in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Tahir has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit. He is currently looking for funding so that he can make repairs and remodel his barber shop.

loans.use: To make repairs and improvements to his barber shop

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is married and has four children. She supports her family and husband, who is a mechanic, by selling plywood at Poly Junction in Cape Coast. She is requesting $525 to buy plywood in bulk from a wholesaler at a reduced rate. She hopes this loan will increase her income.

Agnes is also a member of a lending group called “Wisdom Group”, which consists of 14 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy plywood in bulk from a wholesaler at a reduced rate.

loans.name: Sohib

texts.en:
Sohib is 19 years old. In spite of his young age, Sohib is supporting his mother and younger brother. Since he was seventeen Sohib has been running his business manufacturing wooden doors and window frames. Sohib's father trained Sohib, who inherited the business from him.

Now Sohib is dreaming of improving the working conditions of his shop. He dreams of providing the best quality in the neighborhood. After two years of operation, Sohib is applying for a loan for the first time. He requests $600.00 for the term of 12 months. Sohib would like to thank everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase materials, like lumber, and improve working conditions.

loans.name: Menyikwa Agri Business Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Martha K. is an average young Kenyan, married with 4 children of her own and 1 orphan child of her late sister.

Martha started her tailoring business two years ago after completing her tailoring course in Kisii town. Before venturing into the tailoring business, Martha used to sell cereals in the Kisii market, a business that she did for five years. She used the profits from her cereals business and savings from various women's groups to start her tailoring business. She initially started with one sewing machine, but she has worked hard to expand her business and she currently has three sewing machines.

With the little profits that Martha gets from her business, she is still able to provide food, clothing and shelter for her children. But most importantly, she says she is glad that she can pay for all her children's school fees. Her greatest joy would be to see her children go to secondary school and higher education if possible.

With the help of her loan, Martha will be able to purchase more clothing materials for her business. Her long-term business vision is to own a buttonholer and an overlock machine.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials

loans.name: Sylvana

texts.fr:
Mrs. Sylvana A. was born in 1966 in Lomé. She is married to a trader and the mother of three children. She is a seamstress by training and would like to have a loan to rent a workshop and buy another sewing machine. A very good designer and very honest, she is highly sought after by those living in her neighborhood to make their clothes.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Sylvana A. est née en 1966 à Lomé, elle s’est mariée à un commerçant, et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle est couturière de formation et désire avoir un prêt pour loyer un atelier et acheter une autre machine de couture. Bonne couturière et très honnête elle est très convoitée par les habitants de son quartier pour la confection de leurs vêtements.

loans.use: Rental of a workshop and purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Thon M., 49, is married and lives in Siem Reap Province with her four children. Daily, she goes to the market to sell porridge, making around $12.50, while her husband sells firewood, typically making $5 each day. The family is also supported by a few of the children who are able to work. One child is a farmer, another works with Thon M., another works with her husband, and the last is a student. Thon M. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a pig to raise. It is a difficult time economically for most Cambodians, because inflation has soared, and raising pigs will be a good way for Thon M. to generate some extra income for her family and raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a pig.

loans.name: Débora

texts.fr:
Born in 1968 in Tsévié, Mrs. G. is married and the mother of three children. She and her family live in a neighborhood which is quite far from the center of the city of Lomé. The inhabitants of her neighborhood have to go quite some distance to stock up on everyday necessities. Having analysed this need, Mrs. G. began selling such products. She buys them wholesale and retails them. This is a business that is working very well for her, except for the fact that she often runs short of this product or that. She is therefore requesting this first loan to add to her inventory.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1968 à Tsévié madame G. est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit avec sa famille dans un quartier qui est un peu éloigné du cœur de la ville de Lomé ce qui fait que les habitants de son quartier font une distance assez importante pour se ravitailler en produits de première nécessité. Ayant analysé ce besoin, elle s’est lancée dans la vente de ces produits. Elle les achète en gros et les revend en détail. C’est une activité qui marche très bien pour elle sauf qu’elle est souvent en rupture de stock. Elle sollicite alors ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock.

loans.use:
Purchase of grocery staples for re-sale

Achat des produits de première nécessité

loans.name: Huorn

texts.en: Mr. Huorn T. was born in 1968 and he now lives in Srae Ampil Village in Kandal Province.  He has a motorbike with a cart attaches, which he uses to transport passengers and goods. At the moment, this business is not very profitable because his motorbike uses a lot of gasoline. He has therefore decided to ask for a loan so that he can buy a more efficient motorbike. His wife, Mrs. Ya Chroeb, is a sugar cane juice seller in the local village. Mr Huorn T. has four children who are all attending school. His wife is shown on the left of the photograph.

loans.use: to replace his old motorbike with a new one.

loans.name: Lenuel

texts.es: Disculpen les envio la foto del señor lenuel P.
texts.en:
Disculpen les envio la foto del señor lenuel P.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Taller de torno y soldadura

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Married with three children between the ages of 13 and 4, 33-year-old Amina A. from Mwanza has been operating a cosmetics shop business since 2004. Amina currently earns about $300 per month working at the business 12 hours per day, six days per week, assisted by one employee. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy more cosmetics, and in the future, she plans to increase her range and stock of products. Amina thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Mrs. Saret H., 22, and her husband, Mr. Ret Touch, 23, live in a small village off the national road two, about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. They were married in 2006 and have a seven-month old son.

Mrs. Saret has been selling vegetables for one year. She buys them from the Sa-ang district and resells them at the Takmao market. Her husband has been a mason for eight years. Saret requests a loan of $300 to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 34-year-old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with his wife. He has been a painter and a contractor for three years. He requested a loan of $800 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase coal. This is his fourth cycle and he has always paid on schedule. Ali's clients are his friends. Thanks to a previous job, he came up with the idea of opening a coffee shop.

loans.use: Ali needs the loan to purchase coal

loans.name: Nih Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is married to Elizabeth Bih and they are blessed with three children, all of them above 15 years of age. Patrick and his entire family are living in a house with three bedrooms and one sitting room. As a very hard working man, Patrick has faced many challenges in life. In the process of struggling to earn a living, he encountered many challenges in life such as the death of his pigs and people owing him huge sums of money for work done. These problems made life very difficult for him until 2005 when he became a member of GHAPE and received his first loan (for 20,000 FRS). He received a loan of 65,000 FRS in 2006 and 400,000 FRS in 2007. He successfully repaid these loans. 

Now Patrick is requesting a loan so he can buy “wilberoo" fish and five piglets and make repairs on his pig pen. Repayment of the loan will start at the fourth month from the day of disbursement. Patrick is convinced that the business will succeed because of the experience he has had in it and he is well known in the community as fish supplier.

Patrick plans to use the profit from the loan to construct a good house for his family, pay for his children's school fees, and to feed and cloth his family. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the training GHAPE provides before giving out loans and the follow up it does after the loan is disbursed to ensure  proper usage of the loan.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy fish and pigs

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna M., 56, and her husband, Mr. Yun Morm, 66, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have one son who is married. Besides her son she also has one daughter in-law and three grandchildren living with her. 

Vanna and her husband have been farming for 20 years. They grow tomatoes, eggplants, and corn in their farmland near the house. Their son takes the produce and buys some amount from their villagers to sell at market in Phnom Penh.

Vanna is requesting a loan of $1100 to purchase a motorbike and trailer for her son driving as a motor taxi (Tuk Tuk) and carry vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and trailer for her son driving motor taxi (Tuk Tuk).

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
“Helping one another is also building a good and happy family,” says Maricel.

Maricel B. is living in Barangay (township) San Lorenzo with her husband Dante and two children: Marjulaine, 8 years old, grade three and Mark Jay, 2 years old. The family's source of income is farming, which is being managed by her husband while she works as a vendor in their public school.

Maribel sells different kinds of snacks in their village. She is planning to increase her merchandise and sell different flavors of juice and ice candies and some snacks like "banan cue" (sugar coated banana) and sweet potatoes. To fulfill her plan, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 as additional capital. She has been in this business for four years and according to Maricel, she can generate a weekly income of PHP 400 that she needs to budget between family needs and business capital. Her income is not enough but still, it sustains the needs of their family.

loans.use: To increase her range of merchandise

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Madame Yacime N. est une femme mariée qui fait de petits commerces au marché de Bambey, une petite ville à 130 km de Dakar.  Elle vend du poisson sec et du poisson fumé.   Ce crédit le permit de renforcer la marchandise sur sa petite cantine dont les revenues lui permettent de soutenir son mari sur les dépenses familiales.   Son boutique est situe a l’intérieur du marché ou on a mit des toitures pour se couvrir du soleil.  Il y a beaucoup d’autres vendeuses a cote d’elle, mais son sourire attire les clients.
texts.en:
Ms. Yacime N. is a married women who is a small-scale merchant at the marketplace of Bambey, a small city 130 km from Dakar. She sells dried and smoked fish. This loan will enable her to enhance the merchandise in her cantine, which provides the income enabling her to support her husband in covering family expenses. Her shop is located within the marketplace, where roofing has been put up as cover against the sun. There are many other retailers adjacent to her, but her smile attracts the customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Filena De La Cruz

texts.es: La señora Filena inicio su negocio desde hace seis años, en la venta de ropa, zapatos el cual inicio con dinero propio, algunas veces con ventas bajas debido al desempleo de muchos nicaragüense, pero ha sobresalido a flote con los prestamos que Afodenic ha prestado. Tiene 52 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación,  tiene cuatro hijos que son independientes, su esposo tiene un taxi y es muy responsable. Este es su onceavo ciclo de préstamo el cual va invertir en comprar ropa variada para adulto y niños como zapatos, para incrementar el inventario y poder obtener mejores ingresos para poder ayudar a sus hijos económicamente.
texts.en:
Filena opened her business six years ago with her own money, selling clothing and shoes. Sometimes sales were slow because of the high unemployment rate in Nicaragua, but she has stay afloat thanks to the loans from Afodenic. She is 52 years old and lives in the neighbourhood of Villa Reconciliació. She has four children who no longer depend on her financially; her husband has a taxi and she is very responsible. This is her 11th loan cycle. She will use the loan to buy a variety of adult and children's clothing as well as shoes in order to increase her inventory and make a better income in order to be able to help her children financially.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria cuenta con 52 años de edad, es casada, tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales 4 de ellos migraron a la ciudad de Lima. Junto a su esposo siembra maíz, alverjas, espinacas y demás verduras, también cría animales que en momentos de necesidad, puede vender y solventar algunos gastos; como cuando los precios de sus productos en el mercado no fueron buenos, pudo pagar los gastos de educación de sus hijos con la crianza y venta de su ganado. Por ello, Maria nos muestra su tierna becerrita,  que está esperando a su madre, la cual está sujeta en la praderas para que se alimente bien y pueda brindar de su leche, no solo a su cría, sino también a sus amos, pues María tiene varios pedidos para repartir, y con las ganancias de este negocio, compra los víveres para la comida del día.  Ahora su esposo está sembrando avena para alimentar a sus animales y que les sigan proporcionando su deliciosa leche. Maria es fundadora de su banco comunal, al que le tiene mucho cariño y estima, y durante este tiempo ha ocupado diversos cargos que ha cumplido con mucha responsabilidad, asimismo cada una de sus cuotas las ha pagado puntualmente. El dinero que solicita es para preparar sus tierras con arados, así podrán aumentar su producción y tendrán provisiones para los meses de agosto, que son meses de sequía en su zona.
texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old and married. She has six children of whom four have migrated to the city of Lima. Together with her husband she sows maize, peas, spinach and other vegetables.
