She also raises animals which at times of need she can sell in order to meet expenses, such as when the prices of goods in the market weren't good and she was able to pay for her children's education with the sale of her livestock. Maria showed us her dear calf who was waiting for his mother who is being kept in the paddocks in order that they she is well feed and can provide milk not only for her young but also to her owners. Also, Maria has various orders to fill and with the profits from this business she buys the food for that day's meals. Now her husband is sowing oats in order to feed their animals so that they continue to produce their delicious milk. Maria is the founder of her community bank, for which she has much affection and esteem and during this time she has occupied many different posts which she has fulfilled with a great deal of responsibility: she's also repaid every one of her installments punctually. The money which she is asking for is to prepare and plough her lands in order to be able to increase production and have provisions for August, which is a time of drought in their area.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Prepare her lands for sowing

loans.name: Takku Liggey Cite Senghor 1 Group

texts.fr: HAWA ,DIARA ET MARIAMA SONT TROIS FEMMES MARIEES QUI VIVENT A THIES AU QUARTIER CITE SENGHOR .ELLES FONT DU COMMERCE DE PRODUITS DIVERS DEPUIS PLUSIEURS.ELLES SE SONT REGROUPEES EN GROUPE ET ONT OUVERT UN COMPTE A LA MUTUELLE .AVEC CE PRET ELLES VEULENT RENFORCER LEURS ACTIVITES GENERATRICES DE REVENUS.
texts.en:
Hawa, Diara, and Mariama are three married women who live in Thies, in the Senghor district. They have been selling various items for several years. They have formed a group and opened an account in the Mutual. With this loan, they hope to reinforce the businesses with which they earn their living.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of various items

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es: Roberta acaba de cumplir 47 años, es una madre trabajadora y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo e hijos. Tiene 9, de los cuales, 4 de ellos viven fuera, mientras los otros 5 están con ella, y son el motivo de sus esfuerzos. Se dedica a la compra, crianza y venta de cerdos, se levanta muy temprano para alimentarlos y que estén muy gorditos para comercializarlos, por lo que los cuida con mucho cariño y esmero, puesto que sabe que gracias a ellos, tendrá el dinero para los gastos familiares. Su  esposo es agricultor, y en horas de la tarde, cuando Roberta pastea sus cerdos, también lo apoya en los trabajos agrícolas. Los 8 años que lleva en este negocio le han dado la experiencia necesaria para realizar un buen trabajo; y lo que más le gusta es que al mismo tiempo que cuida de sus animales, también puede realizar sus labores hogareñas. Pero considera que lo más difícil es evitar que sus cerdos se vayan lejos y se pierdan, por lo que sobre todo, tiene mucho más cuidado de los pequeñitos, con los que decidió tomarse la foto. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, durante sus anteriores préstamos consecutivos ha demostrado ser una cliente muy responsable en cada uno de sus pagos, y del mismo modo se compromete a seguir trabajando con su banco comunal. Con los dos mil soles que ha solicitado quiere incrementar la cantidad de sus porcinos, además de comprar fertilizantes químicos para los cultivos de su esposo.
texts.en:
Roberta just turned 47 years old. She is a working mother and responsible. She lives in her own house with her husband and children. She has 9 children, 4 of which live elsewhere and 5 with her. They are the reason behind her efforts. She works buying, raising and selling pigs. She gets up very early to feed them and fatten them for market. She cares for them with affection since she knows that she will have money for family expenses thanks to them. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him in the afternoon hours when the pigs are grazing. Her eight years in this business have given her the necessary experience to do a good job. What she likes best about it is that she can do her household chores at the same time she is caring for her animals. She thinks the most difficult part is to make sure her pigs don’t go far away and get lost. Above all she is very careful with the little ones. She decided to have her picture taken with them. This is her third loan with MFP. She has proven to be a very responsible client with each payment of her previous consecutive loans. She is committed to continue working with her community bank in the same way. She wants to increase the amount of pigs with the loan of two thousand PEN she has applied for and also buy chemical fertilizers for her husband’s crops.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs and fertilizers

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim M., 42, is a good mother who has been blessed with four children: two of whom are married and the others are single and in school.

Sim M. makes a living by buying and selling used goods for a profit. She owns an old motorbike and uses it to transport used goods that she buys from door-to-door in her community. Her husband has always been a civil servant officer but has been retired for a year. Sim M. wants to encourage her husband to have a business to invest in. She would like a $500 loan as capital for her husband to begin selling grocery items out of their home.

loans.use: For her husband to begin selling grocery items out of their home

loans.name: Amade

texts.en:
Amade A. is originally from the province of Nampula, but currently resides in Boane. He lived in Nampula for 34 years, studied through the end of high school and began to work. His work led him to the city of Maputo in 1999, and soon thereafter, he moved to Boane. Amade is the father of two children and also supports his brother who lives with him.

Amade currently works as a transit police officer and teaches transit courses on the side. He is able to make around MT 4,200 (USD $155.00) a month and with this, he is able to save a little bit. He plans on using this loan to help realize his dream of finishing construction of his home that will offer much improved living standards for his family. This is Amade's second loan with Hluvuku, and he plans on taking out more in the future.

loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: Phim's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four low-income members. Its leader, Phim S., is aged 38 and the mother of five children: four are single and one is married and lives away from home. She is married to Nhem Kok, 39, and they both earn a living by working as carrying workers in the busy fish market. This couple makes as their daily income approximately US$ 4 per day to manage their family’s daily living needs.

The family’s living conditions are not so comfortable due to the fact that their house is cracking. To solve this problem, Phim S. is taking out a loan to repair her old broken house.

The other borrowers are:

S. is a grocery seller, requesting a loan to grow her business.

T. is taking out a loan to decorate her house.

C. will be using a loan to paint her old house that is in poor condition.

loans.use: To repair her old broken house

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Mrs. Phat P. lives in Slaeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living; her field is far from her house. Her husband, Mr. Bin Reth, is an electric cow driver who can make only a small income to support the family.

Since the field is far from the house and Mrs. Phat P. has difficulty transporting fertilizer to use in the rice field, she decided to ask for a loan to buy an electric cow cart for her husband in order to transport fertilizer.

Mrs. Phat P. has two children who are both attending the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: to buy electric cow cart for her husband in order to transport fertilizer

loans.name: Tinah

texts.en:
Tinah G. is 37 years old, and a single mother of one child. She lives with her daughter Joyce in Mikindani, Mombasa. Tinah is a food vendor in the busy Kongowea market and has been able to attract many customers in the area. She has been in the business for 10 years. 

She is accessing her second loan from KADET and she plans to improve her hotel's look by buying furniture, painting the hotel and by also purchasing a microwave. This way she will be able to maintain her customers and attract more, thus improving her earnings.

Tinah hopes to run a hotel in Mombasa's City centre in future.  

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy furniture, paint the hotel and also purchase a microwave.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 61 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 03 hijos y no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, vive en el Sector Ilata.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para compra de insumos para la elaboración de helados. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de azúcar, colorantes, barquillos, etc para la elaboración de helados.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para salir adelante.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la puntualidad.

loans.use: Para la compra de azúcar, colorantes, barquillos, etc

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis es una madre de familia de 23 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 1, 4 y 6 años de edad en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado a 5 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de yogurt, aprendió este oficio en un Instituto de la ciudad de Chiclayo, y ya lleva cuatro años en el negocio, todos los días se dirige a vender sus productos en los exteriores del mercado Moshoqueque desde las 6:30 am hasta el mediodía.

Por la tarde compra los ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración del yogurt y prepara lo que venderá al dia siguiente; ella también distribuye sus productos en diversas tiendas de la zona y eventualmente la invitan a algunas ferias especializadas.

Su esposo adquirió una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la que la ayuda a distribuir su mercancía, el también trabaja en la moto mientras ella está vendiendo; el excesivo uso de este vehículo ha hecho que empiece a sufrir fallas en el motor, por lo que Gladis se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación de su unidad móvil así como en la compra de más ingredientes para ampliar su negocio.

Gladis sueña con construir su casa, ya que actualmente vive en una alquilada y también desea seguir sacando adelante a su negocio para adquirir más adelante un local en donde pueda ofrecer el yogurt que produce. Ella es muy conocida entre sus clientes por la calidad y responsabilidad con las que elabora sus productos.
texts.en:
Gladis is 23 years old. She and her husband have three children (ages 6, 4, and 1). They live in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz, which is located 5 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

She makes and sells yogurt, a trade she learned while attending an institute in Chiclayo. She has been in business for 4 years and sells her products daily at the outdoor Moshoqueque Market from 6:30am to 12pm. In the afternoons, she buys the ingredients she needs to prepare the next batch of yogurt that she will sell the following day. She also distributes her product to different stores in the area and at specialty fairs where she is invited.

Her husband bought a moto-taxi (a motorcycle with a sidecar for transporting cargo or passengers) to help her distribute her merchandise. He also uses it to provide transportation services. Excessive use of the vehicle has resulted in engine failure, so Gladis is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 soles. She will use the money to make repairs to the vehicle as well as buy more ingredients so that she can expand her yogurt business.

Gladis dreams of building a house because her family currently lives in a rented home. She also dreams of continued success in her business so that she can open her own location where she can produce and sell yogurt. She is well known among her customers and they appreciate the care she puts into making a quality product.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making yogurt & pay for repairs to her husband's motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose sells text books to make a living.she hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more text books to sell.Her ultimate goal is to lift her business and family above poverty.She is 50 years old and married with 6 children.She says a big thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more text books to sell

loans.name: Milafe

texts.en:
Milafe O. is from the village of San Vicente. She is 49 years-old and married with five children. Three of them are adults and the remaining two are school-aged.  Milafe owns and operates in food sector business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling selling rice and viands in the local community. Milafe has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Milafe joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milafe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock for her pigs raising activity. Milafe is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients and working capital for the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Milafe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and support the education of her children . 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw ingredients

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 24 años, vive con su pareja y madre de su hijo, en su casa propia.
Sus anhelos son de prosperar mediante sus cultivos de café y plátanos, por lo que trabaja todos los días, desde la 6 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde quitando las malezas y las malas hierbas de la tierra, contando con el apoyo de su esposa para estas tareas.
Adicionalmente, trabaja como jornalero en otras chacras, empezando su trabajo a las 8 de la mañana y le pagan al día la suma de 15 soles, incluido almuerzo. 
De esta manera José ha empezado a sostener a su familia, la cual acaba de formar, por lo que tiene muchas esperanzas de comprase sus propias tierras en el  futuro, pues de ese modo asegurará la estabilidad de su economía.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y durante su crédito anterior demostró mucha responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
José is 24 years old. He lives in his own home with his partner, who is the mother of their only child.

His aspirations are to prosper through his coffee and banana crops. He works every day from 6am until 5pm removing weeds and thickets from the soil. His wife helps him with these tasks. In addition, José works as a laborer on other farms. He starts that job at 8am and gets paid 15 soles, including lunch. Through these activities, José is able to support his family which is just now developing. He has high hopes of acquiring his own land in the future as a means of ensuring his financial stability.

This is his second loan with MFP. On his previous loan, José showed that he was responsible in making his payments. The money he requested will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Halimatou Habibou

texts.fr: Halimatou Habibou D. est une femme de 50 ans elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois et a eu 13 bonnes expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de la restauration, elle prépare ses mets à domicile et fréquente pratiquement tous les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité pour vendre ses repas. Elle participe à la nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
Halimatou Habibou D., aged 50, is married and the mother of ten children. She is a member of a village bank and has successfully managed 13 loans. She is a caterer; she prepares her dishes at home and tours nearly all the weekly markets of her town to sell them. She helps with providing food for her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To support her business

loans.name: Raphel

texts.en:
Raphel sells motorcycle spare parts at retail prices to his customers. He hopes to own a mechanic shop in the future. He is a focused, hard worker. His wife is a tailor. He is 43 years old and has four children. His children are excelling in school. 

Raphel hopes for a loan amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell. With this business, he hopes to meet the basic needs and necessities of his family. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for resale

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: Celestina is twenty-nine years old. She is single and has no child. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community in the central region of Ghana. She is a trader. Celestina trades in ready-made women's clothing. She sells door-to-door and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. Celestina has been in business for three years and desires to give her business a face-lift. She therefore wants a loan, which she will use to procure more goods.

loans.use: To buy ready-made clothing

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa, de 38 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 5 hijos: Yony de 18, Hernán de 15, Vilma de 13, Norma de 9 y Roger de 6 años, a quienes desea dar unos buenos estudios superiores. 
En la mina La Rinconada, a más de 5400 m.s.n.m. se encuentra ubicado el negocio de Nicolasa, su principal actividad es la venta de golosinas, pero también desempeña muchas otras actividades como la venta de triciclos, la cual realiza los días domingos en la feria. 
Asimismo, algunas noches brinda el servicio de transporte en motocarro, actividad que realiza solo esporádicamente por el frío tan intenso que hace en esta zona minera.
Lo que más le gusta a Nicolasa es que con sus actividades puede brindarles a sus hijos todas las comodidades que necesitan, lleva 3 años realizando esta labor y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el intenso frío que hace en la mina. 
Para más adelante, espera tener una tienda de abarrotes donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Nicolasa con MFP, espera cumplir con todas sus cuotas a tiempo y así no perjudicar a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Nicolasa, 38, is a very loving and hard-working mother. She lives in her own house with her five children; Yony is 18, Hernán is 15, Vilma is 13, Norma is 9, and Roger is 6. She wants to give them a good post high school education. Nicolasa’s business is located at the La Rinconada mine, which is at more the 5,400 meters above sea level. Her main activity is selling sweets. However, she also does other activities like selling tricycles on Sundays at the fair. Some nights she offers transportation services in her “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle). She only does this sporadically because of the intense cold in this mining area. What Nicolasa likes best about her activities is being able to give her children all of the amenities that they need. She has been doing this work for three years. The most difficult part is having to withstand the intense cold in the mine. Later, she hopes to have a grocery store where she could sell more peacefully. This is Nicolasa’s fourth loan with MFP. She expects to make all of her payments on time so she does not hurt the members of her communal bank. She is very respected in her communal bank for the responsibility that she shows. She will use the 3,000 PEN she is requesting to buy more sweets to better stock her sales stand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en: Akbar T. is a 25 year old, young, single man. He lives in Fuzuli region. Akbar has been working in his business for 5 years. Akbar T. now needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy stock to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stock

loans.name: Hayssam

texts.en:
Hayssam is a 37 year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Hayssam has been working in construction since 1998. Hayssam is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. Hayssam has been a microcredit client for five years and has always paid on time.

Hayssam is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and does a good job. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building a network of clients and had some financial issues. He decided on his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans to expand his business and improve his work quality.

loans.use: To purchase tools.

loans.name: Renacidas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Renacidas” esta representado por la señora Justina y conformadas por 12 socias D. las cuales todas son mujeres, este banco se caracteriza por ser muy unido y alegre la señora Justina que es la presidente es muy amiga D. todas y esta casada con Fernando abogado D. profesión, ambos tienen 2 hijas ya mayores D. la cual una es socia dentro del grupo, D. manera que solo trabaja para el sustento D. ella y su marido. Esta socia es bastante multifacética ocupando su tiempo en distintas actividades como ser la venta D. ropa, venta D. repostería, bisutería y otros, las casa donD. vive es propia, por lo tanto esto le favorece bastante por que ocupa el espacio D. la casa para desempeñar las actividades ya mencionadas, las expectativas D. la señora Justina es crecer poco a poco y poder tener una tienda D. ropa para poder ayudar a sus hijas con el sustento D. sus nietos. el resto del grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades como se la venta D. comida, D. cosméticos, repostería tradicional, venta D. ropa nueva y usada, confección y remodelación D. ropa, estas actividades son desempeñadas como ambulante y en otros casos en un puesto fijo. si bien la competencia es bastante el grupo cuenta con clientes fijos que conocen su trabajo y demandan sus servicios, por otro lado cave recalcar el entusiasmo que ponen las mismas al realizar su trabajo. El presente crédito será utilizado como capital D. operaciones, con la compra D. mercadería, insumos y materiales para agrandar sus negocios y mejorar sus ingresos que se traducirán en una mejor calidad D. vida para sus familias. La mayor expectativa D. las socias es contar con un negocio productivo que logre mejorar sus ingresos y ayudarlos a salir D. la pobreza brindando una mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias. El grupo va cumpliendo un segundo ciclo demostrando siempre responsabilidad, honestidad y muchas ganas D. trabajar.
texts.en:
The “Renacidas” (Reborn Ones) communal bank is represented by Justina and is maD. up of 12 members, who are all women. The members of this bank are known for being very unified and cheerful. Justina, who is the president, is very friendly with all the members. She is married to Fernando, who is an attorney; they have two adult daughters, one of whom is a group member, too. Justina, therefore, works just for her own and her husband’s support. Justina is quite multifaceted; she occupies her time with a variety of activities such as: clothing sales, pastry sales, costume jewelry sales, and others. She lives in her own house and this is very beneficial to her because she has space in the house for all her activities. Justina’s expectations are to gradually grow and have a clothing store eventually so that she can help her daughters and support her grandchildren. The rest of the group members are in various kinds of commercial activities such as: food sales, cosmetic sales, traditional pastry making, new and used clothing sales, clothes making and repair. These activities are undertaken in some cases, door-to-door and in others, from a fixed location. Even though competition is heavy, the group relies on regular customers that know their work and insist on their services. On the other hand, it is worth stressing that they put a lot of enthusiasm into their work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito tiene 42 años, está casado y tiene 6 hijos. Vive en la localidad de “Palmapampa” (selva central peruana), donde tienen su casa propia. 

En años anteriores trabajaba en el sector agrícola cultivando productos típicos de la selva tropical, pero actualmente se dedica a la carpintería, actividad que le brinda buenos resultados, por lo que ya tiene ganado clientes regulares. Es así que siempre le hacen pedidos de algún mueble y él lo trabajo acorde a los requerimientos de su cliente. Benito ya viene trabajando en su localidad desde haces 15 años y generalmente trabaja con sus ayudantes, pero cuando ellos descansan recibe la ayuda de sus familiares. Para el futuro piensa reincorporarse a la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de café, con el propósito de diversificar sus actividades y obtener mayores ganancias para su familia.

Este es su décimo sexto crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas en la fecha establecida. Con el dinero que esta vez solicita adquirirá dos motosierras para su taller de carpintería, de ese modo minimizará el tiempo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Benito is 42 years old and is married, with six children. He lives in the “Palmapampa,” the central Peruvian jungle, and has his own house. In years past, Benito worked in agriculture, growing products typical of the tropical region, but now, he works as a carpenter. This has worked well for him, and he now has several regular clients. They order a piece of furniture and he makes it according to their requirements. Benito has been working in this location for 15 years and usually works with assistants. When the assistants are not available, he receives help from his family. In the future, he would like to get back into agriculture, specifically the cultivation of coffee. This would diversify his activities and bring more earnings to his family. This is Benito’s 16th loan with MFP, and he has always made his payments on schedule. With this loan, he will buy two power saws for his woodworking shop. This will speed up production.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two power saws

loans.name: Monique

texts.en:
Monique N. is 55 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" in Thiékène for 9 years and has always paid back her loans on time.

She sells various products: clothes and shoes, cosmetics and fruit juice. She has a long experience in her business. This loan will allow her to purchase more of the products that she wants to resell.

loans.use: To buy products to bolster her shop

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch M. is 56 years-old and is a village bank president of her group which consists of twenty-seven members located in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province. Each member of this village loan will use it to support a different purpose. 

Mrs. Touch M. is a farmer who owns a one hectare field on which she cultivates rice. In order to support her farming, Mrs. Touch M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. Her husband, Mr. S. Eing, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family. Mrs. Touch M. is the mother of three children.  One child is a a seamstress in a garment factory, another a laborer and the youngest is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Momun

texts.en: Momun A. is married and has 3 children. He was born in 1979. Momun and his family live in Baku city. This man has been in his business for 6 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy buy fertilizers and seeds to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Xenia Jaquelin

texts.es:
La sra. Xenia G. es una mujer joven emprendedora que se dedica al negocio de pulperia,
Xenia es bien dedicada a su familia y en sus tiempos libres se dedica a sus estudios, todos los dias se levanta bien temprano para atender a sus clientes, Xenia vive con su madre y toda via Xenia no tiene esposo, es soltera 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor para su negocio y asi tener mejores ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Xenia G. is an enterprising young woman who manages her own store. She is dedicated to her family and attends classes in her free time. Every day, she wakes up early so that she can attend to her customers. Xenia is single and lives with her mother.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise in bulk for her business so that she can generate additional income to cover her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Sulatre's Group

texts.en: Teresita S. is from the village of Roxas. She is 60 years old and is the group leader of this two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is S.'s Group. Teresita is married and has five adult children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns on average approximately 3,000 PHP each month. In 2007, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets and feeds. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for hog-raising. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as aadditional capital for hog-raising

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack I. I. is 63 years old, widowed and has seven children between the ages of 38 and 28 years old. He describes himself as kind and trustworthy. He has been selling beauty products, including cosmetics, handbags and even shoes. His business is located along the busy Kakamega Webuye highway. He has been doing this business for the last three months now. He says that this business is profitable and his major challenge is low sales since the business is still new. He is working very hard to keep his business doing well. 

Meshack I. I. is using his loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to boost his current stock of shoes, handbags and cosmetics. He hopes to be a wholesaler of beauty products.

loans.use: To buy handbags, shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Luz Beatriz

texts.es:
Luz Beatriz P. P. tiene 56 años.  Es sotera vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar en el Recinto Delicia. Tiene 2 hijos, Jose (5) y Lucia (8). 

 Luz es una socia de la ventanilla rural El Progreso La Delicia Recinto que pertenece a la Parroquia San José del Tambo, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a sembrar cacao y maíz. 

Luz se dedica a la agricultura, siembra en ciclo cortó maíz.  Realiza sus compras cada mes de los productos y de los insumos para la siembra en los Agro servicios de AGRIPAD y vende los productos en el Mercado de Mata de Cacao.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos de maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener buena cosecha y tener mejor ingreso económico. El desafío que enfrentamos es en tiempo ya que se puede dar plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta trabajar y pasar tiempo con la madre y con los hijos.
texts.en:
Luz Beatriz P. P. is 56 years old. She is single, and she lives in the Chillanes canton, Bolívar province, Delicia precint. She has two children, 5 year old Jose and 8 year old Lucia. Luz is a member of the El Progreso La Delicia Precint Communal Bank, which belongs to the San José Parrish of Tambo. This communal bank is comprised of 19 members. The community devotes itself to growing cacao and corn. Luz devotes herself to farming. She plants corn, which has a short growth cycle. Every month she buys the products and supplies for planting from the Agro services of AGRIPAD (a wholesaler of agricultural supplies). She sells her products at the Mata de Cacao Market. She is requesting the loan to buy corn supplies. She thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. Her dream is to have a good harvest and to have greater income. The challenge that confronts her is that in time pests and illnesses could harm the plants. She likes to work and spend time with her mother and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn supplies

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati K. is 32 and married with two children aged 14 and 10. In 2008, she established her poultry business. Working 6 days a week, 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received, and successfully repaid, 8 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase chicks. In the future, Saraswati plans to send her children to private school. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: purchase chicks

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo Méndez Castañeda y su esposa son una familia muy unida que se apoya mutuamente. El señor sale todas las mañanas a trabajar en un constructora como conductor. Su esposa tiene su negocio de la venta de frituras y dulces que ella mima empaqueta para venderlos a un buen precio a los niños quienes son los que más le compran. Para seguir teniendo más ingresos requieren un préstamo para comprar mas mercancía.
texts.en:
Arturo Méndez Castañeda and his wife are a close-knit family who supports one another. Every morning, Arturo leaves for his job at a construction site as a driver. His wife has a business selling fried foods and sweets. She packages these items and sells them at a good price to children who are most likely to buy them. To continue generating more income, Arturo needs a loan to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana es de 57 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo varón y una mujer, es comerciante, en la actividad tiene quince años de experiencia, solicita su segundo crédito, para la compra de Muebles en Color Natural, compra de Pintura y Barniz el cual es una inversión rentable, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajadora, por tal motivo no tendrá inconvenientes para pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana, 57, is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. She has operated a business for fifteen years. She is applying for her second loan so that she can buy unpainted furniture, paint and varnish, supplies that she needs for her business. Her personal references indicate that she is a responsible, hard-working person and, consequently, a good credit risk.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stock and supplies for furniture business.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es: Maria Gloria M. M. tiene 30 años de edad, reside en la Colonia Nazareth junto a su familia que esta conformada por su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos de 8 y 9 años. Maria Gloria es una persona muy simpatica y muy conocida por sus vecinos. Desde hace varios años ella y su esposo se dedican a la venta de helados. Ella vende en el domicilio y su esposo de forma ambulante de pulperia en pulperia. Una de las dificultades que enfrentan es que el corte de energia electrica es muy comun en la ciudad y ellos no cuentan con una planta electrica asi que en muchas ocasiones tienen perdidas, ya que los helados se derriten. El prestamo que solicita lo necesita para comprar mas productos como Ice Cream, paletas de uva, fresa, nance, coco, limon, etc y asi incrementar su inventario y poder ofrecer mas variedad a sus clientes. Su meta es poder tener su propia fabrica de helados y construir su casa propia, y que sus hijos sigan estudiando ya que son unos niños muy aplicados.
texts.en:
Maria Gloria M. M. is 30 years old resides in colonia Nazareth in Juticalpa, Olancho. Maria lives with her family that is made up of her husband and two small children who are 8 and 9 years old. Maria Gloria is a very nice person and very popular amongst her neighbors. For many years she and her husband have been selling ice cream. She sells from their home while her husband sells from different grocery stores. One of the biggest challenges they face is that their are often power outages in their city and they do not have a generator. When the power goes out they lose money as their ice cream melts. The loan they are soliciting will be used to buy ice cream, and grape, strawberry, coconut, lemon popsicles in order to increase their inventory and offer their clients more variety. Their goal is to open their own ice cream production facility and build their own home and that their children continue to study since their currently very enthralled in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar helados

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita M. is from the town of Talibon. She is 42 years old. Lolita is married and has 7 children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making "puto" (rice cakes) and other delicacies for sale. Lolita also makes bread and dreams of having her own bakeshop someday.

Lolita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Almaz

texts.en:
Almaz A. is 38 years old, married and has two children. Almaz is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family.
Nine years ago, Almaz had the idea of starting to raise cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in her house for this business. Slowly, the number of cows increased and with them, her customers started asking for more and more. Her monthly income is about 250 to 300 AZN and she would like to increase it to 500 AZN. With an endless list of requests, Almaz has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN. She will use this loan to purchase three baby calves. Almaz started her business with a loan from Kiva partner, Aqroinvest, and is recommended as a good client.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag D. is 50 years old and lives with her two children in Uvurhangai Province, central Mongolia. They all live together in her ger, a traditional Mongolian tent home, in her sibling's yard. One son recently finished his bachelor’s degree and works as an engineer at the local mine.

Tungalag is a pharmacist and had worked in a drug store till 2001. Since then, she started to operate her own pharmaceutical business in the local market. In addition, she began to supplement her pharmacy earnings by selling a variety of cosmetic products and accessories such as bags, manicure sets, etc.

Tungalag stopped operating her pharmacy when pharmacies without licenses were forbidden to sell medicine. Her cosmetics trade then became her main business from 2003 on. Her other son lives and works in Korea and helps by sending cosmetics to her. She stocks up two to three times a month.

Tungalag is a very optimistic, diligent and hardworking woman. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more cosmetics and accessories for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị (20201030006) is a 71-year-old woman who lives in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 6 adult children.  To making a living, L. owns and operates a business in which she makes and sells bamboo products to local businesses and community members.  L. has been engaged in this business for over 26 years and earns approximately 4.300.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.944.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  L. is now requesting a new loan of 8.736.000 VND to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be L.'s fifth loan from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Nguyễn Thị (20201030006) là 71 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 6 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, L. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng tre cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 26 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 4.300.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.736.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  L. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Kor

texts.en:
Mrs. Kor S. is a 51-year-old married woman. She is villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. Her husband helps her in the farming business. They have five children, all of whom are single. Three of them are employed as garment workers at a fixed salary per month. 

Currently, Mrs. Kor S.'s cow is getting old and it can’t support the plowing. Mrs. Kor S. is looking for a loan to buy a cow to replace the old one.

loans.use: To buy a new cow

loans.name: Bonifride

texts.en:
Bonifride owns a boutique with different items. She is 25 years old and married to a businessman with two children who are between three and five years old. She sells various items such as beans, soaps, salt and rice. Bonifride has been in this business for five years. 

She has requested this loan to add more items for the growth of sales in her business. She expects to make savings and to purchase more merchandise with the profits, and dreams of having a large shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beans, soaps and rice to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace T. is married and has two children. Her husband works in construction. Grace has been selling cooked rice and sweet potatoes at Abura  for three years. Grace assists her husband in feeding, clothing and educating her children. More sweet potatoes are demanded by her customers and so she is asking to use the loan to purchase more to expand her business. She plans to reinvest the additional income back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sweet potatoes to cook for sale

loans.name: Gonzalo Angel

texts.en: O. is 48 years old, married and has four children, ages 22, 21, 19 and 17. His youngest daughter studies in public school. They live in Isla Trinitaria, in the Southern part of Guayaquil. This area has scant basic services but luckily O.’s home, made of concrete, has electricity and water. O. is a businessman who always tries to find and sell products that are in high demand at the moment. At the time of this interview, O. was making monigotes with the help of his sons. These monigotes are dolls made of paper maché and stuffed with sawdust and fireworks. It is a tradition in Ecuador to burn these dolls on New Year’s Eve, symbolizing the ending of the old year and the beginning of the New Year. O. and his sons work every day from 8 am until 6 pm. They plan to invest this loan in paint and fireworks for the monigotes. Even though his business is doing fine, O. and his wife have had some health issues lately. O. suffers from swollen legs and his wife, who takes care of the house, recently had surgery. O.’s dream is to finish his house.

loans.use: To buy paint and fireworks for monigotes (dolls for New Year's Eve)

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret N. is 47 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, none of whom are currently in school. Margret has a small shop, which she has run for less than one year. Margret enjoys sitting in her shop.
To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar and soap for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Margret hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Ajwang

texts.en: Ajwang is 28 years old, married and has a five-month-old child.  He works as a mechanic to earn a living.  He started the business after graduating from college eight years ago.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has developed a culture of saving his money.  He aspires to own a garage in the future.  Being a member of Lenana Road group in Faulu Kenya, he has been guaranteed a loan of 50,000 Kes by the members. With the loan, he will buy a spraying machine.

loans.use: To buy a spraying machine

loans.name: Kadidia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadidia B. a plus de 30 ans, mariée et mère de deux fillettes, vivant avec son époux et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou I-Kapel Kourou, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Kadidia B. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et  de vente d’huile alimentaire, de couscous arabe,  de cube maggie et bien d’autres divers  articles depuis plus de six années. Elle mène son activité à la maison et au marché de son quartier où elle dispose  d’une place. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  depuis plus de deux ans. Elle est actuellement à son 4ème prêt  dont les précédents ont été bien remboursés.
 Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 7 bidons d’huile alimentaire, 5 cartons de couscous arabe, 10 cartons de maggie, 3 cartons du thé Arawane et de stock de condiments. Elle  achète ses marchandises sur commande à Bobo Dioulasso (république de Burkina Faso) et aussi dans les huileries de  la place avant de les revendre en détail au marché de leur localité.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Kadidia B. is 30-something years old, married, and the mother of two little girls. She lives with her husband and their children in Sanoubougou I-Kapel Kourou, an outlying district of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many business unsuccessfully, Kadidia became familiar with buying and selling cooking oil, Arab couscous, Maggie bouillon cubes, and many other types of goods. She has been in this business for over six years and runs it out of her house and at the market in her district, where she has a spot at her disposal. She is in high demand by her customers for the quality of her products.

To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, Kadidia decided to join again the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso over two years ago. She is currently on her fourth loan. The previous ones have all been repaid. 

She intends to use her loan to buy:  7 containers of cooking oil, 5 boxes of Arab couscous, 10 boxes of Maggie bouillon cubes, 3 boxes of Arawane tea, and a supply of condiments. She buys her merchandise by special order in Bobo Dioulasso (Republic of Burkina Faso) and also from local oil mills, and then she sells them retail at the market in their town.

With this loan, Kadidia envision making a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially for helping with family expenses and paying the loan interest. The rest will be used for investing in her business.

loans.use: Buying condiments

loans.name: Mattu

texts.en: This is 48 year-old Mattu.  She is married and has 3 children aged 20, 14 and 12. She has 3 additional dependents who live with her because they are her relatives. In 2005, Mattu established her clothing business. She began her business after acquiring a wealth of experience from her late mother, who introduced her to the clothing business. Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She needs a loan of Le 4,000,000. Mattu requires a loan in order to buy additional wax, cotton, lace, and linen materials. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. In the future, Mattu plans to get a permanent shop and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing for her business to resell

loans.name: Miriam Gladys

texts.es:
Miriam de 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora que vino de Manabí hace 6 años. Se inicio con ventas de  bebida. Con el apoyo de su hermana se propuso a tener una asociación de expendedores de bebidas. 

Ahora tiene su puesto de ambulante en el Malecón de Playas. En la cual labora todo el día vendiendo aguas colas jugos etc. Está  casada con Victor García quien labora en ventas de helados. Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas para incrementar sus ventas. Su meta más deseada es tener su propio local para poder darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Miriam is a hard-working woman of 28 who came to Manabí 6 years ago.  She started out selling drinks.  With the support of her sister, she set out to form an association of drinks sellers.

Miriam now sells her products as an itinerant street vendor in Malecón de Playas.  She works every day selling water, Coke, juice, etc.  Miriam is married to Victor García who sells ice cream.  She would like to use her loan to buy drinks in order to increase her sales.  Her most important goal is to own her own premises so that she can provide her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy juice, Coke and water

loans.name: La Familia Renacer 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group La Familia Renacer (The Family is Reborn)1 & 2, and her story is representative of the members of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. 

Ana´s group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, a city known for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home in a simple structure with her three children. She enjoys attending church to sing and to preach.

Ana is excited to be taking out her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a colmado, or small general store, by stocking rice, beans, cooking oil, spaghetti, sauces, canned products and flour. She will use the profits to re-invest in her business.  She wants to have an improved business in order to reach her dream of one day opening a supermarket and having enough money to travel to Jerusalem. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, spaghetti, sauces, canned products and flour

loans.name: María Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “María Auxiliadora”, está constituido  por 15  señoras muy activas y solidarias que constantemente se hallan realizando actividades para la comunidad y para recaudar fondos para el grupo.
Ellas tienen actividades diferentes y algunas emprenderán una nueva labor, están en el Décimo Segundo Ciclo.
Estas mujeres son muy preparadas para las microempresas a las que se dedican, cada una conoce exactamente sus rubros, incluyendo sus riesgos y ventajas, por eso solicitan el crédito para poder incrementar sus inversiones y ganancias.
La sra. Mirian posee una cantina, desde donde provee con los mejores productos comestibles a todos los individuos que acuden a su negocio, en especial a aquellos trabajadores que no pueden ir a sus casas para la hora de la comida, del almuerzo.
Ella gana buenas referencias gracias a sus buenos servicios, por ende logra tener mayores ingresos eocnómicos para mantener y sustentar de manera estable a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar panificados, carnes, embutidos, verduras, frutas, etc.
texts.en:
The committee calls itself "Maria Auxiliadora" and is made up of 15 very active and unified women who always find themselves doing activities for the community and raising funds for the group. They have different businesses and some will start a new line of work. They are in their 12th cycle.

These women are very prepared for their small businesses, each one knows her line of work well, including the risks and benefits. For this reason they asked for a loan to be able to increase their investments and earnings.

Mirian owns a cantina where she sells the best food products to everyone who comes to her store, especially the workers who can't go home on their lunch hour. She gets good references thanks to her good service, and consequently she has achieved better income for maintaining and sustaining her family in stable way. 

She asks for this loan to be able to buy baked goods, meats, sausages, vegetables, fruits, etc.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, meats, sausages, vegetables, fruits, etc

loans.name: Thuthukani Group

texts.en:
Thenjiswa is 53 years old and single, with five children between the ages of 2 and 38. Two of them attend school. She also cares for one additional relative. She runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Emandeni, South Africa. In the photo she is standing on the far right wearing a white hat.

She's been in this business for three years, selling fruits and vegetables in the mall. She also receives income from the government's children's grant. She says that the main challenges to her business are customers who buy on credit and fail to pay on time, because that will delay her profit.

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses to buy face cloths, table cloths, fruits and vegetables. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her send her children to the higher educational institutions and build a house for her family. In future she would like to own a fruit and vegetable market and a small farm where she can do her planting. 

In her comments, she adds that WDB and Kiva have been a help to them because she does not qualify for a loan from banks.

loans.use: to buy face cloths, table cloths, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 43 years old and lives in the Paynesville area.  She is married and her husband is a contractor at a construction firm.  They have four children between the ages of 15 and 27, who are all in school. 

Lucia runs a mini pastry shop in her community where she has a lot of customers.  Her doughnuts and breads are popular and get sold before 10:00 a.m.  Lucia is requesting a loan to purchase more sugar and butter for her business.  She plans to make more money and send her children to quality schools.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar and butter for her bakery

loans.name: Jantoyerela  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe JANTOYERELA 2 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant dans des  familles polygames à NIANTANSO, un des villages de la commune de KOLOKOBA, préfecture de Sikasso, (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien  remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée par ce groupe d’homme  est le maïs à instar de ABDOULAYE (le premier débout, en chemise noire, la houe sur l'épaule).
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte payer les frais de labour, acheter de l’engrais et de l’herbicide. 
Les productions du groupe sont vendues au niveau du marché de Farakala et au marché de Sikasso après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
ABDOULAYE compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 000 par campagne qui sera utilisé pour  prendre en charge les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven members of the JANTOYERELA 2 group are married men with an average age of 38 and four children. They live in polygamous families in NIANTANSO, one of the villages of the commune of KOLOKOBA, Sikasso prefecture, (third administrative region of Mali). 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural endeavors during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution and the prior loans were reimbursed correctly. 

The crop this group of men cultivate is maize, as does for example ABDOULAYE. With this new loan he intends to pay for plowing, fertilizer, and herbicide. 

The group's crops are sold at the market of Farakala and the market of Sikasso after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. 

ABDOULAYE expects to make an average profit of 120,000 per season which will be used to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, fertilizer, and herbicides.

loans.name: Chrisitine

texts.en:
Chrisitine is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children. 

For the past two years, she has operated a water vending business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the hot dry season, the availability of water for supply is lower and demand is higher compared to the cold, rainy season when the availability of water for supply is higher and demand is lower.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase a water tank to store water for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 46-year-old businessman in quarry mining. He is married to Mary. They are blessed with three children, ages thirteen, nine and four. He has been in the business for the past ten years with a monthly income of about 10,000 KES (~$114) which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to purchase tools and equipment for his quarrying business. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children and purchase another quarry area. 

His hopes are to support his family financially and improve their living standard.

loans.use: To purchase tools and equipment for his quarrying business.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.fr:
Cliente de 42 ans, celibataire avec 4 enfants a sa charge,apres son divorce en 2007, pour subveenir au besoins des ses enfants, elle se lance dans le commerce des friperies comme ballot de je pantalon en jeans, body, et des marinieres pour enfants et adultes.
Sa strategie est de jouer sur son stock, avoir plusieurs articles et jouer sur le prix.Ses revenus sont considerables, elle vend en moyenne 8000 a 25000frs. 

A l'octroi de son pret elle va acheter des ballots de jeans, ballot de body et des marinieres pour enfant , hommes et dames.
A l'avenir elle veut ouvrir un depot de friperie , aller acheter a Kinshasa et Pointe Noire et avec les benefices , elle epargne pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et s'occuper aussi de la scolarite de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This customer is 42 years old, single and has four children in her care. In order to provide for her children's needs after her divorce in 2001 she began selling second-hand clothes, such as bundles of jeans, body stockings and smocks for children and adults. Her strategy is to play with her stock, have several different articles and play on the prices. Her income is significant, she sells on average between 8,000 and 25,000 francs.

Once she has been granted her loan she is going to buy bundles of jeans, body stockings and smocks for children, men and women. In the future she would like to open a second-hand clothing store, go to Kinshasa and Pointe Noire to buy goods, and with the profits to save money in order to provide for her family's needs and also take car of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy bundles of jeans, body suits, smocks

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Teresa tiene ya más de 23 años dedicándose a la venta de muebles para el hogar. 
Solicita un préstamo para invertir en comprar más muebles más modernos ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la inversión y sus clientes le están solicitando varios tipos de muebles. No cuenta con el capital necesario para invertir. 
Doña Maria Teresa planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá con la inversión, ya que su esposo el señor Benedicto se encargara de los gastos familiares.
Desea mejorar la inversión de su negocio y de su familia, también quiere contratar a dos personas para darles trabajo en las ventas y así ayudarlos económicamente.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Teresa already has more than 23 years of experience selling household furniture. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of more modern furniture, but she does not have the necessary funds to make this investment. Her customers are requesting all types of furniture, but she does not have the necessary capital for this investment.

Doña Maria Teresa plans to repay the loan using the profits she earns from this investment. Her husband Sr. Benedicto takes care of the family expenses.

Maria Teresa wants to improve the investment in her business and in her family. She also wants to hire two employees so that she can give them sales jobs and help them financially.

loans.use: to buy furniture to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies, chicken, meat and fish.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es: José Alejandro de 30 años de edad solicita su 4to crèdito para arreglar la vivienda donde habita,  pues algunas paredes estan dañadas y quiere fortalecerlas para seguridad de su familia, cuenta con el apoyo de su compañera de vida que tambien trabaja por eso ambos comparten con los gastos familiares y con el pago de sus cuotas, tiene buenas referencias comerciales, personales y laborales. Su amyor sueño en la vida es que su familia goze de salud y seguir estudiando para adquirir nuevos conocimientos.
texts.en: José Alejandro is 30 and is requesting his fourth credit to make repairs to his home where he lives.  Some of the walls are damaged, and he wants to reinforce them for the security of his family.  He has the support of his wife, who also works.  They both share their family's expenses, and with their wages, they have good commercial, personal, and work references.  His biggest dream in life is that his family enjoys health and to keep studying to gain new knowledge.

loans.use: To make repairs to his home.

loans.name: Ana Antonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Ana Antonia es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria con muchos años de experiencia ya que casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a esta actividad, es madre soltera de tres hijos los cuales todos son independientes criándolos y preparándolos profesionalmente sola con su esfuerzo propio de su trabajo.
Tiene muchos años de trabajar con ceprodel donde se le han otorgado 9 préstamos para su vivienda la que ha mejorado poco a poco. Una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir un crédito para la compra de ladrillos y pago de mano de obra, ya que es el material faltante que tiene para terminar de construir su cocina con todas sus condiciones.
texts.en:
Ana Antonia is from the town of El Sauce.  She works as an elementary school teacher and has many years experience as she has worked almost her whole life in this job.  She is the single mother of three children who live independently.  She raised them and prepared them professionally on her own through her hard work in her job.

Ana Antonia has been working with Ceprodel for many years and has received nine home loans which she has used to gradually improve her home.  One of the needs she has right now is that of obtaining a loan to buy bricks and pay labor costs.  She lacks these materials which she needs to finish building her kitchen.

loans.use: to buy bricks and pay labor costs

loans.name: Anilyn

texts.en:
Anilyn is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Anilyn has a shop where she sells pillows, clothing & beauty products. She has had this business for 1 year. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stock like clothing & pillows from DAKKI & AVON to sell.

Anilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Anilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks like clothing & pillows for sell from DAKKI & AVON.

loans.name: Ligia Irene

texts.es:
La Señora. Ligia es socia del banco comunal Pan de Azúcar, vive por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, por la calidez y gentileza de su gente, esta ciudad cautiva con su variada  gastronomía.

Doña Ligia tiene 40 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 19 y 8 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión vendedor, no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. Ligia es de profesión costurera y labora en esta actividad 25 años, trabaja en su taller de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de telas, hilos, botones, cierres y otros materiales de costura para su negocio, también va a comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos.

Su meta es comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Ligia is a member of the Pan de Azúcar (Sugar Loaf) Communal Bank. She lives in a beautiful part of the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its beautiful architecture, its warm and friendly people, and its captivating and varied gastronomy.

Ligia, age 40, is married and has two children, ages 19 and 8.  Her first child is in high school, and her second child goes to a school in the city.  Her husband is a salesman.  They do not have their own house; they rent where they live.

Ligia is a seamstress and has been working in this profession for 25 years.  She works in her seamstress shop from Monday through Saturday.  She does not have a fixed schedule.

This is her second loan in the communal bank.  She will use it to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and other sewing supplies for her business.  She will also buy school supplies for her children.

Her goal is to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Luvy Jeaneth

texts.es: Luvy Jeaneth se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa nueva. Hace más de 9 años que tiene este negocio, tiene un hijo bajo su cargo. Inicio esta actividad viajando a costa rica y con la ayuda de su esposo pudieron establecerse aquí y empezar este medio de vida. El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar pantalones, camisas, faldas, pantalones, ropa interior, ropa para niños entre otros. Espera con esta inversión aumentar sus ganancias. El sueño de Luvy es aumentar su capital en ganancias y darle mejor vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Luvy Jeaneth buys and sells new clothing.  She has been in this business for more than nine years.  She has one child in her care.  Luvy started this business traveling to Costa Rica and, with the help of her husband, they were able to settle there and start out in this line of work.

Luvy will use this loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, underwear, children's clothes, etc.  She hopes to be able to increase her profits through this investment.  Her dream is to increase her profits and provide her son with a better life.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, underwear and children's clothes

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 26 years old, single, and supporting two of his brothers. He sells fuel and he has been in business for four years. Right now his monthly income from the business is KES 7,000. He is borrowing a loan of KES 10,000, which he intends to use to purchase paraffin for sale.

He plans to pay back the loan and to expand his business with the anticipated profit from the business. This is his first loan and his hope and dream is to open his own filling station.

loans.use: to purchase paraffin for sale

loans.name: Villamor

texts.en: Villamor owns and manages his corn field. He has been managing it for almost 20 years. According to him, he is able to earn about P30,000 per cropping season. Villamor's income goes to his family's daily needs, allowances, and school fees of his children, and some is used for the payment of electric bills. His funds are insufficient to maintain and buy some farm inputs for his business. So for this reason, he is asking for additional capital amounting to P27,000 to be used in buying farm inputs such as fertilizer, certified seeds, and insecticides for the maintenance of his business. Although Villamor encountered some difficulties in his farming business, he still believes that he could overcome all those things. He hopes that he can be a successful farmer someday through the help of his family members and through the financial assistance given to him. With this success in life, he could give a better education to his three children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, certified seeds, and insecticides for maintenance of his business.

loans.name: Emilie

texts.en:
Emilie is 37 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 13 years, Emilie has run a spice-selling business in the Philippines. 

Emile is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more spices to sell in her stall. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spices to sell in her stall

loans.name: Enoque

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 1  filho ainda menor de idade. Fez o nivel basico e naõ continuou devido as dificuldades financeiras. Vive  na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta ninguem.

É comerciante vende produtos diversos no mercado de Boane ha mais de 7 anos, onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria e atravez de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo comerciante que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos para reforçar o seu negocio (massas, ovos, arroz, farinha, cervejas, refrescos, oleo e outros). O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 11.000.00mt, e foi para o negocio. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria como forma de aumentar o seu rendimento, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Enoque was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. He is married and has one young son. He finished middle school but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
He's been selling a variety of products in the Boane market for more than seven years. He earns about 10,000 meticals a month, which he uses to cover household expenses. He is also able to save a small amount through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings). 
He's never had a loan from other banks. He heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is a businessman and also a client of the institution.
This is his second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he will use to buy products (eggs, rice, flour, beer, soft drinks, oil, etc.) to strengthen his business. His first loan was in the amount of 11,000 meticals, which he also invested in his business. He is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to expand the quantity of his stock to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy products (eggs, rice, flour, beer, soft drinks, oil, etc.) to strengthen his business.

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru: Уктам женат, имеет 3-х детей. Раньше работал в вата-чесальном цеху, но от этого цеха прибыли было мало. Он решил закрыть это дело и заняться откормом скота. У него дома тогда было 2 коровы.
