Корова каждый день давала до 20 литров молока и соседи покупали у него молочные продукты, а внуки каждый день завтракали  только молочными продуктами. За коров ему предлагали большую сумму, но он не хотел продавать, так как это являлось основным доходом.  Узнав в 2007 году о нашей организации получил у нас кредит приобрел еще одного быка. Вскоре он начал размножать свой скот и продавать его. За период сотрудничества в течении 4 лет, он арендовал за пределами города участок земли и приобрел еще 2 коров и 2 быков. Все лето он  провел на этом участке земли и за стоимость каждого проданного скота сажал на этом участке земли редьку и морковь, а сейчас продает урожай. В зимний период скот дешевле, чем в теплую погоду, поэтому на полученный кредит он собирается купить еще 4 коров. Сейчас он и его семья благодарны кредиторам за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Uktam is married and has three children.  He previously worked at a cotton-ball processing facility, but his profit there was low.  He decided to close that business and get involved in fattening up livestock.  He has two cows at that time.  Each cow produced up to 20 liters of milk daily, and neighbors bought dairy products from Uktam, and his grandsons had only dairy products for breakfast.  Uktam was offered a large amount of money for his cows, but he did not want to sell because this was his main source of income.  Having learned about our organization in 2007, Uktam obtained a loan from us and purchased one more bull.  Soon after, he started to breed and sell livestock.  Throughout the four-year partnership, he leased a plot of land outside the town and purchased two more cows and two more bulls.  He spent the entire summer on that land and planted radish and carrots there, using the money from each sold livestock.  And now, he sells his harvest.  Livestock is cheaper during winter than during warm seasons, and this is why Uktam plans to use this loan to purchase four more cows.  Currently, he and his family are grateful to the creditors for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Yuuliana vive en el distrito de los Olivos, tiene una familia grande sus 4 hijos aun están en edad escolar, junto a su esposo luchan para sacar adelante a su familia, es así que  ahorrando algo de dinero  han podido comprar un carro que alquilan para realizar servicio de taxi, el ingreso que le genera el alquiler de su carro es de mucha ayuda  así puede brindarle a su hijos una buena educación y comprar algunos artículos para su hogar, el préstamo que le otorga EDAPROSPO le será de mucha ayuda para la reparación y mantenimiento del carro, de esa manera podrá seguir alquilándolo, Yuuliana es la tesorera del grupo “CORAZON DE JESUS” ya tiene cerca de 2 años integrando el ALCOM, ella quiere seguir ahorrando para lograr comprarse otro vehículo.

*Yuuliana viste polo fuccia.
texts.en:
Yuuliana lives in the District of Los Olivos. She has a large family that includes four school-age children. She and her husband strive together to move their family forward. After saving some money, she was able to buy a car to rent out for taxi services. The income generated from renting out her car has been a great help because it has provided her children with a good education. Yuuliana was also able to buy a few items for her home.

The loan being provided by EDAPROSPO will be a great help in repairing and maintaining her vehicle so that it can continue to be available for rent. Yuuliana is the treasurer of the group “Corazon de Jesus” (Heart of Jesus) and has been a member of the Communal Bank for nearly two years. She wants to continue saving so that she can purchase another vehicle.

*Yuuliana is seen wearing a fuchsia-colored polo shirt.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance and repairs to her taxi.

loans.name: Ndatte

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée, mère de deux filles qui vont toutes à l'école.Elle exerce le commerce d'huile d'arachide. Elle achète le produit dans les villages environnants de sa ville auprès des femmes qui transforment les graines d'arachide en huile.Grâce à la forte demande de cet huile,beaucoup moins chère que celui industrielle,elle arrive à obtenir des revenus assez consistants.Elle prend ainsi en charge les frais de scolarité de ses filles ainsi que leurs dépenses d'habillement.Elle soutient aussi son mari dans les dépenses d'alimentation de la famille.Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un prêt de 150000f pour acheter 200 litres d'huile d'arachide. Son ambition est d'implanter une cantine au marché central de sa localité.
texts.en: The borrower is a married woman, mother of two daughters who both go to school. She sells ground nut oil. She buys this product in the villages around her city from women who convert the nuts into oil. Thanks to the strong demand for this oil, much cheaper than the industrial version, she successfully gets quite consistent revenues. Thus she takes care of the school fees of her daughters as well as their clothing expenses. She also supports her husband in their spending to feed the family. To strengthen her business, she is asking for a loan of 150000f to buy 200 liters of ground nut oil. Her ambition is to establish a canteen at the central market in her area.

loans.use: to buy 200 liters of ground nut oil.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
From Sibutad, Zamboanga del Sur, Gemma is married and blessed with four siblings, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a farmer, while she has been planting and harvesting flowers for sale for the past three years, earning about 2,500 Php per month.

Gemma, who joined GDMPC in 2010 to get funds to help improve her living conditions and to expand her business, is now requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 Php to purchase flowers, fertilizers, and pesticides. She plans to reinvest the additional income arising from the loan back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase flowers, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: York's Group

texts.en: Originally from Moung Russey district of Battambag province, York is 43 years old and a father of three children. Now, he still needs to support only one schoolchild. For his family, rice farming is the solely source of income for his entire family and he has occupied in this busines for 20 years. This is the first loan for York and his co-borrowers in a group consisting of four and York is the leader. For Yor, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for his cash-crop farming. He hopes that he can succeed in his rice cropping so that he can improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for his cash-crop farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more animals for milk production.

loans.name: Azad

texts.en:
56-year-old Azad with his 4 children settled in Sumgait city. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Gubadli region. Since 2002 Azad has been engaged in animal sales to improve his family’s living condition. As he did not have enough funds, he could not develop his business well enough in the beginning. Having borrowed 2 loans ($500; $800;) from Normicro, Azad significantly expanded his business, bought 11 sheep, achieved progress in his business and increased his family income. The loans were paid back in a timely manner.
He applies for a loan amount of $1200 to buy 12 sheep.

loans.use: To buy 12 sheep.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: “The more you plant the more you get” – that’s Maria’s motto.  Taro farming is hard work, and when her husband begs off of working on the plantation, Maria keeps her motto in mind and walks the many miles to her farm to tend her taro plants.  She hauls her taro to market twice a week and is usually able to sell the bulk of her supply.  Her hard work earns up to ST 300 – 400 (approximately USD 120 – 160) a week for her family.  As the committed farmer in the family, Maria joined the SPBD program to keep reinvesting in her farm and keep the land, equipment and plants in good condition.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers, knives, taro plants

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. L. is 53 yrs old and lives in Hung Nguyen, a deeply Catholic area of poor central Vietnam. She has 13 children aged from 11 to 36, 7 sons and 6 daughters. They had barely enough food some years ago. They raise pigs, poultry and cows. Now two sons have found jobs as builders in the city. Mrs. L. wants to use the loan to build a barn and to repair her house.

loans.use: To build a barn

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mrs. Suon P. is 42 years old and lives with her ailing husband and seven children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To supplement her household, Suon P. works very hard in a garment factory, and earns around $3 each day. Two of her children are employed at a garment factory and generally make $100 each month. Her other chilren attend school.

Mrs. Suon P. humbly requests a loan of $300 to purchase pigs to breed and sell for additional income.

loans.use: Purchase pigs to breed

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Mahbuba’s core business is wholesale of food products (on the photo Mahbuba has just arrived with a new batch of goods). She buys her products in the neighboring Uzbekistan. Although this is not an easy business, it is also Mahbuba’s only source of income, so she cannot give it up. Most food vendors on the Spitamen’s market are Mahbuba’s clients. In the morning, Mahbuba delivers and distributes the goods. In the evening, the retail vendors come to Mahbuba to pay for the products they sold. Mahbuba, 48, is married. Mahbuba’s husband is jobless and all the responsibility for the family is on Mahbuba’s shoulders. Prior MicroInvest loans helped Mahbuba grow her business. This loan she plans to use to expand her business further.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Основная деятельность Махбубы – оптовая реализация продуктов питания. (на фото Махбуба только что привезла новую партию продуктов питания). Чтобы закупить товар она выезжает в соседнюю республику Узбекистан. Это сопряжено с трудностями, но так как другого источника дохода у нее нет то она вынуждена этим заниматься. На базаре Спитамена почти все являются клиентами Махбубы. Утром она занимается раздачей продуктов питания а вечером предприниматели рассчитываются с нею деньгами. На следующий день Махбуба выезжает за новой партией товара. Махбубе 48 лет, она замужем. Ее муж ничем не занимается и все бремя семейных расходов лежит на ней. Займ Микроинвест помог ей расширить бизнес и получить дополнительную прибыль. Новый займ она потратит на дальнейшее расширение.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru:
Bahodur A., 27, is married and has 2 children. Bahodur’s main business is cattle farming and sales. He has been in business for 4 years. Bahodur A. plans to use this loan to purchase several animals, feed and sell them every 40-45 days. After sale, Bahodur plans to purchase a new batch of cattle and use the profits to sustain his family. He plans to repay the loan with 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Азамов Баходур, возраст – 27 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 2-х детей. Основной вид деятельности которым занимается клиент это разведение и продажа крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он заниамется уже в течение 4 лет. На полученый кредит клиент планирует несколько голов крупного рогатого скота, который после откормки, через каждые 40-45 дней будет продаваться. После продажи он планиркет приобретать новую партию скота, а прибыль используьет для содержание семьи, так как других источников дохода лу него нет, в связи с отсутсвием рабочих мест с хорошей заработной платой. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and sales of cattle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary BA. is a trader who buys corn wholesale to sell. She also prepares ‘kenkey’ a native food which is in  high demand. She is a single parent of 4 children and  works very hard to support the family. She wants to increase sales in order to increase her income.

She is asking for $1,200 in additional capital to buy more corn to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more corn to meet the demand of her costumers.

loans.name: Tahire

texts.en: Tahire K. owns and operates a furniture store in the small northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Tahire has already repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit, thus proving to be one of our trusted and valued customers. She is currently looking for funding so that she can make improvements in her store.

loans.use: To make improvements to her store

loans.name: Marcelina Tulia's Group

texts.en:
Felicitas, Norma, and Marcelina are members of the “Virgen del Carmen” community bank. Felicitas and Marcelina have been members for ten years, while Norma joined three years ago. They are all from the district of Pacaycasa, which is 30 minutes outsiD. of the city of Ayacucho. In the bank, they have learned to save, how to manage their business, to be responsible, punctual, to have self-esteem, and to respect others.

Felicitas is 58 years old. She is married and has seven children, two of whom live with her. Felicitas buys tara, a local tree used to make industrial products, and cochinilla, an insect used to make red dye, in Pacaycasa, and then sell them in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, seasonally, Felicitas collects tuna, a local fruit that comes from a cactus, and sells them in Ayacucho.

Norma is 23 years old. She is a single mother and has one daughter. Norma buys tuna, cochinilla, and tara and sells them to middlemen in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Norma makes bricks, which she later sells to others who fire them. With her new loan, Norma will open a new business selling vegetables from the jungle region of Ayacucho.

Marcelina is 41 years old. She is married and has three children. Marcelina has a store where she sells food, such as, flour, rice and sugar. Her store is located in the central square of Pacaycasa. In addition, Marcelina buys tara, cochinilla, and lucama, a local fruit, and sells them to middlemen.

Felicitas, Norma, and Marcelina need loans of 300, 1500, and 900 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in tara, cochinilla, vegetables, sugar, rice, oil, and noodles.

Felicitas, Norma, and Marcelina dream that their children will be professionals, their business will be successful, and that they will be able to own a home.

loans.use: Felicitas, Norma, and Marcelina need loans of 300, 1500, and 900 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying tara, cochinilla, vegetables, sugar, rice, oil, and noodles.

loans.name: Bibigul

texts.en:
K. Bibigul is 50 years old. She has run her business for six years. Bibigul purchases young cattle and sells them in the local market after fattening. At the same time, she is growing crops and selling them in the market. Moreover, Bibigul is growing nuts, like filberts, walnuts, and she sells these also in the local markets. 
As you see, Bibigul is full of energy and is working hard to support her family and provide for her children. Today Bibigul is applying for a loan of $450.00 for the term of 12 months. This is the first time that Bibigul has applied for a loan. She has a particular plan, and she is sure she will be able to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing of one cow.

loans.name: Ou

texts.en: Mrs. Ou C. Y, 30, earns about $3 per day making bricks. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver and earns around $1.93 per day. They live in Phum Thmey Village, Siem Reap Province. C. requests a loan of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for family use.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura is married and lives with her husband and her four children (ages 22, 18, 12 and 7) in the house they own. Her three youngest children are studying in business schools and her oldest daughter is studying in Spain. Maura has a food sales counter in El Carmen market and her husband operates a motor taxi throughout the area. Each has 5 years of experience doing this work. Although there is competition in food sales, Maura owes her success to her experience in the sector and more importantly the location of her business opposite the bus stop. She also sells food in the market and to retirees. A full lunch costs 8 Bolivares (just over $1) and extra or special dishes cost 15-20 Bolivares (approximately $2-$3). She will use the requested loan to purchase ingredients for her business, which she can get at wholesale prices in the Villa Verde market. Maura and her husband have an excellent credit history.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Maura es una señora casada y vive en su casa propia junto a su espos y suscuatro hijos de 22, 18. 12 y 7 años respectivamente, de los cuales los tres menores estudian en escuelas fiscales y la mayor está trabajando en España. Maura cuenta con un puesto de comidas en el mercado El Carmen y su esposo cuenta con una moto que la trabaja como mototaxi en rutas locales, ambos cuentan con una experiencia de 5 años. Existe competencia el rubro, sin embargo el éxito de Maura se concentra en la experiencia que tiene en el rubro y sobre todo por su ubicación que es al frente de la parada de micros. También vende comidas en el mismo mercado y a pensionados, el almuerzo completo vale Bs. 8.- y los platos extras o especiales de Bs. 15.- a Bs. 20.-. Sus compras las realizará con el presente prestamo comprará insumos para su puesto los cuales los compra a diferente precios en el mercado de Villa Verde al por mayor. Tanto Maura como su esposo tienen excelentes antecedentes crediticios.

loans.use: Compra de moto

loans.name: Thi Hoa

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Lương (MS: 13010030), 35 years old, is loved by her villagers and has reputation as a trustworthy woman in the village. Beside farming activities her family has a small grocery stand which earns a stead income. She has two children. One is still in school age, the other is grown up and has a job with a wage of 50,000 VND a month. She is applying for a loan of 4,256,000 VND to expand her grocery stand. Her group has 4 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Trịnh Thị Mười (MS: 080003), 59 years old, applies for a loan to invest in small business.
  • Hoàng Thị The (MS: 080004), 25 years old, applies for a loan to raise pigs.
  • Tạ Thị Duyên (MS: 080013), 49 years old, applies for a loan to invest in small business.
  • Lý Bích Thủy (MS: 080014), 46 years old, applies for a loan to invest in livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Cô Đậu Thị Hoa (MS: 080002), năm nay 49 tuổi. Cô là người có uy tín trong làng và được mọi người yêu mến. Gia đình cô có cửa hàng nhỏ, tạo thu nhập thường xuyên. Nghề chính của gia đình cô là làm nông nghiệp. Cô có hai con, một con đang còn đang đi học, con lớn đi làm có thu nhập bình quân 50.000 VND/ tháng. Cô vay 4.256.000 VND để đầu tư mở rộng của hàng.
  • Trong nhóm cô gồm có:
  • Trịnh Thị Mười (MS: 080003), năm nay 59 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND để đầu tư buôn bán nhỏ.
  • Chị Hoàng Thị The (MS: 080004), năm nay 25 tuổi. Chị vay 3.360.000 VND để nuôi lợn.
  • Cô Tạ Thị Duyên (MS: 080013), năm nay 49 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND đầu tư buôn bán nhỏ.
  • Cô Lý Bích Thủy (MS: 080014), năm nay 46 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi.

loans.use: livestock and small business

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
María Esther is married, 34 years old, studied until the second year of high school, and has three children - one is independent, two depend on her. She lives in the Victor Larco district in the Trujillo province of La Libertad. Currently, she prepares and sells meals every day from her father's house. She also buys manjar blanco (a dessert made with milk) from wholesalers who bring it from the city of Cajamarca, which she then sells on credit from house-to-house her customers. She invested her first loan in the purchase of rice, oil, and noodles in bulk to prepare the meals that she sells. María Esther is a member of the "The Palm Trees" Communal Bank. With this loan of $375, which she will repay in six months, she will buy rice, noodles, oil and other products in bulk to get a better price. She uses these ingredients to prepare the meals that she sells daily. Her goal is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora María Esther está casada, tiene 34 años, estudió hasta 2do año de secundaria, tiene 03 hijos, 01 es independiente y 02 dependen de ella; vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad . Actualmente prepara comida y vende todos los días en la casa de su papá; Además compra manjar blanco a mayoristas que traen de la ciudad de Cajamarca y vende al crédito visitando casa por casa a sus clientes. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00, invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite y fideos al por mayor, para la preparación de la comida que vende. La señora María Esther es socia del banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS”. Con el préstamo de S/.1000.00, que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses; comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y otros productos al por mayor para obtener mejor precio; estos ingredientes los utiliza para la preparación de la comida que vende diariamente. Tiene como meta tener su casa propia.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.name: Kitimbwa Group

texts.en: Emmanuel T. is 39 and married with 8 children and cares for 1 dependent. He is the treasure of Kitimbwa mixed group and the leader of his lending group. His 15-year-old shop is doing very well, and over the years it has enabled him to start other businesses like selling used clothing and keeping chickens at home with the help of loans. His wife helps with shopkeeping while he sells his used clothing to the various markets using his bicycle. He has a plan to buy a motorcycle to help in his trade, but capital is still lacking because a good motorcycle costs over $1550, while at the same time his shop still needs restocking plus soliciting fees for his school-going children. He is saving toward buying a motorcycle and will be happy to let everyone know when he buys it. Right now he needs a loan to be able to restock his shop as well as buy bales of clothes for sale.

loans.use: Emmanuel needs a loan to be able to restock his shop as well as buy bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mwadhani

texts.en:
Mwadhani R. is a single woman with one child aged 3 years old. Mwadhani is 24 years old, and she started running a used clothes business in 2005. Used clothes from Europe and USA are imported to Africa and re-sold. Many people like them because they are cheap.

Mwadhani earns about US$ 60 per month. Mwadhani is requesting a loan of US$ 275 in order to purchase additional stocks of used clothes. She has one employee to help her in her business. In futurer she plans to open another business.

She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of used clothing

loans.name: Eleazer Rafael

texts.es: El señor Eleazar habita el barrio Villa Reconciliación, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 24 años de edad, se encuentra soltero, actualmente el se dedica a la sastrería, donde apoya en el negocio de su mama, negocio que inicio con ahorros de su mama y el ahora lo esta administrando y a la vez dedicándose al trabajo de sastrería, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, y el esta requiriendo de financiamiento para seguir apoyando a su mama en el negocio familiar de sastrería, por tanto esta solicitando un crédito por la cantidad de C$ 6,000 aun plazo de 6  meses, para la compra de una maquina de coser industrial y de esta forma poder un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ya que en un futuro desea ir mejorando poco a poco el negocio de sastrería que tiene su mama, para poder ir incrementando sus clientelas.
texts.en:
Eleazar lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood, located in the capital of Managua. He is 24 years old and single. He is a tailor and helps with his mother´s business, which she started with her savings and which he runs while at the same time working as a tailor. He has been doing this for 8 years. He needs financing in order to continue helping his mother in the family business and is requesting a loan for C$8,000 over 6 months to buy an industrial sewing machine so he can give better service to his customers. In the future he would like to make improvements little by little to the tailoring business that his mother has and to increase his customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Oun L. is a villager in Preak Thom village in Kandal Province. She sells fertilizers. When her business is going well she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to support her sales. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for her current business. She hopes to increase income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Phai Horn, is a fisherman. Mrs. Oun L. is 51 years old and the mother of five children -- three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while one is attending the local school, and another one is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her current business.

loans.name: Grace Divine Group

texts.en:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates at seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Lucie T. was born on March 25, 1967. Lucie is married to Benédictus Akue and they have two children, ages 12 and 14, both of whom are in school. Lucie is part of Divine Grace along with Clarisse R..

13 years ago, Lucie began selling onions wholesale; she also sells assorted items at Dantokpa Market. Due to recent construction at Dantokpa, Lucie has had to relocate to a less lucrative location. Should her business return when she goes back to Dantokpa, Lucie would like to add peppers, garlic, and ginger to her wares. With her current loan, she will buy onions in large quantity at a lower price.

Clarisse R. was born on August 9, 1964. Clarisse has four children, aged 8, 12, 16, and 28. They are all educated. Clarisse sells delicious Béninois food such as komé (traditional corn dish), fresh fish, peppers, and igname (a hard potato-like vegetable). Clarisse's pots are filled with steaming meals – frying ignames, pepper spread, skinny noodles, fried bananas, and fish. Around Clarisse, gather her friends and family, helping serve, and perhaps angling for a free meal.

Clarisse started her business six years ago with capital of about $90.00 USD. Clarisse began by selling apples, but diversified when she realized she could not get by on apples alone. Currently, she is trying to build up a store of plastic bowels and cooking flatware so she can sell these products too.

loans.use: Purchase large bags of onions

loans.name: Mwasiti

texts.en: Mwasiti H. is a business woman and entrepreneur in Tanzania. She lives on Kigamboni Island in Dar es Salaam. She is the mother of four children, two of which are in secondary school and two are in primary school. Her ability to pay her children's school fees and provide for her household expenses depends on the income she can generate from her small business. For the past six years she has run a cafe in Kigamboni. She requests a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to buy more food items to meet the needs of her cafe's customers.

loans.use: Buy more food items and expand cafe business

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares is a 47-year-old man who lives in Bekaa, Lebanon, with his wife and their seven children. Fares has owned a butcher shop for 12 years. His shop is very clean. His clients are people from his village. When he first started his business, Fares faced some difficulties because his financial situation was bad.

Fares requests a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Fares has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Perina

texts.en:
Perina A. is currently in the business of selling alcohol and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Perina is 45 years old and is married with a husband that is a peasant. She has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: construct a shop

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth, pertenece al banco comunal “El Comercio”, del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 33 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con dos hijos, posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (tercero de secundaria). 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 08 años, se retiro 04 años, posee su negocio de comidas preparadas y la comercialización de ladrillos el mismo que los conformó con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300 nuevos soles como capital inicial de trabajo en el distrito de Desaguadero. 
Actualmente requiere un préstamo de S/. 1800 nuevos soles, para poder incrementar su mercadería, es decir adquirirá ladrillos en cantidad y los comercializara al por mayor en millares; en la misma localidad de desaguadero. Asimismo refiere que tiene la predisposición de cumplir con sus pagos, según lo acordado con su grupo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth belongs to the Community bank "Comercio," from the Desaguadero district, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 33 hears old, married, has 2 children and has an incomplete high school education (through 3rd year of high school). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 8 years, left for 4 years, has a business of ready-made meals and the sale of bricks which she obtained with an initial loan of S/.300.00 New Soles as initial working capital in the Desaguadero district. She currently needs a loan for S/.1,800 New Soles to increase her inventory, in other words buy more bricks wholesale to sell wholesale by the thousands in the same locality of Desaguadero. She has every intention of make her payments on time, as stipulated by the group's agreement.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para adquirir ladrillos en cantidad y comercilalizarlos.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La labor a la que se dedica la señora Marta A. es a la elaboración y venta de tortillas las cuales son preparadas por ella misma en su propia casa de habitación en la ciudad de Chinandega donde actualmente vive.

Es de importancia destacar que ella se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente trabajadora ya que elabora deliciosas tortillas preparadas por ella misma. La razón por la que ella espera en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de maíz para elaborar las tortillas y así seguir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de mucha inversión en estos momentos.
texts.en:
The work that Mrs. Marta A. dedicates her time to is the making and selling of tortillas. She prepares them herself in her home which is located in the city of Chinandega. It is important to note that she is a very hard working woman as can be attested by the delicious tortillas that she prepares. She is waiting for a loan from Ceprodel so that she can purchase corn for the making of the tortillas and thus be able to keep moving ahead with her business which currently requires a large investment.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn

loans.name: Leonit Mejail

texts.es:
El sr. MEJAIL, es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en la provincia de Chincheros, pero él socio vive en la ciudad del Cusco en el barrio de santiago en qoripata francisco arumaga 180, CUSCO.

Nuestro socio tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos, él socio es técnico en mecánica de mantenimiento, y el desea comprar maquinas para poder hacer pequeños trabajos y poco a poco poner su propio taller, el socio solicito el préstamo para poder comprar parte de su maquinaria.

El socio valora el préstamo y agradece al medio por el cual el podrá cumplir con su sueño y se compromete a efectuar con el pago total de su préstamo en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
MEJAIL is a native of the village of Cruz Pata in Chincheros province, but he lives in the city of Cusco.

Our member is 29 years old, single, and has no children. He is a mechanic and wants to buy equipment so that he can do small jobs and, little by little, set up his own workshop. He's applying for a loan so that he can buy some of the equipment that he needs.

The member is grateful that he can borrow money in this way and make his dreams come true. He commits to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy equipment.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita M. grows hybrid corn in their village. She is 44 years old and has five children in school. She and her husband, Abudio M., work very hard to sustain their family and provide for their daily needs. They never mind the labor of going to the field, working under the heat of the sun, and touching the wet soil, just to ensure enough food for their children. Now, Emelita is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (the first Filipino MFI that obtained active status on Kiva). Emelita will use the loan to purchase hybrid corn seeds. The loan will truly help her increase her income.

CEVI aims to help small businesses grow. CEVI provides their clients with more than just loans. It also offers training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid corn seeds

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Maria Auxiliadora R. Pérez, tiene la edad de 61 años, habita en el barrio San José de los Ríos, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como transportista, para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen cuatro hijos , de los cuales tres de ellos son independientes y uno que a su cargo , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace treinta años dedica a la agricultura , el mayor problema que se le presenta son las plagas por falta de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios , ya que no cuenta con un financiamiento . Los planes hacia un futuro es poder trabajar sus tierras con obras de conservación de suelo. Con el financiamiento obtenido a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y obtener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora R. P. is 61 years old. She lives in the San Jose de los Rios district, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. Together with her husband she works as an agriculturer, to help cover the household expenses. They have four children, three of whom are independent and only one is still in their care. Her plans for the family are to improve their living conditions. For thirthy years she was an agriculturer but the greatest problem she faced were pest infestations and the lack of fertilizers and other necessary items. She is no longer financed. Her future plans are to be able to work the fields in a way that will conserve the topsoil. With this loan she will purchase fertilizers and other items to use in the harvest, so to enjoy a good yield.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other items to use in the harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase items  for her beauty salon

loans.name: Roukeya

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente du quartier d’agoè zongo, qui est un quartier au centre de la ville de Lomé, en 2005 elle a commencé le commerce de savons et de pommades qu’elle fabrique elle-même et qu’elle vend en gros et en détail. Elle est la seule à exercer cette activité dans cette zone ce qui fait qu’elle réalise de bons chiffres d’affaire. A ce jour les matières entrant dans la fabrication de savons et de pommades sont épuisées, elle doit en acheter et demande pour cela son premier crédit pour acheter 07 sacs de farine, 06 bidons d’acide et 01 bidons de pommade. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce elle aide son époux dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
This woman is a resident of Agoè Zongo, which is a district in downtown Lomé. In 2005, she started doing commerce in soaps and ointments that she makes herself. She sells at the wholesale and retail levels. She is the only one operating in this business in this area, which means she realizes some good sales figures. Today, her stock of raw materials for making soaps and ointments is exhausted. She must buy more and is therefore asking for her first loan to buy seven sacks of flour, six drums of acid, and a drum of ointment. She is married and the mother of four. With what she earns from her commerce, she helps her husband cover household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the supplies necessary for making soaps

loans.name: Sajida Parveen Muhammad Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Sajida Parveen baji owns a two-room brick house in a city called Arifwala, Pakistan and has been living in it for the past 18 years. Her husband's name is M. R. and he has a rented motorbikes business. He lets motorbikes out for a fee and charges according to the hours used. He has been in this business for over 8 years. Presently, he has 2 motorbikes.

Sajida baji is a very hard-working lady. She also has a clothes sewing business. She does this work to pay their utilities bills. Her work gives her courage to lead an independent life. She is applying for a loan to buy another motorbike to grow her husband’s rented motorbikes business.

This loan is consists of two additional people:

Safia begum baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell.

Parveen baji wants a loan to buy timber to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Note: Sajida parveen baji is seated in the middle of the baji's in this photo.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike for their rented bikes business

loans.name: Эркинжон

texts.ru: Ашуров 1977 года рождения. Женат имеет троих детей. Жена домохозяйка помогает мужу по хозяйству. Эркин с детства  ходил с дедушкой на скотный рынок продавать скот. Он 15 лет занимается  этой деятельностью. Эркин покупает скот, откармливает и продает на рынках области. За счет займа он хочет увеличить количество скота и получить больше прибыли.

loans.use: На покупку скота

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 38 años, es madre de 3 hijos que cursan estudios técnicos, vive con su pareja, quien se dedica trabajar con madera. Desde hace 4 años ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes, cosméticos y joyas de varias líneas de belleza. Estos productos son muy demandados por las personas que viven en su zona, por lo que ella los vende al crédito para cobrar cada día durante la semana, según acuerda con cada uno de sus clientes en particular. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es aprender a dar cada día un mejor trato mejor a sus clientes y le es rentable porque tiene pedidos regulares cada mes. Para el futuro, María quiere tener una tienda de ropa muy grande y con mucha mercadería qué ofrecer. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, ella nos cuenta que le gusta su banco comunal porque es muy agradable trabajar en equipo, a lo que ya se ha acostumbrado y sobre todo, existe mucho compañerismo y responsabilidad en todos sus compañeros. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprara más productos de belleza y una vitrina para exhibir y proteger a sus productos.
texts.en:
María, 38, is the mother of 3 children who are in technical schools. She lives with her spouse who is a woodworker. For 4 years she has sold perfumes, cosmetics and jewelry from various beauty product lines. These products are much in demand by the people who live in her area, since she sells to them on credit so she can be earning every day of the week, according to the particular agreement she has with each client. What she enjoys about her work is learning how to give her customers the very best treatment every day, and this is profitable because she receives regular orders every month. For the future, María would like to have a large clothing shop with lots of merchandise on offer. This is her seventh loan through MFP, she tells us that she likes her communal bank because it is so agreeable to work in a team, which she is already accustomed to, and above all because there is a lot of companionship and sense of responsibility among all her teammates. With the money she is requesting today, she will buy more beauty products as well as a display case to display and protect her products.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional merchandise

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Capachica, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 52 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 05 hijos todos ya independientes y no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, vive en el jr. Lima s/n en Capachica.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año,  su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para aumentar a su capital en su negocio D. venta D. verduras. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, el cual invertirá en la compra D. productos D. la región y en las ferias semanales realiza el sistema del trueque y si le quedan productos los venD..

Su mayor deseo que su negocio crezca mucho.

A ella le gustan los préstamos y las reuniones ya que se divierten mucho
texts.en:
Ms. Catalina C. is a member of the “San Salvador Luminoso” Microfinance Institute, located in the Capachica district of the Puno province, department of Puno. She is a 52-year-old married mother with 5 independent children. She was never given the opportunity to study, and she lives on Lima Street in Capachica.

Ms. C. has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 1 year. She used her initial loan of 300.00 PEN to increase her working capital for her vegetable business.

At this time, she is requesting a 300.00 PEN loan, which she will invest in purchasing local produce. She barters at the weekly street markets, and sells whatever produce is left over.

Her biggest wish is for her business to grow significantly.

She likes the loans and the fun meetings offered by her microfinance institute.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase local produce: potatoes, freeze-dried potato products, quinoa, etc.

loans.name: Antonio Guadalupe

texts.es:
el sr. ANTONIO GUADALUPE ORDOÑEZ se dedica al servicio de corte de cabello, tiene una barberia la que la que se denomina BARBERIA ORDOÑEZ, tiene 5 años prestando sus servicios de corte de pelo, barba y  masajes.
La satisfaccion de sus clientes es por su profesonalismo con que atiende, la ubicación de su negocio  es un lugar muy estrategico de facil acceso, sus clientes le visitan de diferentes lugares de la zona urbana y rural, por lo que es bien concurrido, permitiendole tener clientela todo el año.
El Sr. O. esta casado tiene dos hijos que estudian en centros educativos publicos de la colonia en donde vive.

nos comento que tiene una experiencia en este tipo de actividad de mas de 8 años de experiencia, ya que antes trabajaba en una barberia y tomo la decision de poner su negocio con los ahorros que hizo durante el trabajo en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa.
su meta es ampliar su negocio y contratar mas barberos para asi poder atender a muchas personas a la vez.

loans.use: compra de tijeras, maquinas de cortar pelo, cremas, shampoos, productos de limpieza, rasuradoras,

loans.name: Nwosu

texts.en: Nwosu is 30 years old and married with three children. She sells groceries to make a living and this is her main source of income. She is requesting the loan amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn M. is from the village of Taboc Norte. She is 39 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Arlyn owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Arlyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $100 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Arlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to repair her fishing boat. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey Y., age 52, is married with four children, two of whom are married and  two are attending school. She is a domestic rice trader who owns a rice hulling  machine inside her home. She provides a rice milling  service to her neighbors. She also buys rice in bulk at a reasonable cost to mill, and she sells her finished rice to people for income. Her husband works with her in the business. Usually Srey generates around $5 of profit a day to meet the needs of her family. This rice harvesting season Srey Y. needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when the rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of rice

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 24 years old and married to Juanito, who works as a farmer. They live in the villaage of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City, together with their three children: 5-year-old Melanie, 3-year-old Maria Lian, and 1-year-old Jhon Oliver.  Elena is thankful for such a loving family that chooses to be happy despite the hardships of life.

Elena chose hog raising as her business. At present, she would like to request a loan of PHP 18,000, which she plans to use to buy additional piglets and feed. She dreams of sending her children to college and of them having a better way of life someday. As a mother, she will do her very best to succeed in her endeavor.  She has promised herself that she will work hard for the education of her children and provide them with their needs.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets and feed

loans.name: Dorca

texts.es:
Dorca J. es una mujer emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella iene 32 años, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad y se dedica a la venta de pescado, actividad que realiza junto con su esposo. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace dos años; el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles que le permitió invertir en la compra de pescado fresco y seco para vender. Ahora Dorca necesita un crédito de 900.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados para la compra de pescado que luego comercializará a sus clientes. 
La meta de Dorca es construir su casa y tener una tienda de abarrotes con variedad de productos comestibles.
texts.en:
Dorca J., 32, is an enterprising woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She has two minor children and she, together with her husband, is a fish merchant. She has been a member of the "Madres Corajes" communal bank for the last 2 years. Her first, 300 new sol, loan was used to buy fresh and dehydrated fish to sell. Now, Dorca needs a 900 new sol loan to buy fish to sell to her customers. Dorca's goal is to build her house and to have a grocery store stocked with a variety of food items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites A. is 28 years old and married with three children. Her oldest child is 16 years old. Rice farming is Marites’s livelihood. Aside from farming, she also raises pigs to add income to her family. 

Marites aims to send all her children to school so that they may have a proper education. She works hard but still makes sure she has time for her family, especially her children.

Marites has been a member of CEVI since 2007. She tells us that her loans have really helped her business and her family. She is now applying for a loan in the amount of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). She will use this loan to finance her farm.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is divorced. She lives with her grown son in Vodyanoye. Valentina owns two big and spacious greenhouses and two smaller ones. She grows vegetables for sale. She has been in this farming business for 12 years. Currently, she has 50,000 grivnyas invested in this venture. She usually spends about 20,000 – 25,000 grivnyas on seeds and plastic film every year.  

Valentina is seeking a 10,000-grivnya loan to purchase three rolls of polyethylene film, tomato seeds and fertilizers for her greenhouses. She is very excited to see her business grow and provide a stable income for her family. Profits generated have helped them make enough savings to purchase a new house. Valentina is hoping to further expand her business and eventually finish all the remodeling in her recently purchased house.

loans.use: To purchase polyethylene film, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 22-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil in southern Lebanon. Ali has been working in construction since 2006, tiling floors. When he first started his business, he had to face competition and had some financial issues. Now, he is exceptional because he is known for his good work. His clients are people from his region.

He requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work and to purchase more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Nueva Amistad Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario esta conformado por 3 personas, todas tienen diferentes negocios pero de un solo propósito, sus actividades de negocios son las siguientes: Ada S. tiene una tienda de ropa y miscelanea, Argelia A. tiene una venta de ropa y Yesika C. tiene una venta de joyas.

Ada S., tiene 38 años de edad, es casada tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos estudian y tiene un bebe de 6 meses, su negocio es de ropa típica y de micelanea, tiene 10 años de tener us negocio, su esoso trabaja y le ayuda con sus gastos y por eso han podido salir adelante. Ada necesita este crédito para ampliar su mercadería, su sueño es ver a sus hijos graduados y poder darles un negocio a cada uno.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of 3 persons, all of whom have different businesses but one purpose. Their business activities are: Ada S. has a clothing and accessories shop; Argelia Ajquil has a clothing store; and Yesika C. has a jewelry store. Ada S. is 38 years old, is married and has 4 children. Three of her children study in school and 1 is a baby of 6 months. Her business of traditional clothing and accessories she has had for 10 years. Her husband works and helps with the expenses and because of this they have been able to get ahead. Ada needs this loan to increase her merchandise. Her dream is to see her children graduate and be able to give them each their own business.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: invest in merchandise

loans.name: Sereno Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Sereno Calderón es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como conserje en la Alcaldía Municipal de El Sauce donde tiene dos años de laborar. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de útiles escolares con el fin de brindarles una mejor oportunidad de estudios a sus cuatros hijos, ya que es una madre soltera que lucha por sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sereno Calderón is from El Sauce. She has been a caretaker for El Sauce's City Hall for two years. She asked for the loan to buy school supplies so that her four children can be better prepared for school. She is a single mother who struggles to get her children ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Santa Rosa, una distrito cuya economía depende pricipalmente de la pesca y que se encuentra ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la pesca desde hace 15 años, esta actividad le ha proveído de ingresos suficientes para mantener a su familia durante este tiempo. El nos comenta que tuvo la oportunidad de trabajar en este rubro gracias a una bolichera que el y sus seis hermanos heredaron de su padre. Actualmente todos se valen de esta para ganarse el sustento.

Ellos se hacen a la mar cuando el tiempo es favorable y se quedan ahi por varios dias, los productos que logran extraer son vendidos en el mismo muelle a los comerciantes que luego los ofrecen en el terminal que queda en el mismo distrito.

Isidro y sus hermanos han estado invirtiendo algunas ganancias en brindarle mantenimiento a su instrumento de trabajo,  el desea hacer algunas mejoras en la infraestructura de la bolichera para optimizar su funcionamiento, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Isidro es una persona responsable y que conoce mucho de su trabajo, su mayor anhelo es poder equipar a la bolichera con instrumentos que optimicen su labor como por ejemplo un transmisor de radio que acaba de comprar y que nos muestra en la imagen.
texts.en:
Isidro is 53 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children in the Santa Rosa district, an area whose economy depends principally on fishing, and which is located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Isidro has worked in fishing for 15 years, and this work has provided him with sufficient income to support his family during this time. He tells us that he had the opportunity to work in this field thanks to a small fishing boat that he and his six brothers inherited from their father. Today they all count on this boat to earn their living. They all go to sea when the weather is favorable, and they stay there for several days. The fish that they are able to catch are sold from the dock where they land to the merchants who later sell the fish in a market at that district's terminal. Isidro and his brothers have been saving some of their earnings to put toward the maintenance of their instrument of work. He hopes to make some improvements to the infrastructure of the boat in order to optimize its functionality. To do so, he has seen the necessity to request a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which would help him to achieve his goal. Isidro is a responsible person who is very knowledgable about his profession. He greatest longing is to be able to equip his boat with instruments that optimize he and his brothers' labor, including items like the radio transmitter he holds in the photo, which he just purchased.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gastos de mantenimiento de infraestructura de bolichera.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha B. is from the village of Lantay, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 47 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Editha joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Editha is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Monh

texts.en:
Mrs. T. is 28 years old and has had a fish sale trade since 2000. She sells fish that she and her husband catch themselves from the river. She also buys fish from other fishermen when she does not have enough fish to serve her valued clients. By doing this, they are able to generate $6 per day to solve their daily financial problems. The couple was married many years and have been blessed with two children; both are going to school or working.

Currently, the quantity of fish caught is declining due to the lack of fishing tools. This is why T. has requested a loan in order to purchase more equipment for fishing activities.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing equipment

loans.name: Saidia

texts.en:
Saidia E. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut paste and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell.  Saidia is 20 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has one child and her child does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Alejandro José

texts.es:
El señor Alejandro José L., es casado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y alimentos  variados, ellos tienen 3 hijos menores de edad que se dedican a los estudios, ellos son una familia de limitados recursos, la cabeza del hogar labora como guarda de seguridad desde hace 7 años.

Ha sido con el apoyo de su esposa que ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de la infraestructura del hogar, hace poco tuvieron un  préstamo con Afodenic con el fin  de realizar unas reparaciones en su vivienda es para este mismo fin que nuevamente solicitan un préstamo para continuar con los cambios, con el crédito compra los materiales de construcción que le permitan las edificaciones de dos cuartos, este apoyo les ofrecerá  una mejor independencia, para los hijos debido a que el mayor que ya cumple 19 años y les demanda su propio espacio, tras la culminación de este proyecto les brindara  la tranquilidad de poder ofrecerle a sus hijos un mejor hogar donde habitar. Ha sido gracias a los fondos kiva que la familia ha mejorado las condiciones y comodidades en las que ellos habitan.
texts.en:
Mr. Alejandro José L. is married and his wife sells nacatamales (steamed corn cakes) and different prepared food. They have 3 children who are in school. They are a family with limited resources and the head of the family has been working as a security guard for the past 7 years. With the support of his wife, he has succeeded in improving their living conditions. A short time ago they had a loan from Afodenic so that they could make some repairs to their home. They are now asking for loan so that they will be able to continue with the improvements, and buy the construction materials that will allow them to build two rooms. This support will give more independence to their oldest son since he is turning 19, and needs his own space. With the fulfillment of this project they will be able to offer their children the tranquility of having a better home to live in. It's been thanks to the Kiva funds that this family has improved their living conditions and the comfort where they are living.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build two rooms

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn O. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 36 years old. Arlyn is married with two school-aged children and one infant. To make a living, Arlyn owns & operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. Arlyn has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Arlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used for house repair. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Arlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Mairamo

texts.en:
Mairamo is an enterprising woman with a big desire to improve the quality of life of her family. She is married and the mother of four children. Mairamo has been a seamstress since she was very young. With a lot of effort, she has been able to open a small shop in her home and has been successful because her customers have recognized the high quality of her products. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. 


Today Mairamo is applying for a loan from IMON International for the second time. She is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni to purchase new modern fabrics for sewing national dresses. You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Mairamo and her children are grateful for your generosity and support.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit http://www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing national dresses.

loans.name: Nelly Judith

texts.es:
Nelly Judith F. C. tiene 42 años.  Es soltera vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar en el Recinto Delicia. Tiene 3 hijos, Rosa (14),  Jose (10) y Júnior (8). 

Nelly es una socia de la ventanilla rural El Progreso La Delicia Recinto que pertenece a la Parroquia San José del Tambo, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a sembrar cacao y maíz.

Nelly se dedica a la siembra de maíz en ciclo corto. Realiza sus compras las realiza Babahoyo  y vende los productos en el comercial Chávez.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra del insumo de maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener un negocio propio. El desafío que enfrentamos es el tiempo y la falta de recursos económicos.

Le gusta trabajar estudiar y pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Nelly Judith F. C. is 42 years old. She is single and lives in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar province, in the town of Recinto Delicia. She has three children: Rosa (14), Jose (10), and Júnior (8). Nelly is a member of the rural bank "El Progreso La Delicia Recinto" ["The Progress of Delicia Recinto"], which is located in the parish of San José del Tambo. There are nineteen members in the group. Most of the community works growing cocoa and corn. Nelly grows corn in short cycles. She makes her purchases in Babahoyo and sells her products in the Chávez commercial center. She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies for growing corn. She thinks that this loan is an opportunity for her to get ahead. Her dream is to have her own business. The challenges she faces are time and the lack of economic resources. She enjoys working, studying, and spending time with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for growing corn

loans.name: Juntos Para El Exito Group

texts.es:
Organización y responsabilidad es lo que caracteriza a L. Alcancía "Comunal Juntos para el Éxito", ahora lo conforman 12 socios que cursan el segundo ciclo. 
L. Presidenta Mónica se dedica al rubro D. L. venta D. prendas D. vestir (reparte sobre pedidos), desD. hace tres años y seis meses, es algo que le gusta hacer, aunque elL. nos manifiesta que este año no ha tenido muchas ventas en comparación con el año pasado pero eso no L. desanima ya que siempre busca las circunstancias para poder ofrecer sus productos, ya piensa en el bienestar D. sus hijos, se inicio en este negocio ya que tuvo L. oportunidad D. juntar unos ahorros gracias al trabajo D. vendedora al cual se dedicaba anteriormente. Con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria ha logrado comprar un televisor y un equipo D. sonido, su gran sueño es tener una tienda propia.
El reciente préstamo será destinado para L. compra D. mercadería. Los socios están conformes con el crédito y desean continuar trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD.
texts.en:
Organization and responsibility are what characterize the “Juntos para el Éxito” (Together for Success) communal bank which has 12 members currently in its second cycle. Group president, Mónica, sells clothing based on prior orders. She has been in this line of work for three and a half years. This is something she enjoys doing although she tells us that this year sales have been less compared to last year. However, this doesn’t discourage her because she always looks for sales opportunities for her products because she’s always thinking of her children’s wellbeing. She started out in this business when she had the opportunity to save a bit of money from her previous sales job. With her daily effort she has managed to purchase a television set and a sound system. Her great dream is to own her own house. The current loan will be used to buy stock merchandise. The group members are satisfied with the loan and wish to continue to collaborate with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda G. is from the village of Punit. She is 59 years old, married, and has 1 adult-aged child. Erlinda owns and operates a specialized retail store which offers a variety of products to the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years.

In 2009, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Mujeres Tunecas Group

texts.es: Doña Dalila T. H., es una señora que cuenta con 25 años D. edad, curso solamente sexto primaria, tiene con dos hijos  que estan estudiando, la cual ella se dedica diarimente en la venta D. perfumes desD. sus 15 años D. edad esto lo hace para su sustento diario y la D. sus hijos D. igual manera ayuda en lo minimo a su esposo que es el que esta pagando los estudios D. los hijos,  viendo la necesidad D. ella y D. algunas vecinas D. la misma comunidad en poder incrementar sus negocios formaron un grupo para solicitar un prestamo. El grupo se llama Mujeres Tunecas que esta integrado por 5 mujeres, la cual se dedican a diversas actividades economicas como por ejemplo podemos mencionar: la venta D. chocolate, venta D. ropa y venta D. consumo diari. El credito se utilizara para la ampliacion D. capital D. trabajo, que ayudara a incremtar sus ingresos y asi poder mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en:
Dalila T. H. is a 25 year-old woman who was only able to finish 6th graD.. She has 2 children who are in school, and she has been selling perfumes daily since she was 15. She does this to support herself and her 2 children. Her husband provides some minimal support; he pays for the schooling of the children. As she and some of her neighbors in the same community saw the need to expand their businesses, they formed a group to request a loan. The group is called "Mujeres Tunecas," and is comprised of 5 women who work in different areas, for example: the sale of chocolate, the sale of clothing, and the sale of everyday consumer goods. They will use the loan to increase their working capital. This will help them to increase their incomes and in this way improve the living conditions for themselves and for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia E. is from the town of Poblacion. She is 48 years old. Virginia is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling clothing & shoe products in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina T. is from the town of Talibon. She is 65 years old. Catalina is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Catalina owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes  from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Catalina also hopes to acquire piglets to raise. She says it would really help to have an extra source of income.

Catalina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catalina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Catalina is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and piglets to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell and piglets to raise

loans.name: Farid

texts.en:
Farid A. is 36 years old. He is married with two children. Seven years ago, Farid, with his mechanic skills, started to do work for his neighbours and acquaintances.  He learned these skills at another shop, until he had the opportunity to begin his own business. 

With faith and enthusiasm, his auto-mechanic business started to grow little by little. Villagers who use machines for their business always come to have their machines repaired by him.  Now, Farid is finding that the tools he has are not enough to work at his job with full speed.  For this reason, he is seeking a loan of 1000 AZN.  This loan will be use to buy tools and materials used to repair cars.

loans.use: To purchase tools and materials used to repair cars

loans.name: Elda Lucia

texts.es: Elda Lucia O.  de 41 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, en donde vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil y junto a tres hijos de los cuales el mayor trabajo junto a su padre. Ella posee su propio negocio en el cual elabora tortillas, así mismo comercializa ropa, El negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación  en donde vende con la mayoría de sus vecinos y personas de los alrededores. Elda solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para elaborar sus ventas, tales como maíz, leña y cal para cocer el maíz y así mismo para surtir su venta de ropa. Este negocio es muy importante para Elda ya que le permite crecer como persona, debido a que puede contar con su propio trabajo y de esta misma forma ayudar a su familia a contar con una mejor estabilidad económica y así mismo a contar con todo lo necesario.
texts.en: Elda Lucia O.  is 41 years old. She lives in the department of  Usulután with her husband, who works as a bricklayer, as well as their three children. The oldest works with his father.  She owns her own tortilla making business. She also sells clothes. The business is located in her house where she sells to most of her neighbors and people from the surrounding areas.
