Elda is asking for a loan with which to buy a greater quantity of materials for her sales, such as: corn, firewood and lime to cook the corn. She will also increase the ammount of clothes to sell.  This business is very important for Elda because it allows her to grow as a person. Having her own business allows her to count on her own work and also help her family with more financial stability and being able to have everything they need.

loans.use: To buy clothing and raw materials for making tortillas.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta B. is from the village of Brgy.Sto.Domingo, Bambang,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 59 years old. Marietta is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Marietta owns and operates a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Marietta has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marietta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marietta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marietta is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 3nd loan taken out by Marietta from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia L. is from the village of Holy Friday. She is 52 years old, married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 29 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Virginia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Risalie

texts.en:
Risalie V. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Kasoy, Brgy. Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: Ready-to-Wear clothing sales, buying and selling Herbal Products and Avon and Natasha Products sales.  Her husband Caleb V., who is 48 years old, helps in his wife's business activities.  They have one child who is 19. 

Risalie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Risalie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her son's education. 

Risalie V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. P. makes a living selling clothing and fruits in the town of Abura. She has three children and her husband is employed as a security guard. She and her husband work hard to meet the needs of their children, and she is applying for this loan to buy more fruit to sell to her customers. She hopes to use the additional income made possible by this loan to build a store in which she can sell her products.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To meet all wedding expenses and organize a wedding party for his brother

loans.name: Barnard

texts.en:
Barnard O. is 38 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Bernard has a small retail shop business, which he has run for less than one year. He has a second business offering rental houses.
To help expand his business, Bernard has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials to complete work on his rental houses. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Bernard hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, he hopes to own another business.

loans.use: To purchase materials to complete work on his rental houses

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Tomasa, de 52 años, es una mujer tierna y dedicada, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Julián de 56 años  y su hijo Michael de 30 años. Por muchos años se dedica en la venta de comida generalmente los fines de semana. Por ello, que estos días esta muy ajetreada, ya que una vez que haya cocinado sus platillos criollos y deliciosos, los envuelve con sus manteles relucientes y limpios, y los transporta hasta la loza deportiva, siendo ahí  su punto de venta, y es muy  apreciada por todos los jóvenes deportistas. Y con su esposo trabaja los otros días, ya que tienen 3 carros de segundo uso, de los cuales su esposo conduce uno, su hijo otro y el último lo alquila. Por ello, Tomasa es la administradora y el buen funcionamiento de sus vehículos, siendo su mayor prioridad en adelante realizar el mantenimiento de todos ellos, de este modo no sufrirá averías frecuentes en el trabajo. Es el 2do crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere defraudar a los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes inicialmente confiaron en ella para integrarle en el grupo. De obtener el crédito que solicita, pagará las papeleta impuesta por el policía de transito, para que no trabaje de manera informal su hijo, siendo por las noches.
texts.en: Tomasa, 52, is a sweet and dedicated woman, she lives in a house she owns with her husband Julian, 56 and their son Michael, 30.  For many years she has sold food generally on the weekends. Lately she has been really busy, because now when she is done cooking her creole and delicious meals, she packs them in clean and bright cloths and takes them to the sport complex, being that her point of sale and she is appreciated by all the young athletes.  She works with her husband every day because they have three second hand cars, of which her husband drives one, her son another one and the third one is rented.  Tomasa is the administrator for the good performance of the vehicles, being her priority to give them maintenance and this way avoid breakdowns.  This is the second loan with MFP and she commits to make her repayments punctually because she doesn't want to let down the members of the community bank, who trusted her to join the group. With the loan requested, she will pay for the ticket given by the transit police, so that her son doesn't work informally during the night.

loans.use: Pay transit ticket to avoid problems and continue to work in transportation.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née le 17 septembre 1982 à Sikasso, Fatoumata B. est divorcée et mère de deux garçons vivant dans une grande traditionnelle à Médine-Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès, Fatoumata B. s’est initiée  à cette activité d’alimentation depuis plus de cinq ans. Elle mène son activité devant son domicile à Médine Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux ans. Elle a bénéficié deux prêts qui ont été remboursés avec succès.
Ainsi, elle sollicite un troisième prêt pour lui permettre d’acheter auprès de ses fournisseurs de Sikasso mais aussi de Bamako, 40 casiers de boisson BRAMALI, 50 paquets de boisson NBB, 70 cartons d’eau minérale, 8 cartons de lait Candia, 30 cartons de boisson en canette  de différentes sortes (Malta, Vimto, Ivorio, etc), 15 paquets d’eau minérale en sachets, des cartons de biscuits de qualités différentes, etc.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born on September 17, 1982 in Sikasso, Ms. Fatoumata B. is a divorced mother of two boys living in a large traditional family in Médine-Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many businesses unsuccessfully, she became familiar with this grocery business over five years ago. She operates in front of her home in Médine Sikasso, where she is much in demand by her customers.

To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, Fatoumata decided to rejoin the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about two years ago. She has benefited from two loans, which have been repaid successfully. 

And so, she is requesting a third loan to enable her to buy goods from her suppliers from Sikasso but also from Bamako: 40 cases of BRAMALI beverages, 50 packs of NBB beverages, 70 boxes of mineral water, 8 boxes of Candia milk, 30 boxes of canned beverages of various sorts (Malta, Vimto, Ivorio, etc), 15 packs of mineral water in sachets, a few boxes of cookies of various sorts, etc.

With this loan, Fatoumata envisions making a monthly profit of 300,00 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her working capital, to help with family expenses, and to pay the loan interest.

loans.use: Buying various grocery items

loans.name: Rosa Bertha

texts.es: La señora Rosa se dedica a  la actividad de la elaboración y venta de comida en la localidad del paso, se dedica esta actividad desde hace veinte años, cuenta con buena clientela ya que es muy conocida en la localidad por sus riquísimos platos, vive en domicilio en anticrético, su esposo es jubilado recibe una renta mensual y tiene una niña a quien esta criando, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. Rosa comprara insumos para la elaboración de sus riquísimos platillos la señora tiene un buen historial crediticio en la institución, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, uno de sus deseos es el poder comprarse su casita y así poder tener su propia pensión, la Sra. Esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa has been preparing and selling food in the town of El Paso for twenty years. She has a good customer base and is well-known in the community for her delicious food. Rosa lives in a rental property. Her husband is retired and receives a monthly pension, while her daughter is already grown.

Sra. Rosa will use the money from her loan to buy supplies for preparing her flavorful dishes. She has a good credit history with Emprender. Rosa is very responsible and a hard worker. One of her wishes is to buy a small house so that she can open her own diner. She is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Francisco Javier  C. le esta haciendo falta terminar un cuarto el cual será para su hija. 
Don Francisco esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que esta realizando la mejora. Ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para terminar al recamara de su niña. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que tiene de su trabajo como vendedor.
Desea mejor la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Francisco Javier C. needs to finish building a room in his home that will be for his daughter.  He is requesting a loan to buy the materials he needs and to pay the person who is carrying out the improvement as, right now, he doesn't have the money he needs to finish his daughter's bedroom.  He plans to repay his loan with part of the income that he earns in his job as a salesman.  He would like to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to finish building a room

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
La señora Nidia Concepción O. es una fémina trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 40 años. Ella hace siete años junto a su esposo con su liquidación puso una pequeña venta luego se quedó ella administrando el negocio el cual desea que crezca más.  
O. tiene un hijo de 18 años el cual va a la universidad y quien le ayuda al igual que su esposo a ver el negocio.
texts.en: Nidia is a hard-working, courageous and enterprising 40-year-old woman. Seven years ago she and her husband, with his severance pay, set up a small store that she has managed ever since and wants to see grow further. She has an 18-year-old son who attends college and has helped her with the business as much as her husband.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, meat and other items

loans.name: Micheline

texts.fr: Née le 28 Septembre 1953 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin, Micheline vit depuis six ans à Godomey Gare, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Micheline est mariée à Désiré un enseignant, et a trois enfants à sa charge, tous scolarisés. Micheline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Micheline assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Pour nourrir ses enfants et satisfaire ses besoins quotidiens, Micheline achète à Dantopka, marché international du Bénin, divers produits (riz, haricot, condiments de sauce, etc.), qu'elle prépare et vend à son domicile. Micheline mène cette activité depuis douze ans. Ce troisième prêt permettra certainement à Micheline de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu.
texts.en:
Micheline was born on September 28, 1953 in Ouidah, a historical city in Benin. She has lived for six years in Godomey Gare, located in the municipality of Abomey Calavi. She is married to Désiré, a teacher, and has three children in her care, all attending school. Micheline lives with her husband and her children. She pays for the various household expenses, together with her husband.

To feed her children and provide for her daily needs, Micheline goes to Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, buys various products (rice, beans, condiments for sauces, etc.), prepares them and sells them at her home. She has been in this activity for 12 years. This is her third loan and it will certainly enhance the level of her activity, expand her clientele and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans and condiments for sauces.

loans.name: Conroy Kitchen Group

texts.en:
Leorcadia M. is the leader of the Conroy Kitchen Group. She is 49 years old and married with four children, ages 26, 20, 12 and 10. Two of the children are attending school. She has a restaurant business in Gweru in Zimbabwe. She has been running this business for two years and sells cooked food at Shurugwi. She does not have any other sources of income. The main challenge she faces is the lack of adequate cooking utensils. 

Leorcadia requested this loan through MicroKing for $400 to buy kitchen equipment including utensils, serving dishes, tables and chairs. In the future, she plans to open a bigger restaurant.

loans.use: to buy kitchen equipment.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazón De Jesús Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Sagrado Corazón de Jesús se conformó en fecha 10 de Junio del 2010, gracias a la Sra. Celeste, quien tiene una ferretería y quedó muy interesada con la promoción que la asesora realizó en la zona, quien a su vez le comentó  la forma de trabajo en el grupo  y del crédito a algunas amigas y conformaron su grupo, contactaron con la asesora  y formaron el grupo con 17  mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 3º ciclo.
Es un grupo que se destaca por su trabajo conjunto y solidario dentro del programa.
La Sra. Celeste espera contar con este crédito para adquirir nuevos productos de ferretería y lograr aumentar el negocio con mayores variedades.
Todas las integrantes realizan actividades para recaudar fondos,  se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
The women’s committee called “Sagrado Corazón de Jesús” (Sacred Heart of Jesus) was formed on June 10, 2010 thanks to Celeste who has a hardware store and was very interested by the promotion the advisor carried out in the area.  She then described the way the groups work and about the loan to some friends and they formed the group, contacted the advisor and formed the group with 17 members who are working very comfortably and are now in their 3rd cycle.  It is a group that stands out because of its collaborative work and mutual support within the program.

Celeste hopes to have this loan to acquire new hardware items to increase sales with more variety.

All the members carry out fund raising activities.  They help each other reach common goals that they all have within the group and with Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy hardware.

loans.name: Edwin Enrique

texts.es:
Este cliente, el señor Edwin Enrique  tiene domicilio en esta ciudad de Managua, es persona  estudiada y trabajador  padre de familia que lleva el sustento diario a su familia con buenos   principios y valores  que sacando adelante a toda  su familia. 

El señor  Edwin  Enrique pensando en el bienestar de su familia y en darle una mejor calidad de vida acudió ante nuestras oficinas con  el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, el objetivo de este crédito lo necesita para la compra de materiales de construcción como bloques, arena, cemento, piedrín, hierro y pago de mano de obra esto será utilizado para hacer ampliación y mejoramiento de su hogar  y así  ofrecerle  un hogar digno a su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin Enrique lives in his own home in the city of Managua.  He is an educated and hard-working father who provides for his family with good principles and values.  He is getting his whole family ahead in life.

With his family's well-being in mind and a wish to provide them with a better quality of life, Edwin Enrique came to our offices to request a loan to improve the condition of his home.  He needs this loan to buy building materials such as blocks, sand, cement, gravel and iron.  He will also pay labor costs.  This is to extend and improve his house, so that he can provide his family with a decent home.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home and to buy building materials

loans.name: Comercita

texts.en:
Comercita is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Comercita has a shop where she sells powdered milk, canned goods, noodles & detergents. She has had this business for 8 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Comercita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 28 years old and married, with 2 children, 4 and 9 years old. She has no other dependents. Margret rents a house in Hioma, Uganda, where she lives with 5 people.

Margret has been running a produce business for 2 years. She started out with only UGX 200,000 and her working capital has grown over time. She has been able to use the proceeds from her business to complete her house despite the challenge of unstable prices. Margret's dream is to have a bigger food store. She needs a loan to buy rice and beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es: Leonel, tiene la edad de 40 años, está en unión libre y tiene un hijo bajo su responsabilidad. El pretende con el crédito comprar una máquina para chapear pasto. El trabaja en jardinería y no cuenta con esta máquina por lo cual necesita comprarla. Esto le facilitara su trabajo y le permitirá darle a sus trabajos una mejor calidad en el acabado de sus trabajos complaciendo a sus clientes y aumentando la clientela. El tiene como meta salir adelante con sus proyectos y tener mayores ganancias para su bienestar en el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Leonel is 40 years old, he lives with his common-law partner, and he has one child in his care. With this loan he plans on purchase a grass trimmer. He works in landscaping and he doesn't have this machine, so he needs to buy one. It will facilitate his work and it will permit him to give his work a better finish, which will please his clients and increase his clientele. His goal is to move forward with his projects and to have better earnings for his future wellbeing. It is the first loan he received from Fudecosur (Kiva Field Partner). he has not previously had any loans with state banks but Fudecosur has granted him a loan with greater ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase a grass trimmer.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Charlita has been in this business for 3 years. She earns more income from motorcycle transport.

Charlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Palomino De Martinez

texts.es: La Sra. L. tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad, la Sra. L. tiene su tienda – librería en donde se dedica a la venta de artículos de escritorio, útiles escolares, golosinas, gaseosas y cerveza, lleva trabajando 5 años en el negocio; el crédito lo va a invertir para el mejoramiento de su casa, va a construir un cerco-muro de ladrillos y concreto. El principal desafío que enfrenta la Sra. es la inseguridad de su casa por la falta de un muro por la parte trasera de su vivienda; su sueño de la Sra. L. es tener algún día un minimarket en su casa y distrito en donde mejorara su condición laboral.
texts.en: Señora L. is 46  years old, married, and has a 12 year old son.  Señora L. has a store - bookstore where she sells stationary, school supplies, candy, sodas, and beer.  She has been running this business for 5 years.  She will use the loan to make improvements to her house.  She is going to build an outdoor enclosure made of bricks and concrete because her main challenge is the lack of security in the back of her house.  Señora L.'s dream is to some day have her own mini-market in her house and district so that she can improve her working conditions.

loans.use: make improvements to her house where her business is located.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata, 35 years old, is married and has 3 children aged 18, 16 and 10 years old. In 2000, Aminata established her cloth business because she wanted to raise enough money to help her husband support their family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, Aminata earns about SLL 1,200,000 monthly from this business.

Aminata has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan. She would like a loan of SLL 4,000,000 in order to buy cotton and lace materials for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. In the future, Aminata plans to open a shop so that she can buy more stock and realize more profit in order to assist her husband to take good care of the home and educate the children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 1 bale of cotton and 5 bales of lace

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan de 32 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres con su familia, la cual cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Oyotún que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Juan desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (cerdos y gallinas), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles  para la compra de más animales y su respectiva comida, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Juan es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido salir adelante junto con esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
32-year-old Juan lives in his parent's home with his family.  The house has water and electricity, and is located in Oyotún district, in Chiclayo province.  The people in this area farm and raise livestock.

Juan has been raising and selling farmyard animals (pigs and hens) for some years.  His pens are located behind his home.  They are suitable and spacious.  He feeds his animals balanced feed and natural grains so that they reach an optimal level of growth.  This means he can sell them in the different markets in his area and make good profits with which to cover his family expenses.

Juan has requested a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and their respective feed.  He will use the profits that he makes from selling his animals to repay his loan and enjoy a better quality of life.  Juan is a person who, through hard work and a lot of determination, has known how to get ahead in life together with his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their respective feed

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with nine children. 

Romeo is buying and selling coconuts for copra & green bananas. He has had this business for one year. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

Romeo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Romeo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas to sell

loans.name: Mouth

texts.en:
Mouth is a 66-year-old villager who comes from a low-income family in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. This hard-working man has spent most of his life cultivating rice crops on his farmland. Mouth is married and has four children, one of whom is single and the other three, married and living independently. 

Mouth can earn an income around 2.3 USD per day. During the rainy season of this year, his rice crop has been growing well. However, Mouth doesn’t have capital yet to use on his farm. So Mouth is seeking funding from Kiva to purchase some bags of fertilizer and hire some local laborers to plant the next crop of rice. In the future, Mouth hopes that he can buy extra farmland for growing crops.

loans.use: to purchase some bags of fertilizer and hire some local laborers to plant the rice.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
En medio de una multitud de chicos jugando beisbol, encontramos un pequeño negocio de venta de zapatos, cuya propietario de doña Ramona, una señora de 61 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, vende zapatos de todo estilo y tamaños, ella ha sido casi toda su vida comerciante antes tenia una pulpería y vendía ropa usada pero decidió dedicarse a la venta de zapatos pues estos le generaba mejores ganancias. En bases a estos negocios fue que logro preparar a sus 9 hijos  de los cuales dos están estudiando en la universidad. Nos expresa que el lugar donde tiene su pequeña venta de zapatos en un buen punto de venta, además se refresca la visa viendo jugar beisbol a los jóvenes de su vecindario que la mayoría de ellos se han convertido en sus clientes más recurrentes.
Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar inventario de zapatos con nuevos estilos y tamaños, de mejor calidad ya que estas son las características de mayor demanda de su producto, también quiere invertir en compra ropa usada para vender. Su meta es lograr ser mas prospero  y productivo su negocio mantenerlo surtido y ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
In the midst of a multitude of young men playing baseball we came across a small shoe selling business belonging to Ramona, 61.  She’s from the city of Estelí and sells all types and sizes of shoes.  She’s been a merchant almost her entire life.  She used to have a grocery store and also sold used clothes but decided to go into shoe sales because they produce better profits.  

She was able to raise her nine children, two of whom are currently in university, thanks to these businesses.  She states that the place where she has her small shoe shop is a good sales point and besides she entertains herself watching the young men from the neighborhood, most of which have become her most loyal customers, play baseball.

She is requesting the loan to buy inventory of shoes in various styles and sizes and of better quality since these are the characteristics most in demand in her product.  She also wants to buy used clothes to sell.  Her goal is to make her business more productive and prosperous, to keep it well stocked and to provide better service.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a hardworking businesswoman who is 25 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. For the last five years, she been running a cosmetics business to make a living. In the next five years, she wants to establish a wholesale business. Mercy dreams of buying a piece of land to build rental houses. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business with the previous loan. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to open another outlet of her business.

loans.use: To open another outlet of her business.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is a 43-year-old mother of two children and she is a widow. For the last 25 years, she has been earning a living by running a grocery store in the front yard of her house. She sells bread, cake, drinking water, fruit, etc. To support her family, she also plants cassava to generate additional income. This is her first loan with VisionFund. She wants to buy grocery stock and plant cassava. This loan will help her to increase her grocery stock and harvest more cassava which will enable her to earn more income to feed her family and build up some savings for her children.

loans.use: to buy grocery stock and plant cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, a 31-year old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda, has a salon that he started eight years ago. He has faced the challenge of high rental costs, and his business goal is to have a renowned beauty palour in town.  His personal goal is to educate his children. John is requesting this  loan to buy a dryer and a piece of hair-cutting equipment.

loans.use: to buy a dryer and a piece of hair-cutting equipment.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is married and blessed with four children, two of whom are in school. For the last two years, he has been running an electronics business to support his family. He has employed one person to assist him in managing the business. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He has requested a loan of 60,000 shillings to buy televisions, radios and DVDs for resale. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his standard of living. Benard dreams of buying a piece of land in the future.

loans.use: to buy televisions, radios and DVDs.

loans.name: Nderema B Group

texts.en:
John is the facilitator of the Nderema B group. John and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to John and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

John takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for his family and to have additional maize profits to send his children to school. In the recent 2011 season, John had an excellent maize yield harvesting 22 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, John was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, John will educate his children and pay off loans and debts.

In 2012, the members of Nderema B group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

John is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jose Leonzo

texts.es: El señor Jose,  es un pequeño agricultor de zona de Ticuantepe, durante mucho tiempo sea dedicado al cultivo de piña, la mayor afectación que se le presento fue las inundación en el cultivo ya que perdido todos los hijos de piña que pensaba renovar, pero no fue asi , ya que con el primer crédito logro establecer un cuarto de manzana de piña , el cual lo perdió, ahora el necesita volver a sembrar pero no cuenta con el capital para la compra de un mil hijos de piña , fertilizantes e insumos que requiere la plantación para salvar lo poco que quedo. Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atraves de los fondos Kiva ; ya que sin este programa de ayuda para los agricultores no sería posible recuperar la plantación de piña .
texts.en:
Señor Jose is a small-scale farmer from the Ticuantepe area.  He has been working growing pineapples for a long time. 

The biggest challenge that he has faced was the flooding of his crops, as he lost all the pineapple plants which he had thought to grow, but he wasn't able to.  With his first loan he managed to establish an area for growing pineapple, which he lost.  Now he needs to plant once again, but he doesn't have the capital for purchasing 1,000 pineapple plants and fertilizers and the supplies that the plantation requires in order to salvage the little that remains.

He is grateful for the support that is being provided by Afodenic through the Kiva funds, as without this assistance program for farmers, it would not be possible to recover his pineapple plantation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Jovine

texts.en: Jovine, aged 22 years, has one child who is 4 years old. She sells beer, sodas and Mutzig (a brand of beer). She has been running this business for the period of six months. She is planning to use the loan for expanding her bar business. With the profits, she will reinvest in the same business. She wants to reach a big level of capital in the future.

loans.use: To buy beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Cristy has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Cristy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Cristy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Morelia Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Morelia  y se integra de tres  señoras quien casada una se dedica a su respectiva actividad.
Quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama  Norma  Esperanza, ella  vive en una comunidad pequeña en la que se camina  media hora, es casada con el señor Geremias y con quien procreo cinco hijos quienes solo uno están a su responsabilidad.
 Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  materiales para, elaborar blusas, camisas, pantalones, y vestidos en donde lleva trabajando   veinte años once meses en la que comenta que le va bien  ya que a mejorad0 muchos sus ingresos.
 Inicio por sus propios meritos ya que también quiere  apoyar  su esposo con los ingresos de la casa   y darle lo más necesario  a su familia.

 Lo que más  desea de  su actividad es  que con el préstamo ella pueda  seguir  aumentando  cada día más   sus  ingresos y  comprar   una máquina   para seguir costurando.
 Las personas que integran en el grupo son: Bertha invertirá el préstamo compra de mercancía para su negocio de abarrotes y María Miguelita  en  sastrería.
texts.en:
The group is called “Morelia” and has three members each of which carries out her own activity.  The person who was interviewed is called Norma Esperanza.  She lives in a small community a half hour walk away.  She’s married to Geremías with whom she has five children but only one is still in their care.

She requested the loan to invest in raw materials to make blouses, shirts, pants and dresses.  She’s been in business twenty years and eleven months.  She comments that she does well since her income has improved quite a bit.  She started out on her own initiative since she also wants to help her husband with household income and to provide what’s most needed for her family. What she wants most from her activity is that with the loan to be able to continue increasing income daily and to buy a machine to continue sewing.

The people making up this group are; Bertha who will use the loan to buy merchandise for her grocery store and María Miguelita in a tailor shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes making raw materials.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married with three children.  She is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Lolita is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living.  She has been doing this for ten years.  She has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase fertilizers and finance corn production. 

Lolita has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and finance corn production.

loans.name: Lab's Group

texts.en: Originally from Battambang province, Lab is 56 years old and a married motherblessed with eight children. To earn a living, she grows rice on two and half hectares of farmland and plants vegetable for resale. During her spare time, she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. This is the fifth loan for Lab and her joint borrower with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) with a successful repayment. For this cycle, Lab is the leader of her group. For Lab, her entire loan portion will be spent on plowing fee, fertilizer and seed cost. She hopes that she can gain a good yield than before.

loans.use: To spent on plowing fee, fertilizer and seed cost.

loans.name: Nancy Wanjiru

texts.en: Nancy is 39 years old and has 6 children. She is a Lay leader in her church St. Micheal church. Nancy coordinates the women’s activities in assisting the needy. Nancy also assists 5 children of her brother in law who died. She pays the school fees for them. Nancy owns a plot at Kware Slum area. She has put up 13 rental rooms and the income per room is USD 12. Nancy wants to put up 7 more rooms. She had bought 56 Iron sheets but due to financial constraints she could not buy the other building materials. Completion of the 7 rental rooms would help Nancy realize more rental income. Therefore paying school fees for all the children will be easier and they will be able to get other necessities at school. To supplement the rental income, Nancy sells Charcoal; she sells 15 sacks in a week. The income from the charcoal is used for buying food and other household items.

loans.use: Nancy wants to build seven rental rooms.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a very enterprising woman. She has been in the provisions business for one year and it has gone well, however she wants to increase her product line in order to offer better service to her customers and in this way to increase her sales. For that reason she is requesting a loan of $1200 which she plans to repay within one year.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Adelaida es una mujer muy emprendedora lleva a año con su negocio de venta de viveres y el negocio a caminado bien, sin embargo ella quiere incrementar la linea de productos para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y de esta manera incrementar sus ventas por lo cual ella esta solicitando un prestamo de $1200.00 Dllrs los cuales piensa pagar en un periodo de 1 año.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ripena

texts.en:
Ripena is married and lives with her husband and four children in a small Samoan village. Her family relies on their small taro plantation for income.

Ripena’s husband does most of the farming, but Ripena is the one to haul their taro crop to market and ensure they receive good prices. She can earn enough money to support the basic needs of her family and pay for her children’s schooling.

However, she is anxious to raise her family’s standard of living further and is applying for a loan to invest in some fertilizer and basic tools to help improve the crop yield from their small plot of land.

loans.use: Buy chemicals, fertilizer and knives

loans.name: Luu Thanh

texts.en: At 24, Ms. T. is the oldest of 6 children in her family. 3 years ago she decided not only to earn her own living, but also to help her aging parents who are farmers. She rented a market stall in the nearby Do Luong township and started to sell ladies' clothing.  3 to 4 times a month she makes the 8-hour bus ride to Hanoi to buy stock from wholesalers. Ms. T. took her first loan of US$200 from TYM in March and now is ready for the next one. With her bright and joyful character, she also agreed to become a Center Leader for TYM and assemble all the women for weekly meetings.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for sale

loans.name: Beli Maya

texts.en:
Mrs. Beli Maya N. and her husband, Shyam N., both are tailors in the town of Bhaishepati, Lalitpur. They have their own tailor shop. Tailoring is their traditional work, which they learned from their forefathers. Their specialty is making custom-fitted dresses like the Kurta Sulwar pants and shirt, which are very popular in Nepal. They seek a $225 loan to buy raw materials for their tailoring work.

They have three sons and a daughter. Their older son works in a restaurant. Their second and younger sons are studying in grade 8 and 9, and their daughter is in grade 10.

Their economic condition makes it very hard to fulfill the basic needs of their family. So they need the loan to expand their business so as to earn more money to support their family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for tailoring work

loans.name: Edisa

texts.en:
Edisa operates the Kuteesa Beauty Salon. She is 40 years old and is married with 2 children of her own and 2 orphans. She has managed to pay school fees and to send one of her daughters to the university, which is quite amazing.

She has been working as a beautician since she was 15. Her salon is located in a very rural setting and is the only one of its kind in the area. Though people do not have a lot of money, they do take great pride in their appearance and the salon is an important part of this care. She keeps her fees very reasonable to make sure everyone can afford her services.

Her dream is to slowly expand her business to meet the needs of her community. For now, she plans to use her loan to buy more cosmetics and pay school fees. She has been receiving loans for the past 10 years and has always paid on time.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and pay school fees.

loans.name: Farti

texts.en:
Farti, 48, owns a general store that serves a small community in Obuasi. This is Farti’s second loan. With her first loan, Farti increased her profits so much she was able to add slippers and sachets of potable water to her stock. This time Farti hopes to add rice, tomato paste, oil, and other food products. The Christmas season will be coming where it is tradition to cook and eat a lot of rice. If Farti generates enough profit, she will add cloth to her stock.

Farti was married once, but her husband left for Germany to work and she has never heard from him since. Since then, she has been taking care of her daughter, currently 32, by herself. Now she has 3 grandchildren and will be getting married to her fiancé soon.

Farti is a member of the lending group in Obuasi. The group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: To expand her store by purchasing more rice, tomato paste, oil, and other food products.

loans.name: Reimunda

texts.es:
Mrs. S. is a 64-year-old widow with three grown up sons who are independent topographers.

Reimunda started her own fashion design business, but upon realizing that it was not profitable, she and her husband decided to make cotton and wool blankets to sell in nearby cities. Shortly after that, her husband passed away, and she was left with many debts and 3 children who were still very young.

Thanks to her enterprising spirit, she was able to push forth and endure the loss of her partner. Her business grow so much that she had to hire personnel so help her due to the high demand for her products. She then started to sell her merchandise to other retailers.

Today she is one of the biggest suppliers of these handicrafts to major retailers in the city. She is requesting this loan in order to buy bigger quantities of cotton and wool thread so that she may continue with her endeavors.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Reimunda tiene 64 años de edad, ella es viuda y tiene tres hijos todos varones, ya son profesionales (topógrafos) y trabajan en forma independiente.

Reimunda comenzó a trabajar en forma independiente como modista y al darse cuenta que no le era muy rentable, decidió fabricar junto con su marido colchas de hilo y lana empezando a tejer ella misma y su esposo las vendía en otras ciudades. Después al poco tiempo falleció su esposo, y ella se quedó con muchas deudas y sus tres niños que aún eran muy pequeños.

Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor logró salir adelante sobrellevando la falta de su compañero. Así fue creciendo hasta que tuvo que contratar a personales para que le hicieran el trabajo por el aumento de la demanda de sus productos y ella empezó a salir a vender los productos.

Hoy día ella es una de las mayores proveedoras de esta artesanía de las tiendas más grandes de la ciudad. Ella solicita el crédito para poder adquirir en grandes cantidades hilos de lana y algodón para seguir con su gran producción.

loans.use: Purchase of cotton and wool thread

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en: Fuad owns a clothing stand in the bazaar of the Saatli town of Azerbaijan. Fuad has been running his business for several years with the help of his shop assistant (she is pictured), and is now looking for funding so that he can increase his inventory of winter clothing. The seasons will be changing soon, and he needs to be prepared for this shift within the market.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila K. is married with a grown daughter. They live in Simferopol, Crimea. Ludmila runs a small business in the local “Moskoltso” market selling hosiery and socks. Ludmila’s business is well-known in the neighborhood for low prices. She started her venture 8 years ago. Currently, her income is about $900 a month. She has about $6000 in inventory.

Ludmila is a well qualified sales manager. Her professional vending skills help her generate new ideas and products that make her business more profitable. Ludmila is consistently growing and developing as an entrepreneur. She is planning to use this loan to purchase seasonal clothing in bulk so she will have plenty to attract new customers. Ludmila is hoping to invest the profits she generates into the legalization of her land lot and the reconstruction of her house.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothing in bulk for her hosiery and sock business

loans.name: Sopheab

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheab Y. and her husband have been married for twenty years. They have five daughters. One of their daughters is married and lives in the family home. Their son-in-law is a goldsmith. Of the other four daughters, two work in a garment factory and two are in school. The house is along the Mekong River, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sopheap has been selling watermelon and grilling bananas for four years. Her husband has been a mason for four years.

Mrs. Sopheap is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $500. She will use the loan to purchase goldsmith materials for her son-in-law’s business.

loans.use: To purchase goldsmith materials for her son-in-law

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao Y. is a 42-year-old farmer living in the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She and her husband Meuy Mau (pictured above) have run a farm since 1980, and currently each make less than $1 a day. They have four children, two of whom work in garment factories, where they make approximately $100/month.

Sao Y. has requested a loan of $500 to buy a cow to help them run their family farm. Eventually, she would like to buy more farmland to use for vegetable cultivation and expand their operations.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Yovanna Lizet

texts.es:
Yovanna G. is 28 years old, lives with her husband, and with one child who is still dependant on her. She went to high school, but has not yet finished. She lives in the La Libertad neighborhood of Trujillo, Peru.

She sells used clothing from a rented stall at the Santa Rosa market in the district of El Porvenir. She began her business a year and a half ago, thanks to the support of Movimiento Manuela Ramos. She buys clothing from wholesalers, washes them, and then sells them.

She belongs to the “Unidas Para El Progreso II” communal bank. Upon receiving her first loan of S/.300.00, she invested it entirely in buying clothing. With this loan of S/.800.00, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will invest it in buying her merchandise.

Yovanna dreams of having her own store where she can sell not only used clothing, but also new clothing, and thereby increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Yovanna G. tiene 28 años, es conviviente con 01 hijo dependiente aún de ella, tiene estudios superiores de educación inconclusos, y vive en la Urb. La Libertad- Trujillo – Perú. Se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en el mercado Santa Rosa del Distrito de El Porvenir, en un pequeño puesto alquilado. Se inicio hace un año y medio gracias al apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, ella compra la ropa a mayoristas luego la lava y la vente en su puesto. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “ Unidas Para El Progreso II”, recibiendo un primer préstamo de S/.300, lo invertio completamente en la compra de ropa. Con el préstamo de S/. 800. el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, será invertido en la compra de su mercadería. Silvia sueña con poder tener su local propio y poner su tienda comercial de ropa no sólo usada sino también de ropa nueva y así mejora sus ingresos.

loans.use: She will buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Len S. is a 44 year old widow and works collecting and buying the recyclable items from her village and around her community and resells them to the recycling plant. On average, she makes $4 each day. One of her children is married and no longer lives at home, two are employed as a garment workers, and the youngest is a student at primary school.
In order to expand her revenue, she would like to take out a loan to purchase more recyclable items from her villagers.

loans.use: To purchase more recyclable items to expand her revenue.

loans.name: Sol Radiante Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal de Panamericana, a este pertenece la asociación “Sol Radiante ” integrado por 17 miembros.
Un grupo muy alegre que  junto  a su asistente de créditos, trabajan con Pro-Mujer con mucha responsabilidad y entusiasmo.
La mayoría en el grupo son casados y con familias numerosas, Actualmente viven en alquiler en cuartos que con el paso del tiempo y el crecer de sus hijos les han quedado pequeños, tiene el sueño de poder comprar una casa propia para ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus hijos,  por lo que trabajan desde muy temprano en la elaboración de almuerzos y cenas , que los venden en mercados de la ciudad de El Alto , ahora lograron conseguir contratos en algunas construcciones de edificios, por lo que necesitan  crédito para la compra de mayores insumos y para  contratar ayudantes de cocina, esto les permitirá duplicar la producción y conseguir mayores ganancias para  poder ahorrar para la compra de su casa en un futuro .

loans.use: Necesitan capital para la compra de insumos y para contratar ayudantes

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina, 30, is divorced with two children, ages 9 and 6. She also takes care of a 60-year-old person in her home. Madina has been selling firewood since 2007. She works from 6AM to 6PM every day and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales. Madina is requesting a loan to buy more firewood for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood for resale

loans.name: Mosy

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania!

This is 31-year-old Mosy C. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with 2 children, between the ages of 4 months and 6 years. Mosy C. has been running a clothing business since 1999. She buys clothing at wholesale and sell it in her store. Her business is doing good. She works at the business for 4 hours per day. Mosy currently earns about $200 from her business as a monthly profit. She is requesting a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional clothes for both women and men. In the future, she plans to establish another business.

Mosy thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes for both women and men

loans.name: Irma Reyna

texts.es:
Como fundadora del barrio, la señora Irma cuenta con un gran respaldo y clientela en su comedor, se caracteriza por velar por sus hijos como pocas madres, por que no les falte nada, absolutamente nada y así es a pesar de la avanzada edad de 2 de ellos aunque la menor es su tesoro más grande, quiere darle lo mejor de lo mejor y, es así que, se dedica también al negocio naturista que implica viajes a provincias, contando con menor tiempo para su comedor pero se las ha ingeniado todos estos años organizándolo bien.

Para el techado de cemento de su comedor, en aras de cumplir las metas que se ha trasado como madre, es que requiere de un préstamo de 700 soles.
texts.en:
As a pillar of the neighborhood, Irma has much support and clientele for her eatery. She is known for watching over her children as few mothers do, so that they lack nothing, absolutely nothing. Since 2 are older, the youngest is now her greatest treasure, she wants to give her the best of the best. This is why she has her natural foods business, requiring trips into the provinces, leaving less time for her eatery. She has managed everything well all these years, organizing well. For a cement roof for her eatery and in order to accomplish what she has undertaken as a mother, she needs this loan of $250.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish construction of the interior of her house for her food clients, plus to stock up on necessities for her natural business requiring trips into the provinces

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
U. Anvar is a hard-working person and he makes an effort to give his 4 beloved children the best. He decided to stay in his homeland so that he could develop it, and now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals. 

Through his business, he has been able to educate his children up to secondary school level. He would now like to extend his animal business and with this purpose in mind, he is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 USD) for the term of 12 months. He plans to increase the number of animals moved at a single time in future. Anvar thanks you very much for your kindness to others.

loans.use: Purchasing of the cattle and calves to expand his business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married and has one grown-up son. She sells men's underwear and women’s tights. Her kiosk is located at one of the city markets at a very good location that attracts many clients. Good pricing attracts clients too.

Tatyana has been in this business for 5 years. She is a very nice and outgoing person. She loves her business and treats the clients well. She has many repeat clients. Her monthly income is 2,500 UAH, and her working capital is 20,000 UAH.

Tatyana would like to get a loan of 3,000 UAH to purchase gift underwear sets to sell. She believes that the Christmas and New Year season is a good time to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase gift setsof underwear to sell

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina E. sells women's clothes and shoes. She is 32 years old and is married with 12 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. 

Paulina purchases her goods in Onitsha and Lagos. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She needs a loan of N30,000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Nadine

texts.en: Nadine is a 20-year-old young woman, living in Rachaya in the Bekaa Valley. One year ago, Nadine started her own home-based business. She learned from a friend the art of sewing. Today Nadine is requesting to borrow $1,200 in order to buy new sewing tools and introduce traditional Lebanese handicrafts.

loans.use: Buy new sewing tools

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret A. is currently in the business of transporting clothes to the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Margret is 23 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has one child, and her child goes to school.  

With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Teodora Avero D. G. es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Guadalupe”, en el distrito D. Pomata, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 42 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (quinto grado). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 14 años, a la venta D. cereales (quinua, cañigua, habas, etc), su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. mercaderías para su negocio (quinua al por mayor). 
Actualmente ella requiere otro préstamo, por tanto viene solicitando la suma D. S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales, con el dinero piensa adquirir mas mercaderías todo al por mayor (quinua y cañigua principalmente), ella tiene el anhelo D. adquirir en el futuro una movilidad liviana (Mototaxi) para su esposo, a fin D. generar mas ingresos para su familia, puesto que su esposo no tiene un trabajo estable.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora Avero D. G. is a member of the "Virgin of Guadalupe" Communal Bank in the district of Pomata, Province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. She is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her education is limited, having completed only to the fifth graD.. For the last 14 years she has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement. She sells cereals such as quinua, cañigua, beans, etc. Her first loan of $95 was invested to purchase merchandise for her business (wholesale quinua). At present she requires another loan, therefore she is requesting the sum of $375. She is committing to repaying the loan in 5 months. She will use the funds to buy wholesale products, primarily quinua and cañigua. In the future, she wants to acquire a Mototaxi for her husband to help generate income for the family because he does not have stable work.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale quinua y cañigua.

loans.name: Waled

texts.en:
Waled, 24, lives with his parents in Aley, Mount Lebanon, where he has been installing  satellite receivers for six years. He is requesting a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new satellite receiver and settle his debts. This is the first time that Waled has requested a loan. 

A fast and skilled worker, Waled has built up his client base to include friends, neighbors and people from his village. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new satellite receiver and settle his debts.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua S. is thirty–nine years old. She is married and has given birth to one child, a son who has completed senior high school and is currently in the teacher training college. Her husband is an electrician by profession. Akosua lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Akosua is a trader. She trades in food stuffs such as yams. She procures tubers of yam from a town called Afram Plains in the region. She sells them in a store in the market to food vendors and others. Akosua has been in business for one year and desires to expand her business. She hopes to give her son the best of educations.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam

loans.name: Sadio Aissatou

texts.fr: Sadio Aissatou Baldé, 52 ans est mariée avec 06 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 4 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter des produits de consommation divers pour les revendre sur table. Elle veut renforcer son petit commerce.
texts.en:
Sadio Aissatou Baldé, 52, is married and raising 6 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Coundara for 4 years. Her business consists of buying various foodstuffs to re-sell on a table top. She wants to reinforce her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of various items on table top

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. JAIME, el es natural de Pilcopata, situada en el distrito de kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo, correspondiente al departamento del Cusco, correspondiendo a la entrada al parque nacional del Manu, a 8 horas de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 28 años de edad, y tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 1 año, el es conviviente y su principal actividad es la agricultura, el cultiva arroz, frutas, yuca y coca, el socio requiere el préstamo, por que desea invertir en la compra de una moto taxi, es una moto armada como una carreta, esta es muy conveniente para el clima que tiene Pilcopata ya que estamos en la selva de Cusco, y gozan de un clima fabuloso, para esto requiere el préstamo y de ese modo hacer servicio de transporte entre los poblados que le anteceden a este.

El socio esta muy agradecido y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Mr. Jaime C. C. is a native of Pilcopata, located in the Kosñipata district of the Paucartambo province, department of Cusco. His town is near the entrance to the Manu National Park, located some 8 hours from the city of Cusco.

Our client is a 28-year-old man who has a live-in partner and two children, ages 5 and 1. His main business activity is agriculture. He grows rice, fruit, cassava and coca. Mr. C. needs a loan that he wishes to invest in purchasing a motorcycle taxi—a motorcycle equipped with a passenger wagon. This taxi will be very convenient in Pilcopata’s climate because we are located in the Cusco jungle, where we enjoy excellent weather. He needs this loan so that he can provide transportation services in the nearby villages.

The client is very grateful and values the loan that he has been given, committing himself to pay it back in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for her business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: La señora Hilda se dedica a la venta de tarjetas telefonicas prepago para teléfonos celulares por cantidad, distribuye a clientes de Villa Fátima, Villa Copacabana, el cruce de villas, vende tarjetas de las tres empresas de telefonía  celular como Entel, Tigo y Viva.Ella vive en la casa de sus padres colaborando con los gastos de la casa. Es una cliente muy puntual y responsable, invertirá su crédito en compra de tarjetas viva y entel, ya que son los productos que mas tiene pedidos.
texts.en:
Ms. Hilda T. sells prepaid cellular phone cards by the bulk. She sells them to customers in Villa Fátima, Villa Copacabana, and near the railroad crossing. She sells cards from three different cellular phone companies—Entel, Tigo and Viva. She lives in her parents’ house and collaborates with covering the household expenses. She is a very punctual and responsible client who will invest the loan in purchasing Viva and Entel cellular phone cards because those are the most popular ones.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase prepaid cellular phone cards

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty O. is 58 years old and married with three children. She sells drinks to make a living. Betty is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Samuel Muthiora

texts.en:
Samuel lives in Uthiru, Nairobi, where he has put up rental houses. Uthiru area houses a number of low income earners and thus Samuel's tenants live in houses made of iron sheets. He intends to construct better and more secure houses that will provide him with a good income. By renovating his current houses, he will make sure that his tenants are satisfied and comfortable.

Samuel is a 38-year-old single gentleman. He was introduced to KADET by his mother, who is a client but in a different group. He has never borrowed from any other financial institution; however, this will be his third loan from KADET.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To renovate rental houses by installing steel doors, cementing the floor and the front yard

loans.name: Kuru Momoo Group

texts.en:
This is Mohamed T. S., Alpha K. and M’Balu K.. They are entrepreneurs in Magburaka town, who sell petroleum products and tea. They named their group Kuru Momo, a Temne phrase meaning Thank You God. They have received several loans from SMT/Kiva. The previous loans have made a big impact on the lives of these entrepreneurs, allowing them to afford the cost of their households.

Mohamed T. S. (left) is the leader of this group. He was born twenty-nine years ago in the town of Magburaka, which is in northern Sierra Leone. He is married with one child, who is in secondary school. Mohamed has been a businessman for five years. He sells petrol, kerosene, diesel, and engine oil. Mohamed and the other group members will use this loan to expand their businesses.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Zaya Wadine Group

texts.en:
Zaya WaD. wants to take out a loan for his general store. He wants to enlarge his shop. Najma D. also requests a loan for his general store. He is a beginner in this business, and he wants to improve his business. Farshta and Rabya want to take out loans for their tailoring businesses.

Zaya WaD. is the leader of the Zaya WaD. Group. All of the members would like to receive money to expand and progress their businesses. There are four members in this group. They have requested a group loan of 56,000 afghani. They are very happy with Kiva lenders and AFS in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose M. is married and has six dependents. She has received a junior high school education.  Rose sells mattresses and linoleum flooring at Castle near Nyankumasi, which she has been doing since 2001. Her husband is a trader. Rose uses her income to help pay fees and utility bills.  Rose will use the loan to buy more mattresses to sell. Rose plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to educate the children.

loans.use: To buy more mattresses to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 50-year-old single mother of four children who all go to school. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she lives with six people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.

Gladys works in semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She sells secondhand clothes and buys these clothes from Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. She doesn’t pay rent for her business as she sells from door to door. She sells to all categories of people both in retail and wholesale.

Gladys has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for five years, and is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. She is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and owning permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Parmaisori

texts.en:
Mrs. Parmaisori M. lives in Bhakepati. Bhakepati is located in Kathamandu district. Bhakepati is one of the developing village of kathmandu and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. M. lives in a single family with her husband and two daughters. Her older daughter is studying in grade 12 and a younger daughter is studying in grade 11.

Mrs. M. is a farmer in Bhakepati. She grows green vegetable on her land. Parmaisori sells her vegetables daily in a local market in the mornings and evenings . Now she is requesting for Rs 15000.00 loan to buys seeds and fertilizers for her farming business.

loans.use: to buys fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza has a general store located in the village of Ballacong, Ilagan, Isabela, where her family also lives.

Flordeliza has been engaged in her retailing business since 2000 and according to her it is somehow improving. She hopes to maintain and expand her business further to earn more income for her family. She is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from Kiva lenders. She plans to retail vegetables for additional profit. The loan she is requesting will be of big help for the expansion of her retailing business.

Flordeliza is a businesswoman already 51 years old. She is married to Pedro who works in a government agency. Most of their children are school-aged and, for this reason, the couple works hard to sustain their children’s educational needs and the other needs of their family. Uplifting their living conditions is one of Flordeliza’s goals.

loans.use: To retail vegetables for additional profit

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon B., nicknamed “Cory” in their village located at Barangay Cataggaman Viejo Tuguegarao City. She is 45 years old and finished her secondary education. Due to financial shortage, she did not pursue her college studies. She works hard to earn a living and is married to Pedro a farmer in their village. They are gifted with three children namely; Perpetua 24 years of age college graduate; Cristopher 22 years of age, college undergraduate; Max 18 years of age, college student. Being a responsible parent, they do their best to improve their way of living. Despite the economic crisis, they are still striving for the sake of the future of their children.

Her husband is a farmer while she is engaged in barbecue vending business in their village to help her husband support the education of their children. Since she only has a small amount of capital, she only earns a net income of Php 700 a week. In this regard, she wants to borrow additional capital to strengthen her business. She applied for an amount of Php 8,000 to be added in her capital to acquire materials and ingredients needed for her business. She is so thankful when she joined in this organization because it gives her the opportunity to improve her small business. And she hopes that through her efforts and sacrifices, all of her children will finish their studies and her business will also grow. As she has said, "Patience and sacrifices is the key to success".

loans.use: additional capital for her barbecue vending business

loans.name: Diegane

texts.fr: Monsieur D. est un villageois sérère  originaire de Foundiougne .Il s’est installe a Dakar depuis 1999 dans l’objectif de trouver un emploi, gagner sa vie et aider sa famille. Ainsi  par l’intermédiaire  d’un ami  il est devenu employé dans une société  de gardiennage dénommée  Raam Daan  qui assure la sécurité  au niveau des caisses  de L’U –IMCEC a Dakar. Il  est âgé  d’une quarantaine d’années et   habite a Grand Yoff dans une des banlieues de Dakar. Il est marie et père d’un enfant de 5 an. Son salaire mensuel est insuffisant et ne lui permet pas de résoudre certains  besoins sociaux  ou d’entreprendre certains projets .C’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite un prêt de 200 000 frs. L’objet de ce crédit est d’acheter du ciment pour faire des briques qui lui permettront de construire un bâtiment  de 3 chambres  pour améliorer  les conditions d’habitation de sa mère  et de sa petite famille car ils logent dans des cases en paille.
texts.en:
Mr. D. is a villager of Serer ethnicity from Foundiougne. He moved to Dakar in 1999, with the goal of finding a job, earning a living, and helping his family. Thus, through a friend, he became an employee of a security agency named Raam Daan, which ensures the security of the holdings of U-IMCEC (one of Kiva's field partners) in Dakar. He is about forty years old and lives in Grand Yoff, a suburb of Dakar. He is married and is the father of one child, aged 5. His monthly salary is insufficient and does not allow him to resolve some social needs or to start up certain projects. It is for this reason that he is seeking a loan of 200,000 frs. The aim of this loan is to buy cement to make bricks that will allow him to construct a 3-room building to improve the living conditions of his mother and his small family, since they live in straw huts.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (milk, baked goods, soft drinks, vegetables, meats, fruit)

loans.name: Benita's Group

texts.en: Benita L. is from the village of Villa C., Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 52 years old. Benita is the group leader of a fifteen-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Benita is married and has two adult children. She owns and operates a business selling bananas and vegetables. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-six years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a week.
