In 2008, Benita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Naftali

texts.en:
Naftali is 23 years old and has been running a 'boda boda' (motorbike taxi) transportation business for the past two years. He also sells electronics, such as amplifiers, televisions, extension cords, DVDs, and phone accessories to earn additional income. He employs two people for his transportation business.

Naftali wants to purchase a motorbike, which will cost Kes. 71,000 as well as insurance for the motorbike, which will cost Kes. 5,000. Naftali describes himself as hard-working and committed and he wants to work for a better future.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and insurance

loans.name: Hubertine Amélie

texts.fr: Née en 1982 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, K. Hubertine Amélie est mariée à SOSSOU Albert, un transitaire. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille réside au quartier Agla à Cotonou, depuis environs 11 ans. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Hubertine Amélie n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour assurer les différentes charges qui lui incombent, Hubertine Amélie   vend des tissus et divers autres produits (riz, produits cosmétiques, etc.) à son domicile. Hubertine Amélie s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est depuis 15 ans que Hubertine Amélie exerce cette activité, et elle a déjà obtenu deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés auprès de ALIDé. Hubertine Amélie souhaite augmenter davantage le stock de ses produits et mieux répondre aux différents besoins de ses clients. Cependant, Hubertine Amélie ne réunit pas assez de fonds pour renforcer son activité. C’est pourquoi Hubertine Amélie sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1982 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ms. K. Hubertine Amélie is married to Mr. SOSSOU Albert, a shipping agent.  The couple have four children who are all in school.  The family has been residing in the Agla district in Cotonou for eleven years.  The couple jointly ensure that family expenses are covered.  Hubertine Amélie attended primary school only.  To meet the different responsibilities incumbent upon her, she sells cloth and a variety of other goods (rice, cosmetics, etc.) out of her home.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and has been in this business for fifteen years.  She has already obtained two loans, which she has repaid to ALIDé.  She would like to augment further her inventory of goods and to respond better to the different needs of her customers.  However, she hasn't gathered enough funds for bolstering her business.  This is why she's requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cloth, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: S N Jose Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “S.N. Jose” esta representado por la señora Virginia y conformada por 15 miembros 13 mujeres y 2 hombres todos residentes D. la misma zona. El señor Hugo es padre D. 3 niños en edad escolar, el se dedica al servicio mecánico y por las noches ayuda a su esposa a la venta D. refrescos y milanesas en la esquina D. su casa su hijo mayor D. 15 años se encarga al cuidar a sus hermanitos durante el tiempo que sus papas realizan su actividad comercial, don Hugo es un señor muy sacrificado ya que se encuentra ahorrando para poder tener un hogar mas cómodo y poder darles sus hijos y a su esposa un mejor lugar donD. vivir es por eso que seguirá trabajado para poder hacer realidad su mas granD. anhelo ver a sus hijos profesionales y bajo un techo digno y cómodo. El resto D. los socios se dedica al transporte público,  venta D. pollo a la Booster, moto taxista, venta D. refrescos, ropa, pan empanadas, zapatos y al servicio domestico. La competencia entre las socias D. sus negocios no es tan dificultosos por que cada negocio D. cada socia esta bien segmentado y tienen canales D. distribución para poder vender y ofrecer sus productos, tienen lugares estratégicos D. ubicación D. sus negocios y  en la venta D. cosméticos tienen sus clientes fieles y constantes por que trabajan hace muchos años con estos productos. El crédito será destinado a la inversión en sus fuentes D. trabajo que son sus propios negocios en algunos casos iniciaron un nuevo negocio, o cambiar D. rubro según a la temporada D. la necesidad del mercado que exige la libre oferta y demanda. La mayoría D. las socias solo habían escuchado D. estos créditos en grupo, pero en la capacitación que se les da en el transcurso D. crédito, se les informo como era el movimiento y como era lo que desea esta institución para los socios, pero algunas socias ya estaban muy bien informadas D. esto, ya que es un grupo antiguo anteriormente habían estado en otra institución por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “S.N. Jose” is led by Sra. Virginia and consists of 15 members (13 women and 2 men) who live in the same area.

Sr. Hugo is the father of three school-age children. He works as a mechanic and helps his wife at night with selling soft drinks and milanesas (breaded meats) from the corner of their house. His oldest son is 15 years old and in charge of looking after his younger siblings while he and his wife are running their business. Don Hugo is a man who has maD. many sacrifices. He is currently saving so that he can have a more comfortable home and proviD. his family with a better place to live. For this reason, he continues to work so that he can fulfill his greatest dreams of seeing his children become professionals and providing them with a decent and comfortable home.

The rest of the members are engaged in different business activities involving public transportation, roasted chicken sales, motorcycle taxis, soft drink sales, clothing, bread, empanadas, shoes, and housekeeping services. The competition that exists among their businesses is not as difficult since each member's business is well segmented and has its own distribution channels for selling and offering products. Their businesses are situated in strategic locations. The members who sell cosmetics have steadily built up their clientele and have been working for many years with their products.

This loan will be designated for investment in their various works. Some members are starting new businesses. Others are changing out their inventory based on the season and the market conditions of supply and demand. Most of the members only heard about the availability of these loans through their group, so they are taking a training course in which they are instructed in how credit works and the expectations the Institution has for each of its members. Some members are very knowledgeable already since this is an experienced group that has worked previously with another institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: María Josefa

texts.es:
La   Señora María Josefa R. L., Labora como Secretaria en la Decana tura de de la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería, el tiene  tres hijos a su cargo,  y   se encuentra en edad escolar, esta casada, ha trabajado dos créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como, cerámica, cemento, y mano de obra para su casa de habitación ya que esta era de concreto.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
María dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Josefa R. L. works as a secretary in the Dean’s office of the Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería. She is married and has 3 school-aged children for which she is responsible. She has had two loans with CEPRODEL over the past two years. In this period of time, she has invested the two loans in the improvement of her home where she lives, thanks for the funding provided by CEPRODEL.

The loan she has requested is to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as ceramic, cement, and labor for her house, since it was already made of concrete.

All of this is with the aim of providing better security and better living conditions for her children. María says that the loan provided have been for housing improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing improvements and expansion

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia Z. is from the village of Damayuhan, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Cresencia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Cresencia owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling gasoline and used oil in the local community. Cresencia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Cresencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cresencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Cresencia is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 15th loan taken out by Cresencia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. E. is 41 years old, is married, and is blessed with four children. She lives in Nambale, Busia District, where she runs a cereals and grocery business. She started this business in 1992, immediately after her high school graduation. Due to a lack of money for further educational fees, she decided to venture into business.

Mary buys her stock from Chwele market twice a week. She would like a loan of Ksh 20,000 to use in expanding her stock in her cereals and grocery business.

Mary’s future dream is to venture into the rental-housing business.

loans.use: To increase her stock and expand her business

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie T. is from the town of Daanglungsod, Katipunan. She is 33 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lanie owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Lanie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Lanie joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. Lanie is requesting a new loan of 5,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en: Pedrita L. is from the village of Makawa, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Pedrita is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Pedrita operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, such as fish, in the local community. Pedrita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Pedrita joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedrita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Pedrita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mr. Chhen Nhaet Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has 12 people who live in Thnal Louk village in TaK. province. Mr. Chhen N. is the village bank president, selected by the other members. Each member will use a small piece of the loan for a different purpose. He is 59 years old. He is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. Now his problem is that his field has infertile soil. So to improve production, Mr. Chhen N. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. His wife, Mrs. Butha Sam, is a congee seller at her local village. He is a father of two children. One of the children is a laborer in a mill and the other attends the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: 04.01.03 - Hoang Truong - Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
"Tam L. T. is a 28 year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Truong - Hoang Hoa .  She is the group leader of a five member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Tam is married and has three young children.  To making a living, Tam operates a fishing business.  WhiL. not her only means to generate revenue, her main source of income comes from harvesting and selling wild-caught fish to residents in the local community.  Tam has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 1500000 VND a month.

Tam joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tam is requesting her first loan of 3079800 VND to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.  Tam plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the family's general living conditions.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  L. T. Thuy is a 20 year-old woman who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.

2.  N. T. Duyen is a 45 year-old woman who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.

3.  N. T. Thu is a 52 year-old woman who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.

4.  L. T. Huong is a 21 year-old woman who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.

-------------------------------------------------------------
About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.



Tam L. T. (57) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Truong - Hoang Hoa .  Tam là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 04.01.03-Hoang Truong-Hoang hoa (04.01.03-Hoang Truong-Hoang hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở biển trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Tam thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tam kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND.  Vào 1, Tam đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tam đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Thuy (58) là 20 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  N. T. Duyen (59) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


3.  N. T. Thu (60) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


4.  L. T. Huong (61) là 21 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

loans.use: Purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Ángel Misael

texts.es:
Ángel Misael Z. C.  tiene 26 años.  Es Unido vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar en el Recinto Delicia.  Tiene 2 hijos, Jaime (2) y Sleiter (5). 

Ángel es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Progreso La Delicia Recinto que pertenece a la Parroquia San José del Tambo, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a sembrar cacao y maíz.

Ángel se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz desde hace cinco años.  Realiza sus compras cada mes de los productos y de los insumos para la siembra en los Agro servicios de AGRIPAD y vende los productos en el Mercado de Chillanes.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos de maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener una bodega para dedicarse a la compra y venta de maíz. El desafío que enfrentamos es el tiempo y la falta de recursos económicos.

Le gusta trabajar en la agricultura y salir con la familia.
texts.en:
Ángel Misael Z. C. is 26 years old. He is married and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar in the Delicia precinct. He has two children, Jaime (2) and Sleiter (5). Ángel is a member of the El Progreso rural solidarity group of La Delicia precinct that is part of the parish San José del Tambo. This group has 19 members, and the community sows cacao and corn. Ángel is an agriculturalist and has been growing corn for the last five years. Every month, he buys the products and supplies for sowing from AGRIPAD agro services and sells the products in the Chillanes market. He is soliciting a loan to buy supplies of corn. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity for him to get ahead. His dream is to have a warehouse and to buy and sell corn. The challenge we are facing is time and lack of economic resources. He likes to work in agriculture and to go out with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of corn

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 50 años, vive con su pareja y sus 2 hijas en casa de su hija mayor. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a vender quesos y demás productos alimenticios como trucha y  maíz seco a las diferentes zonas urbanas de la ciudad donde radica. Lleva sus productos en baldes bien hermético que le ayudan a mantener en buen estado sus productos, en cuanto al queso, para abastecerse de este producto ella misma los prepara cuando va de viaje a su pueblo natal en donde consigue leche de vaca y por el lapso de 3 días vuelve a su rutina de siempre. Le agrada ejercer este negocio porque considera que su trabajo es mejor compensado cuando vende directamente sus quesos, es por eso que esta pensando a futuro industrializar su forma de fabricar quesos. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará quesos ya preparados para que pueda incrementar a su propia producción y cubrir con mayor éxito los pedidos que tiene con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa, 50, lives with her life partner and two daughters in her oldest daughter’s house. For the last 8 years she has sold cheeses and other food items like trout and dry corn in various urban areas of the city where she lives. She transports her items in hermetically sealed tubs that help her keep her products in good condition. With respect to the cheeses, to stock up on them she herself makes them when she goes to her native city to get the cow’s milk and after three days returns to her usual routine. She enjoys this business because she considers her work to be well compensated when she sells the cheeses directly. For this reason, she is thinking of a way to industrialize her cheese production in the future. This is her 3rd loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she can count on financial help because she has always been responsible with her repayments. In addition, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all of its members are responsible and cooperative people. She is grateful to all the people that will fund the loan she’s requesting which will be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the requested funds to buy already prepared cheeses to augment her own production so that she can better fill pending customer orders.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheeses.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina A. is currently in the business of brewing and selling alcohol at home. She is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer to sell.  

Sabina is 45 years old and widowed. She has eight children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to stock food items for her family and send two of her young children to school.

loans.use: Stock crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  es la Sra. Margarita; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos y ella alterna sus actividades desde hace 22 años con el comercio minorista, la socia vende granos secos (maíz en diferentes variedades, lentejas, poros, pallares, habas, etc). La socia requiere capital de trabajo para invertir en su negocio de granos y comprar al por mayor.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos al por mayor. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Margarita, 48, is a member of the “VIRGEN DE CHAPI” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She is married and has four children. For the last 22 years she has combined her household chores with retail sales of dry goods (several varieties of corn, lentils, leeks, white beans, lima beans, etc.) She needs funds to buy grains at wholesale and is asking for a loan to do so. She is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dry goods at wholesale.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana B. is from Tinago, Ozamiz City. She is 53 years old and is married with seven adult children. Juliana owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She also sells different kinds of products. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Juliana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Juliana is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Margaret  Wamaitha

texts.en:
Margaret Wamaitha is 24 years and married. David Kabiru, her husband, is 27 years old. He is a truck driver and they have one child who is three years old. Margaret has been in the business of poultry farming as a primary business and operates a green grocer's as her secondary business. She has been doing this business for one year with an income of KES 8,000 per month.

Margaret was introduced to KADET LTD by another existing client and she is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 to add to the savings she has made from both of her businesses. She wants to buy a dairy cow to rear for milk production. This will improve her farming activity and boost her income. All these activities she does at Kimuga in Kiambu, her rural area near the banana open air market, just a few kilometers from Nairobi city. She sells her products mostly to her neighbors and she takes some products to the nearby open air market.

Margaret plans to use the extra profit to build a modern house for her family, and offer good education to her child to university level, she is a very hard working lady.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to rear for milk production.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 57 años, vive con sus hijos de 19 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años ella se dedica a las tareas agrícolas y a la venta de animales menores como cuyes y pollos, con lo que ha logrado establecerse económicamente. Por otro lado ha comprado vacas, de las cuales les extrae la leche, otra forma más de generarse ingresos diaR.. Asimismo vende animales en las ferias comerciales de los pueblos aledaños a su localidad y los fines de semana en las ferias ganaderas. Por tanto procura tener la cantidad de animales en su granja, para ello cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo cuanto tiene tiempo libre, ya que gracias a este negocio María ha logrado educar a sus hijos, así como cubrir las necesidades dentro de su hogar. Sin embargo hay momento de ventas baja, pero eso no le desanima ya que una de sus características es saber convencer a su clientes al momento de comprar su mercadería. Ahora lo que más desea es aumentar su capital de trabajo y continuar progresando. Es el crédito número 11 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, puesto que la conocen como una persona responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas muy solidaria. Asimismo agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para aplicar en su cultivo de alfalfa, ya que le servirá como forraje para sus animales.
texts.en:
María, 57, lives with her 19-year-old sons in her own house.  For 20 years she has been farming and raising small farm animals, like guinea pigs and chickens, thus becoming economically established.

On the other hand, she has purchased cows whose milk is another source of daily income.  She also sells animals on market days in neighboring communities as well as at weekend livestock fairs.

She, therefore, always tries to have a good quantity of animals on her farm.  Her son helps her in his spare time and thanks to this business María has managed to educate her children as well as to cover household needs.

However, sometimes sales decrease but this does not discourage her since one of her characteristics is knowing how to convince her customers to buy her merchandise.  What she most wants now is to increase her working capital in order to continue making progress.

This is her 11th loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she can count on financial support because she’s known to be a responsible person with respect to repayments.  Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are mutually supportive.

She thanks all those people who will fund the loan she’s asking for that will be very useful for her business’ progress.

She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of manure to use on her alfalfa crops which will serve as forage for her animals.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure to use on her alfalfa crops.

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi L., from the town of Banga, is 36 years old and married. To make a living, Levi owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale. He also raises pigs for fattening and hopes for his small piggery to grow.

Levi joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 12000 PHP to purchase feeds and fertilizers, he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn E. is from the village of Brgy. Inaban,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya.  She is 49 years old.  Evelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.  This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Evelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita G. is from the village of Aguinaldo, Cordon. She is 58 years old. Teresita is widowed and has eight adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business selling a variety of different products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chogjmoo

texts.en:
Chogjmoo T. is 50 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Hovd province, Mongolia. She and her daughter live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her middle child is currently unemployed and her son attends a local high school. Her older son currently serves in the Mongolian military and went abroad as a peacekeeper. 

Chogjmoo operates a meat trading business in her town. She sells a variety of meats to her customers at a stall in the local market. She started her business in 1993 and has since gained much experience. She says, "I hope that my son will come back to us healthy." She is requesting a 2,200,000 MNT loan to purchase livestock to sell.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 49 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Klacouma, préfecture de Dioïla ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce des céréales.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des grains de céréales uniquement.                                                                          
FANTA D., qui est la présidente du groupe s’approvisionne en grains de céréales sur place dans le village et au marché de Massigui. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, au marché de Massigui, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge de façon complémentaire les dépenses familiales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group named Benkadi are all married and they have an average age of 49. They each have 5 children and they live in large traditional families in the village of Klacouma, a dsitrict of Dioila in the region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

They know each other through family relations and their business is the sale of cereal grains.

The women of the Benkadi group are on their tenth loan cycle and it will be used exclusively to purchase cereal grians.

Fanta D. is the leader of the group. She purchases grains for resale in the village and in the market in Massigui.  She makes her sales in the village and in the market in Massigui, completing the sale in either cash or credit. Her client base is made up of both men and women. 

She expects to make a monthly profit of 15000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, to pay for the family's expenses, and to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase cereal grains.

loans.name: Sahel

texts.en:
Sahel A. D. (pictured here in FATEN's office) is a national Palestinian employee and a father of four daughters: Sally, Asma, Rasmiya and Dunia. He also has one son named Abdullah.

Seeing that his daughters were growing up, he wanted to make them their own room. So Sahel came to FATEN and is taking out a $3,000 loan to furnish and purchase the necessary items for the room.

loans.use: To furnish his daughters' room

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman who lives in Talisay City, Cebu.  She earns her living by operating a fish vending business.  Her husband Ramon, who is 46 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have six children who are between the ages of 9 and 23 years old.  

Helen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 3 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Helen has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 30,000 PHP, thus increasing the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 4th cycle loan, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital for the fish vending business so that she could continue to save up for the future expansion of her business and the education of her children. Helen is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of fish vending

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi N. is married and has two children. She is a seamstress. She also sells soaps and other cleaning agents at Abura, which she has been doing for four years. Her husband is a carpenter. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of the home. 

Esi will use the loan to purchase varieties of soaps to meet the demands of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: purchase varieties of soaps for resale

loans.name: Farzona

texts.en:
Farzona is an entrepreneur from Kumsangir, Tajikistan, where she sells women’s and kid’s clothing. Farzona is a married mom of two kids. She manages to balance family and work, effectively managing her time with wisdom and thorough planning. Farzona has been in this trade for 10 years. She is a true venturer. She takes risks and handles challenges with endurance and perseverance. Farzona pursues success of her business and seeks to see it flourish and thrive. This time Farzona is requesting a loan of 6500 Somoni to re-stock her inventory and generate additional income. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increase working capital with the purpose of development of business.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: Máximo, es natural del distrito de Kimbiri, tiene 47 años de edad, es un hombre muy alegre y trabajador, esta casado con Albina de 30 años y fruto de su relación hoy tienen 03 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa ubicada en la comunidad de Vista Alegre Alta. Máximo, empezó su aventura como agricultor desde muy niño en las tierras de sus padres. Su pasión  por el agro lo llevó a adquirir sus propias tierras donde viene trabajando 23 años de manera independiente; en el cual viene cultivando plantas de café, hojas de coca y piña; en total posee 06 cuadras de terreno. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de extraer con mayor rapidez los frutos de cada producto y de esa manera logra avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su trabajo. Se siente muy comprometido con su labor; porque  gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que los frutos de sus plantas le resultan, así obteniendo buenas ganancias por cada kilogramo de producto vendido; asimismo menciona, que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque en estos meses abundan los insectos y las precipitaciones de las lluvias, impidiendo el rendimiento de su trabajo y perjudicando en el desarrollo de los frutos. El crédito solicitado es para que pueda comprar más semillas de piña para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para expandir sus sembríos y aumentar su producción. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprara más semillas de piña para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo.
texts.en:
Máximo, 47, is from Kimbiri district.  He is a very cheerful, hard working man.  He’s married to Albina, 30, and they have three children.  They all live together in their own house located in the Vista Alegre Alta community.  

Máximo started his adventure as a farmer when still a little boy on his parents’ fields.  His passion for farming led him to acquire his own fields where he’s been working independently for 23 years.  He farms coffee, coca leaf and pineapple.  He has a total of 6 cuadras (1 cuadra=1.5 hectare) of land.

During harvest he hires day laborers to help him pick fruit more quickly thus advancing his work more rapidly.  He feels very committed to his work because thanks to his daily effort he can now enjoy the fruits that his plants produce obtaining good profits for each kilogram sold.  He also mentions that winter is not pleasing to him because during these months insects abound and rain is heavy impeding his work efficiency and damaging the growth of his plants.

He is asking for the loan in order to buy more pineapple seeds to graft so that he can obtain good results from his fruits in less time.  For now though, his main priority is the purchase of more land to expand his crops and increase production.

This is his fifth loan with MFP.  He is willing to pay each installment punctually because he wants to access a subsequent loan later on.  He is a well liked member of his communal bank.

He will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy more pineapple seeds to later graft and obtain good advantage with his fruit is less time.

loans.use: To buy pineapple seeds.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es: Corazón D. Jesús es el nombre que representa L. creencia D. esta nueva Alcancía Comunal D. el programa prosperidad -  Edaprospo y gracias al fomento D. nuestras socias D. un grupo D. Huaripachi,  se formo con 09 integrantes en su mayoría mujeres que se dedican al comercio y producción con sus propias manos. Juana rosa  es una D. ellas y es designada como presidenta D. L. Alcancía Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús”. Se dedica a comercializar colchas y prendas D. vestir para niños, Juana rosa viene trabajando así casi 5 años, pues nos manifiesta que el clima frio D. L. zona le favorece y vio en este negocio alternativas D. ingresos adicionales por que junto a su conviviente comparten los gastos en su casa, a sus 54 años D. edad Juana Rosa  ayuda  a una D. sus nietas a seguir capacitándose en L. carrera técnica D. contabilidad, pues su lucha constante es conseguir que sus hijos y nietos sean personas D. bien y trabajadores. Podemos ver L. fotografía en donD.  están reunidos incluso alguno D. sus hijos les acompañan, en L. zona L. electricidad es D. baja potencia por lo alejado.
texts.en:
‘Corazon D. Jesus’ [Jesus’ Heart] is the name that represents the beliefs of the communal group from Edaprospo prosperity program. The group was formed thanks to the support of the nine members from Huaripachi, mostly women, who have small businesses and make things by hand.

Juana Rosa is one of the group members and is the president. She sells blankets and children’s clothes. She has been doing it for five years because, she says, the cold climate aids this kind of business and it provides additional income to help her common-law partner with the family expenses.

At 54, Juana Rosa supports one of her grand-daughters so that she may complete her technical training as an accountant. Her constant struggle is to make sure that her children and grandchildren become good people and hard workers. We can see the photo where the group and part of her family are together. The electricity is not very strong in their area because it is remote.

loans.use: to buy blankets and children's clothes

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: El Sr. Ronald es transportista, convive  con la Sra. Teresa y sus 3 hijos. Viven en casa Familiar en la zona de la mutualista. El Sr. Ronald se dedica al transporte hace 10 años su esposa se dedica  a la venta de comida, así mismo ayudándolo con los gastos del hogar. El crédito que se le otorgo al cliente es para la compra de un juego de llantas. Don Ronald manifestó su agradecimiento por la confianza y la oportunidad que depositaron en el.
texts.en:
Sr. Ronald is a taxi driver. He is in a common law marriage with Sra. Teresa and they have three children. They live in the family home in the District of La Mutualista. Sr. Ronald has been in the transportation business for ten years and his wife sells food. Through their jobs, they are able to help each other with the household expenses.

The loan being given to Ronald will be used to buy a set of tires. Don Ronald expresses his gratitude for the opportunity being given to him and the trust that has been demonstrated.

loans.use: To purchase a set of tires.

loans.name: Cinthia Paola

texts.es:
Cinthia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Victor echave”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Puno, tiene 22 años de edad, tiene estudios universitarios.  Es soltera  y no tiene hijos.
La señorita  se dedica  a la venta de comidas preparadas (sándwich, dulcería), trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  desde hace un año.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
En la actualidad requerirá de un  nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/ 1200.00 nuevo soles, dinero que  invertirá en la compra de un saco de arroz, papa, verduras, carnes, pescados, dulces, etc.,   En su negocio la ayuda su mamá y sus ayudantes.
Su sueño es tener más ingreso económicos que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la ganancia del ahorro y el compartir con las socias.
texts.en:
Cinthia is a member of the Victor Echave Communal Bank, which is located in the Puno district and province.  She is 22 years old, and she has a college education.  She is single and has no children.

She sells prepared food (sandwich and sweet shop).  She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  She invested her first loan, 300 soles, in her business.

She now needs a new loan for 1,200 soles.  She will use the money to buy sacks of rice, potatoes, vegetables, fish, and sweets, etc.  Her mother and helpers assist her with the business.

Her dream is to have more income that would allow her to improve her quality of life.

What she likes about the communal bank is the savings that generate income and sharing with the members.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, potatoes, vegetables, fish, and sweets, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se llama RENACER; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la Provincia y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Victoria, la socia tiene 38 años de edad y es casada la socia tiene 1 hijo de 18 años de edad, la socia es consultora de cosméticos ella trabaja desde hace 3 años en la promoción y exposición de catalogos y venta de cosméticos, la empresa de la socia le permite manejar sus horarios según a su disponibilidad de tiempo, la socia requiere este crédito para poder capitalizarse, ella pagara el total de los pedidos y esperar a que su cliente paguen en dos partes, para así ella recuperar lo anticipado de dinero que ella dio, la socia también desea invertir parte del crédito en la matricula de su hijo que estudia en la ciudad e Lima. La socia requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de productos por catalogo y en la matricula de su hijo.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called RENACER (To be Reborn) and is located in Huanchac District which belongs to La Provincia, Cusco Department.

The member is Victoria, 38.  She’s married and has an 18-year-old son.  She is a Beauty Consultant and has been working for the last 3 years demonstrating and selling catalogue cosmetics.  The firm she works with allows her to set her own work schedules according to her time availability.

She needs this loan to capitalize herself so that she can recuperate the investment she made up front.  She will pay off her entire order and then wait for her customers to pay her in two installments.  She will also use part of the loan to pay her son’s tuition; he’s studying in the city of Lima.  She needs the loan to buy catalogue items and for her son’s tuition.

She is grateful and wants to express that she will repay in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy catalogue items and to pay for her son's tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is an 18-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his two old parents and six siblings. He started his career at a very young age working as a mechanic. In 2010, he opened his own garage. His work is specialized in car electricA. repairs. Since his business establishment, this young man was able to achieve a remarkable growth and became well known in his town as well as in its neighboring villages. He provides the household, medicA. and all other family expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new electric tools and supplies instead of the used ones. He’s sure that with these purchases, he will be able to deliver his services faster.

loans.use: to purchase new electric tools and supplies

loans.name: La Solucion Group

texts.es:
L. señora Celia D. 39 años D. edad, Socia D. L. Alcancía comunal L. Solución, madre soltera su hijo menor D. edad estudia en el colegio del estado. Solicito el préstamo para compra D. un ganado vacuno para que pueda criar y así poder incrementar L. venta D. leche, ha podido incrementar el volumen D. sus ventas, L. socia  quiere mejorar su negocio sembrando mas pastales para sus ganados vacunos, su objetivo es para tener una calidad D. vida y que su hijo estudie en un mejor colegio del estado. L. socia está ubicada en L. primera fiL. con compra D. color naranja. 
El préstamo es D. s/.1000.00 Nuevos Soles.
texts.en:
Celia is 39 years old and a member of the communal bank "L. Solucion", meaning "The Solution". She is a single mother and her youngest child attends a state-run high school. She requests a loan to purchase a dairy calf to raise and to increase her milk production. She has been able to increase her sales volume. She wants to improve her business by planting mO. hay for her cattle. Her objective is to have a quality life and to have her son attend a better high school in the state. On the photograph she is in the first row, wearing orange.

The loan is in the amount of S/. 1000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with a grown daughter. She is a market vendor from Pavlograd. Yelena sells groceries, noodles, and cereal, as well as over 50 kinds of tea and 40 kinds of coffee, in the central marketplace of her home town. She started working in the food-vending business five years ago. She works really hard to keep her business running and make it a success. Currently, her profits amount to 7,000 Ukrainian grivnyas (UAH) a month. 

Yelena needs a loan of 15,000 grivnyas to purchase assorted grocery items for retail sale in her kiosk. Yelena believes that groceries always sell well because people have to eat, which is why she sees herself working in this sphere of trade for years to come. She likes working with this type of merchandise and thus supporting her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase assorted food items for sale in her kiosk

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 31 years old and is married with two children aged 6 and 10. He owns a shop which sells local drinks. He has four years' experience in this business which is well known and well organized. The hours of his business are from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day except on Saturday.

Theoneste has requested his first loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more sorghum to make local drinks to sell. With these profits, he will reinvest in his business and save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of sorghum to make soft drinks.

loans.name: Galinda Mercedes

texts.es:
Galinda Mercedes tiene 41 años, es soltera vive con los hijos de 15 y 10 años, vive en el Recinto El Progreso Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C EL PROGRESO, está ubicada a 15 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 13 socios es el tercer crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca.


Galinda Mercedesse dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maíz, plátano, soya y yuca, ademas se dedica a la crianza de ganado. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos y alimentación para las ganado, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar mas terreno para seguir cultivando y comprar mas ganado.

Le gusta ir al rio con los hijos a tomar un baño.
texts.en:
Galinda Mercedes, 41, is single living with her children who are 15 and 10 years of age in El Progreso that belongs to Chillanes Canton.

The members of the “El Progreso” (Progress) communal bank are located 15 minutes from the Chillanes office.  There are 13 members and this is their third loan request to the cooperative.  The members of this communal bank are cocoa bean, corn, banana, soya and manioc farmers.

Galinda Mercedes farms cocoa beans, corn, banana, soya and manioc; she also raises livestock.  She makes her purchases in Chillanes and in San Pablo and her sales take place in the Chillanes Sunday market.

The loan will help her buy farming supplies, fertilizer and manure for the crops and feed for the livestock.  The loan has helped her in that she increased crop yields.  She has faced challenges like illness among her laborers and infestations and illnesses in the crops.  Her dream is to buy more land to continue farming and to buy more livestock.

She enjoys bathing in the river with her children.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, fertilizer, manure and animal feed.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria has had a sari sari store business for 7 years. She sells items like soft drinks, canned goods, coffee and other various items. She usually earns about 6000 PHP per month with her business.

Gloria is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell like soft drinks, rice, coffee and canned goods. Gloria hopes to have a bigger store in the future. She hopes to be able to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soft drinks, rice, coffee and canned goods.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Chantha, 49 year old, is a vegetable seller. Her husband is a policeman. Their income is $5 per day. They have three children who are 24, 21 and 18 years old. One is studying and another is a teacher who earns $2.50 per day. Every month, Chantha has to spend $77 on food, $15 on electricity, $20 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She is requesting a loan of $600 to buy vegetables to sell. Chantha would like to have a store for selling vegetables so that she doesn’t have to sell on the ground. She wants to support her children to continue their education..

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 61 year-old Mohamed. He is married and has 8 children, aged 14, 16, 18, 20, 24, 26, 29 and 31 years. 

In 1972, Mohamed established his plastic slippers business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL5,000,000. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy children's plastic  slippers - 2 cartons @ SLL400,000, women's slippers - 3 cartons @ SLL450,000, men's slippers - 2 cartons @ SLL450,00 and assorted foam slippers - 5 bundles @ SLL300,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL300,000. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to open another outlet and hopes to send his children to college. He is hardworking and honest and, therefore, wants to continue his business until he retires. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for children's plastic  slippers - 2 cartons @ SLL400,000, women's slippers - 3 cartons @ SLL450,000,  men's slippers - 2 cartons SLL450,00 and assorted foam slippers - 5 bundles @ SLL300,000.

loans.name: Oleveira

texts.es:
Oliveira tiene 44 años D. edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio D. luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Oliveira desD. hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa D. su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción D. leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores D. la zona o lo lleva a vender al mercado D. TambogranD., cuenta con clientela fija por la buena calidad D. leche que tiene, con sus ingresos solventa sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más ganado vacuno lechero para que se incremente la producción D. leche y así podrá ofrecerlo aun mejor precio para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.  Oliveira es una persona trabajadora y dedicada que lo único que quiere es que su negocio se amplie para que sus hijos tengan otras oportunidades D. estudios.
texts.en:
Oleveira is 44 years old, living with her family in her own house. Her home is only equipped with electricity and it is located in the rural zone of the TambogranD. district, which belongs to the department of Piura. In this area, the main activities are agriculture, animal husbandry, and craftwork.

Oleveira has worked in raising and selling cattle (cows) for several years. Her corral is located outsiD. her house. She feeds her cattle with balanced feed and natural fodder to have good milk production. She sells the milk to the other residents of the area or carries it to the TambogranD. market to sell. She has steady customers due to the high quality of her product. With her earnings, she’s able to settle her family’s obligations.

She has requested a loan of 2000 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more milk cows for increasing milk production to offer even better prices. In this way, she will be able to repay the loan and improve her family’s quality of life. Oleveira is a hard-working and dedicated person, who wants to see her business expand so that her children will have other education opportunities.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Letecia has a corn farm where she harvest & sells corn grains. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy fertilizers for the corn field.
Letecia has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Letecia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the corn field

loans.name: Kubanychbek

texts.en:
Kubanychbek is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  He is a resident of Ananievo, a small village near to Isykul Lake in the north of Kyrgyzstan.  

In order to earn money, Kubanychbek cultivates agricultural products. He started this activity five years ago with an initial investment of 7,000 soms. With that money, he purchased potato seeds and wheat for cultivation. Selling some part of the harvest, he earns about 6,800 soms to meet the family's needs. 

Kubanychbek is requesting a loan because he needs money to purchase 100 liters of fuel and 100 packs of hay and to pay for tractor driver services. In the future, he  wants to provide his sons with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and potato seeds and to pay for tractor driver services.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 54 years old and married with nine children. Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for a year and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergents, soaps and other groceries. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is married and blessed with one child. For the last three years, he has operated a motorbike transport business to make a living. Over the next five years, he wants to expand his business. 

George is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to service his motorbike. He dreams of becoming more financially stable in future.

loans.use: to service his motorbike.

loans.name: Nabangala Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nabangala Group in Western Kenya! Patrick is the facilitator of the Nabangala group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Patrick takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Patrick had a very good maize yield harvesting 22 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Patrick was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Patrick and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Patrick will educate his children, ensure food security for his family, and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Nabangala group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mukewa A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Mukewa A SHG Group in Western Kenya! Alice is the facilitator of the Mukewa A SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Alice takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Alice was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Alice will educate her children, ensure food security for her family, and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Mukewa A SHG group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 3  filhos, 2 dos quais  frequentam a Escola e o outro ainda é bebé. Fez a 5ª classe e não continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta sua mãe que vive com ela. 

É negociante ha mais de 8 anos vende produtos de primeira necessidade e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa (areia, cimento, pedra, barrotes, ferro e outros). 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende terminar a obra da sua casa e comprar uma viatura para auxiliar no transporte da sua mercadoria, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Rosa was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school, while the other is still a baby. She went to school through the fifth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own home with her family, and also supports her mother, who lives with them.
She's had a business selling staple goods for more than 8 years and earns about 6,500 meticals a month. She uses her income for household expenses and is able to save a small amount in her bank account (BIM).
She's never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her first loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, beams, iron, etc.) to build her house.
She is committed to paying off this loan and in the future hopes to request further loans from Hluvuku to finish the work on her house and buy a car to help her transport her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, beams, iron, etc.) to build her house.

loans.name: Paepaepuna

texts.en:
Paepaepuna is 18 years of age and is single. She is engaged in a sewing business, providing general clothing services to local community members.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.

Paepaepuna needs a loan of 1500 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Paepaepuna joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Paepaepuna's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Modeste

texts.en:
Modeste is 42 years old and married with eight children between the ages of 1 and 15 years old. He owns a business selling food and drinks such as milk, tea, cakes, biscuits, water, etc. He has been in this business for ten years and works from 6am until 11pm every day.

Modeste has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his restaurant by buying more food and drinks such as milk, tea, cakes, biscuits, water, etc. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and pay medical insurance for his family.

loans.use: to expand his restaurant by buying more food and drinks to sell.

loans.name: La Union (Flat) Group

texts.es:
La Union es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 8 personas alegres, amables y trabajadoras, cada una de ellas realiza una actividad economica para sacar adelante a su familia y tener cada dia una mejor vida, ellos viven en una zona cañera y la mayoria de los esposos se dedican al corte de caña en tiempo de zafra(cuando el ingenio azucarero esta en tiempo de producion).

La señora alejandra es uno de los miembros del grupo, ella tiene la edad 37 años, estudio hasta la secundaria y esata casada con el señor Dionicio, ella tiene dos hijos que asisten a la escuela en su comunidad. 

Doña Alejandra  platica que desde hace mas de 15 años inicio a trabajar vendiendo de todo un poco para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar, pero hace algunos años inicio a vender hamburgesas y hot-dog los fines de semana en el parque de una comunidad cercana, ella dice que gracias a Dios vende bastante y con el paso del tiempo ha hecho muchos clientes a los cuales les gusta mucho su comida, lo que mas le ayuda es que frente al parque esta la iglesia y al terminar la misa la gente le hace el gasto, ella se encuentra muy contenta porque su negocio esta progresando y esto le ayudara a poder dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
ella invertira este credito en la compra de  carne, lechuga, tomate, chiles, cebolla, pan y refrescos.
Ella nos dice que a futuro le gustria invertir en algunas mesas y sillas para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 

Los demas integrantes del grupo son:
florina manualidades
Alejandra venta de hot-dog y hamburguesas
 Odali venta de cosmeticos 
Silvia Venta de Antijitos Mexicanos
 Concepcion venta de cosmeticos 
Florencia venta de catalago 
Anabel venta de catalago 
Daniel taller mecanico 

NOta: Daniel no aparece en la foto pero sale su esposa
texts.en:
The Union is the name of a group made up of 8 happy, friendly, hardworking people. Each one of them has a job to get their family ahead and to make each day of their lives better. They live in an area of sugarcane production and the majority of their husbands make a living chopping cane during harvest (when the sugar mills are in a production period.)

Alejandra is one of the members of the group. She is 37 years old and studied until middle school. She is married to Dionicio and has two children that attend school in her community.   

Alejandra says that more than 15 years ago she began selling a little of everything to help her husband with household expenses, but several years ago she began selling hamburgers and hot dogs on weekends in the park of a nearby community. She says that thanks to God she sells quite a few and with the passing of time has made many customers who like her food a lot. What helps her the most is that the church is at the front of the park, and after mass people like to spend money. 

She has been very happy because her business is getting bigger and this will help her be able to give her family the best quality of life. 

She will put this loan towards the purchase of meat, lettuce, tomatoes, peppers, onions, bread and drinks. 

She told us that in the future she would like to invest in a few tables and chairs to give the best service to her customers. 

The other members of the group are:
Florina Manualidades
Alejandra: Hot dog and hamburger sales
Odali: Cosmetic sales
Silvia: Mexican antiques sales
Concepcion: Cosmetic sales
Florencia: Catalogue sales
Anabel: Catalogue sales
Daniel: Mechanic workshop

Note: Daniel isn't in the photo but his wife is.

loans.use: to buy meat, lettuce, tomatoes, peppers, onions, bread and drinks.

loans.name: Adriel

texts.es:
Adriel, de 64 años, es un hombre muy alegre y responsable, el es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene siete hijos mayores, vive en la casa heredada de sus padres junto a sus hermanos, sus hijos como ya son adultos tienen independencia, por ese motivo el vive únicamente con su pareja en la casa donde crío a todos sus hijos. El trabajo de Adriel es brindar servicio de vulcanizado a vehículos menores como motos y mototaxis. Tiene su taller instalado en su casa en donde también ha establecido su tienda de venta de repuestos en donde pone a la venta diversos artículos vehiculares como faros, rodajes, llantas, aros y espejos. Realiza labores como bajada de motor, cambio de rodajes, cambio de aceite, parchado de llantas entre otros. Ejecuta esta actividad desde hace 21 años y con ello pudo brindarles a sus hijos todo lo necesario para su crianza.
